loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia B. is 27 years old, married, and a mother with two kids. One is in school and the last born is breastfeeding. She has been a food vendor for a long time, through which she has supported her child who is in school. She prepares and sells rice with stew and cooked yams in Wasa Asamang in the western region of Ghana. She lives with her household and has this business. She also sells other foodstuffs such as sugar, "gari" (cassava grits), and rice in the marketplace of Wasa Asamang.

Lydia's food is a delicacy many Ghanaians enjoy every day either as breakfast, lunch or dinner, especially where she lives. Her business is doing well and she wants to expand her operations to serve more customers. With the loan, she wants to buy more rice, vegetables, "gari", and assorted meats for her operation and also hopes to use part to provide education for her kids. She hopes this loan will help her increase her savings to improve her family's well-being. She would be very grateful for your assistance. She belongs to the village bank called ‘God’s Time’. She hopes to receive GHS 500 to make business progress by adding to her inventory.

loans.use: To buy bags of dried maize grains, rice, vegetables, assorted meats, etc.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel sells provisions and drinks. Samuel needs the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. He is 40 years old and married with 2 children. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.fr: Mary D., 42 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Vélingara Foulbé depuis 1 an et demi. Son activité est la vente de produits divers dans une boutique. Elle veut acheter de l’huile, du lait, du riz, du poivre, des produits de lessive et autres pour renforcer son commerce. Ses revenus  vont lui permettent d’améliorer ses conditions de vie, de santé et la scolarité de ses enfants.  Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Mary D., age 42, is married and has three children to support. She has been a member of the village council of Vélingara Foulbé for a year and a half. Her work involves selling various goods in her shop. She wants to buy some oil, milk, rice, pepper, cleaning products, and more in order to boost her commerce. This income will enable her to improve her children's living conditions and health and their schooling. The loan she's requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her shop with various goods

loans.name: Sidaia

texts.en:
This is Sidaia E. from Balti town. She grows grains and vegetables for a living. She is married and has 2 children, but her husband left the country 5 years ago because of the family financial problems. He decided to go to another country with the hope that a free labor force, by comparison to Moldovo, would pay higher wages. E. remained in Balti with their 2 children so she could care for them.

E. decided to request a loan from MicroInvest to buy more seeds to expand her business. E.'s primary advantage is that her children are capable of helping her with the agricultural work.

loans.use: Buy seeds for her business

loans.name: Oumou Hawa

texts.fr: Oumou Hawa D., 53 ans est mariée avec 04 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Vélingara Foulbé depuis 2 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter du riz, des légumes, des poulets et des condiments pour renforcer son activité de restauration. Les repas sont vendus à la gare routière et à son domicile (sur une table). Ses revenus lui permettent  de prendre en charge les besoins familiaux en nourriture, santé etc. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Oumou Hawa D., age 53, is married and has four children to support. She has been a member of the village council of Vélingara Foulbé for two year and a half. She wants to buy some rice, vegetables, chickens, and condiments to bolster her food catering business. The meals are sold at the bus station and at her home (on a table). Her income enables her to meet family needs in terms of food, health, etc. She's requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice vegetables, chickens, etc. for catering

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. She sells books and is a LAPO client. She needs a loan of N100,000 to purchase more books to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more books to sell

loans.name: Evan

texts.en: Evan is 26 years old and married with 2 children. She is a hairdresser and sells hair cream and hair extensions. She needs a loan of N100,000 to purchase more hair cream and hair products to sell. She says thanks to kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase hair cream and hair products to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.es: Charles de 23 años de edad, es casado y  tiene una hijita de 4 años la cual está estudiando. Él es un hombre muy trabajador que siempre se ha dedicado a trabajar, da todo de sí en las labores que realiza, desde hace 4 años se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, es propietario  de un motocarro, con el cual se moviliza por las calles de su ciudad en busca de pasajeros, gustándole el conocer varios lugares y relacionarse con muchas personas, porque es muy amistoso y su gran carisma ha hecho que su servicio gane fama, siendo muy cotizado por las personas del lugar, lo que le es muy rentable. Charles administra su dinero separándolo para comprar cosas para su familia y para hacerle algunos arreglos a su principal herramienta de trabajo, porque él quiere seguir creciendo en el negocio del transporte y para ello tiene que tener en muy buenas condiciones a su moto. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP y le gusta mucho  trabajar con su grupo ya que son muy unidos. Con el dinero que solicita quiere comprar repuestos para mandar a reparar su mototaxi en lo que gastará un aproximado de1000 soles, y que gracias a ello pueda lograr mayores ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, el resto del dinero lo invertirá en pequeño taller de soldadura que atiende en sus ratos libres.
texts.en:
Charles is 23 years old, married and has a small daughter aged 4 who is already studying. He is a very hard-working man who has always devoted himself to his work and gives his all in the labours he undertakes. For the last four years he has worked transporting passengers, as he is the owner of a motor-bike which he drives through the town's streets looking for passengers. He likes knowing different places and interacting with many people, because he is very friendly and his great charisma means that his services have become famous, and he is much sought-after by people in the area. This means his business is very profitable. Charles manages his money, dividing it to buy things for his family and for making some repairs to his main tool of trade, because he wants to continue expanding his transport business and for that he need to keep his motor-bike in excellent condition. This is his 3rd loan with MFP and he likes working with his group very much, as they are all very united. With the money that he has asked for he wants to buy spare parts to make repairs to his taxi, which will cost around 1000 soles. Thanks to this he will be able to increase his income and improve his family's quality of life. He will invest the rest of the money in a small soldering workshop which he deals with in his spare time.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Catherine

texts.fr: Catherine S., 61 ans est mariée avec  02 petits fils en charge est membre du banc villageois de Vélingara Foulbé depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter des pourceaux, des aliments, des vaccins et améliorer l'abri pour son activité d'élevage et commerce de porcs. Ses revenus lui permettent de prendre en charge la nourriture et la scolarité de ses petits fils. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Catherine S., age 61, is married and has two young sons to support. She has been a member of the village council of Vélingara Foulbé for seven and a half years. She wants to buy pigs, feed, and vaccine, and to improve the shelter for her business in raising livestock and commerce in pork. Her income enables her to cover the costs of food and schooling of her young sons. The loan she's requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy, raise, and sell pigs

loans.name: Elda

texts.es: La señora Elda de 48 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su dos hijos, quienes la apoyan en todo lo que les sea posible. La casa donde viven es propia. Su actividad es la venta de ropa de segundo uso, la misma que lleva vender a un caserío que queda a dos días de viaje en lancha por el río Ucayali, siendo un trabajo muy sacrificado, por las largas horas de viaje que tiene que pasar trasladando su mercadería. Ella vende sus prendas al contado y a veces llega a hacer trueques, cambiándolos por algún producto como pan, plátanos, yucas, maíz, entre otros, para saciar las necesidades de su hogar. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 3 años atrás, gustándole su trabajo, ya que a pesar de ser cansado el viaje por el río tambíen la desestresa y la ayuda a soñar en un futuro mejor, al mismo que conoce otros lugares como caseríos cercanos. Su negocio le es rentable porque su ropa salen como pan caliente, cuando ella llega, todos sus clientes se acercan a observar las prendas que vende eso le da esperanzas de que en un futuro pueda llegar a tener una tienda de ropa. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP y le gusta mucho trabajar con su banco comunal. Invertirá la cantidad que solicita comprando ropa de segundo uso, además quiere incursionar en la venta de zapatos.
texts.en:
Elda is 48 years old and lives with her husband and two sons, who help her in every way they can. The house where they live is their own. Her business is the sale of second-hand clothes, which she also takes to sell at a hamlet which is two days journey by boat away on the Ucayali river. It's a very self-sacrificing job because of the long hours spent travelling and transporting her merchandise. She sells her garments for cash and sometimes by barter, exchanging the clothes for products such as bread, bananas, yuca and maize among other things. She had been doing this work for the last three years, and enjoys it, because although the journey by river is very tiring, it also de-stresses her and helps her to dream of a better future, as well as passing through other closer hamlets. Her business is profitable because her clothes sell like hot cakes! When she arrives, all her customers approach to observe the garments she is selling, which gives her hopes that in the future she may be able to have a clothes shop. This is her fourth loan from MFP and she likes working with her community bank very much. She will invest the money she has asked for in buying second-hand clothes: she also wants to try and sell shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata  Kandé, 25 ans est mariée avec 01 enfant  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Vélingara Foulbé depuis 4 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter  et revendre des  thioubs (tissus teintés). Aminata assure la dépense quotidienne chez  elle. Elle veut renforcer son commerce  pour avoir plus de revenus. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Aminata Kandé, age 25, is married and has a child to support. She has been a member of the village council of Vélingara Foulbé for four and a half years. He work consists in buying and reselling thioub (dyed cloth). Aminata ensures that the day-to-day expenses at her place are covered. She wants to boost her commerce to have more income. She's requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell dyed cloth

loans.name: Lita

texts.es: Lita tiene 33 años de edad, vive con su pareja y sus tres hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad en un pequeño ambiente dentro de su vivienda, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace un año, y cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos quienes la apoyan mucho. Lo que le gusta de su negocio es relacionarse con varias personas y hacer amistad con sus vecinos, quienes son sus principales clientes, además le es rentable porque en su cuadra es la única persona que cuenta con este tipo de negocio y le va muy bien. Posteriormente quiere llegar a tener su propio minimarket. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero solicitado comprará abarrotes, invertirá en ello la suma 800 soles, y el resto lo utilizará en la ampliación y ambientación del local de su negocio para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lita is 33 years old, and lives with her partner and her three children in their own house. She sells groceries and essential goods in a small space inside her home. She has been doing this for a year and relies on the support of her children who help her a lot. What she likes about her business is interacting with different people and building friendships with her neighbours, who are her main customers. Also, the business is profitable because she is the only person on her block who runs this sort of business and it is going very well. In the future, she'd like to have her own convenience store. This is her 4th loan with MFP, and with the money requested she will buy groceries, investing around 800 soles in this, and the rest will be used to expand and improve her business site in order to give her customers a warmer welcome.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her stock and improve her store-site

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Maimouna Y., 54 ans est mariée avec 08 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Vélingara Foulbé depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter du mil, du sucre, du pain de singe( fruit du baobab) et du bissap pour préparer des crèmes  glaces et de la bouillie de mil.. Son souhait est d’accroître ses revenus et soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Maimouna Y., age 54, is married and has eight children to support. She has been a member of the village council of Vélingara Foulbé for three and a half years. She wants to buy some millet, sugar, monkey bread (the fruit of the baobab tree), and bissap (dried hibiscus flowers) for making ice cream and millet porridge. Her wish is to grow her revenues and to help her husband with family expenses. She's requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell ice cream and millet porridge

loans.name: Dilion

texts.en:
This is Dilion R., and she is 33 years old. She has lived in the Cantemir district for more than 15 years, where she spent her childhood among her friends and family. She learned many things about agriculture from her father when she was young.

Her main business and plan for the future is growing vegetables and seeds. Dilion decided to request a loan from MicroInvest to increase her working capital after inheriting a large plot of land from her parents. R. has a good credit history at Microinvest, who has all the confidence in this customer.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos que son su razón de salir adelante cada día mediante su esforzado trabajo. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a brindar servicios de seguridad (vigilante) a diferentes instituciones, con lo que lleva ingresos económicos a su casa, aunque algo peligroso, es un trabajo estable. Adicionalmente, él y su esposa tienen un negocio de venta de comida, al cual, ella se dedica mucho más tiempo porque es quien cocina y lo administra, mientras José la apoya en lo que sea necesario durante sus momentos libres, así como sus hijos, quienes disfrutan de trabajar todos juntos porque saben que aportan para mejorar la economía de su hogar. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, José comenta que le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal, porque aparte de haber hecho buenos amigos y amigas, puede aprender e intercambiar ideas para la mejorar su economía, así como la guía de su asesor de crédito. Con el dinero que está solicitando quiere mandar a construir un Kiosco para el negocio de la comida, implementarlo con utensilios de cocina y todo lo necesario para su esposa, así invertirá 1000 soles. Con lo restante reparará el motocarro que tiene para usarlo en transporte y tener otro medio con el cual se genere ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
José is 40 years old and lives with his wife and his two children, who are his reason for going forward every day through hard work. For the last 5 years he has offered his services as a security guard (watchman) to different institutions, which brings in additional income to his house, and although its somewhat dangerous, it is a stable job. Additionally, he and his wife have a business selling food, to which she dedicates much more time because she cooks and administers the business while Jose helps her when necessary during his spare time, as do his children, who enjoy working all together because the know that they are contributing to improving the economic well-being of their home. This is his 3rd loan from MFP: Jose remarks that he likes working with his community bank because apart from having made good friends, you can learn and exchange ideas to improve your business, such as through the guidance of his credit assessor. With the money that he is asking for he wants to construct a Kiosk for the food business, installing kitchen utensils and everything else his wife needs: in this way he will invest 1000 soles. With the rest of the money, he will repair the motorcycle which he owns in order to use it for transport and have another means of generating an income.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Consturction of a kiosk and purchase of kitchen utensils

loans.name: Ghenghea

texts.en: This is Ghenghea I.. He is 56 years old. His business is growing grain and vegetables. He has a problem because the demand from his customers is very high but he does not have enough working capital to increase the quantity of his harvest. Now he is requesting a loan from MicroInvest and we hope that he will never have this same problem again. We hope this loan will help him to grow his business so that he can match supply with demand.

loans.use: To extend his business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos.  
Juana es casada, tiene 49 años, tres hijos de 19, 14 y  12 años, los menores están en la escuela estatal.
Ella estudio enfermería técnico, trabajo en el hospital en el área de los neonatos, la despidieron, puso un negocio de  pollos a la braza en sociedad pero le engañaron y perdió todo, se dedico a su casa, pero la animaron a que trabaje en  venta productos  de belleza por catalogo.   
Juana necesita un préstamo de  1200 soles, para  la compra de productos de belleza por catalogo.
Desde que comenzó en Finca, con los prestamos que brindan  puede invertir mas en su negocio, y recibe charlas de cómo mejorar su negocio.  
El sueño de Juana es tener su negocio de  venta de ropa
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Communal Bank 'Unidas Triunfaremos' ('United we will triumph').

Juana is married, she is 49 years old and has 3 kids who are 19, 14 and 12 years old. The youngest are in a state school.

She studied technical nursing and worked in the neonatal unit of the hospital, but was fired so started a business selling marinated chicken called 'pollo a la braza' in a society, but they tricked her and she lost everything. She dedicated herself to her home, but was encouraged to work selling beauty products from catalogues.

Juana needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy beauty products from catalogues.

Since she started out with Finca with the loans they have given her she has been able to invest in her business and go to talks about how to improve her business.

Juana's dream is to have her own business selling clothes.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Juana needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy beauty products from catalogues/Juana necesita un préstamo de  1200 soles, para  la compra de productos de belleza por catalogo.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés es socia del Bancomunal  Unidas Triunfaremos.
Inés es casada tiene 59 años, cuatro hijos 29, 28,26 y 16 años este ultimo en la escuela estatal.
Inés siempre se dedica a su casa, por que su esposo no quiso que trabaje y que cuide a sus hijos, y le apoye en el trabajo que él realizaba; Hace siete años  ella   empezó con una pequeña bodega “Diana” con pocas cosas, ahora gracias a los prestamos tiene un poco más surtida su bodega.   
Inés necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles,   para invertir en su bodega va comprar gaseosa, cerveza, azúcar, sal, arroz.  
Cuando entro a finca, ella no-tenia nada y gracias al préstamo que dan, pudo invertir y aumentar su capital. 
El sueño de Inés es que su  hijo el menor estudie una carrera que  sea un profesional, por que los demás no quisieron estudiar.
texts.en:
Ines is a member of the Communal Bank 'Unidas Triunfaremos' ('United we will Triumph').

Ines is married and is 59 years old with 4 kids who are 29, 28, 26 and 16, and the last one is at a state school.

Ines has always been in the house as her husband did not want her to work while looking after their kids, and he supported her with the work he did. Seven years ago she started a small grocery store called 'Diana', with a few things. Now, thanks to loans, she has stocked her store better.

Ines needs a loan of 2000 soles to invest in her store, and she is going to buy fizzy drinks, beer, sugar, salt, rice.

When she entered Finca she did not have anything and thanks to the loans they have given her she has been able to invest and increase her capital.

Ines' dream is that her youngest son would study a degree and become a professional, as the rest did not want to study.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ines needs a loan of 2000 soles to invest in her store, and she is going to buy fizzy drinks, beer, sugar, salt, rice./Inés necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles,   para invertir en su bodega va comprar gaseosa, cerveza, azúcar, sal, arroz.

loans.name: Ancelma

texts.es:
Ancelma es socia del Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos.
Ancelma es conviviente  tiene 44 años, tres hijos de 27, 26 y 15 años que esta en la escuela  estatal.
Se dedica a la venta de empanadas  en el verano y al tejido de chompas en el invierno, llevo un curso de repostería  ahora esta haciendo dulces y postres.  Desde los 17 años empezó a tejer con una señora que exportaba chompas, tejía una chompa  semanal. 
Ancelma necesita un préstamo de  1000 soles para hacer empanadas  y comprar harina, huevos, leche.
En Finca recibe apoyo con los prestamos que dan,  y orientación  con las charlas sobre negocio, en las reuniones del Bancomunal ha encontrado unión,  ha hecho amigas. 
El sueño de ancelma es poner una panadería.
texts.en:
Ancelma is a member of the Communal Bank 'Unidas Triunfaremos' ('United we will Triumph').

Ancelma lives with her partner, she is 44 years old and has 3 kids who are 27, 26 and 15 years old, and the youngest is in the state school.

She dedicates herself to selling empanadas (a type of pie consisting of filled tortilla dough which is then fried) in Summer and knitted sweaters and cardigans in Winter. She has been on a baking course and now is making sweets and desserts. She started to weave 17 years ago with a woman who exported sweaters, and she knitted a sweater a week.

Ancelma needs a loan of 1000 soles to make empanadas and buy flour, eggs, milk.

In Finca she receives support with the loans they give her and giudance with the business talks, and in the Communal Bank's meetings she has found unity and made friends.

Ancelma's dream is to have a bakery.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ancelma needs a loan of 1000 soles to make empanadas and buy flour, eggs, milk./Ancelma necesita un préstamo de  1000 soles para hacer empanadas  y comprar harina, huevos, leche.

loans.name: Yolanda Orfelinda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos.
Yolanda es viuda, tiene 50 años, tiene cuatro hijos, ya mayores,  él ultima es de 5 años y esta en la escuela estatal.
Hace 20 años empezó su negocio, despidieron del trabajo a su esposo y viajaron a  Chiclayo con su esposo donde aprendió hacer ceviche y comidas norteñas, cuando llego a Lima decidieron poner una picantería, Lamentablemente su esposo falleció hace 8 años y sus hijos mayores le ayudan en el negocio.
Yolanda necesita un crédito de 2600 soles, para la compra de cerveza, gaseosa, y reparación de los baños de su local.  
Gracias a los prestamos que les dio Finca pudo salir adelante e invertir, construyó su local para su picantería,  y en los pisos siguientes hizo su casa.
El sueño de Yolanda es seguir trabajando
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Communal Bank 'Unidas Triunfaremos' ('United we will Triumph').

Yolanda is a widow, she is 50 years old and she has 4 kids who are over 18, and her last one is 5 years old and is in the state school.

She started her business 20 years ago as her husband was fired from his job and they travelled to Chiclayo with her husband where she learnt to make ceviche (a raw fish dish) and northern foods and when she arrived in Lima they decided to set up a diner. Unfortunately her husband died 8 years ago and her eldest kids help her in the business.

Yolanda needs a loan of 2600 soles to buy beer, fizzy drinks and to do some repair work to the bathrooms of her diner.

Thanks to the loans Finca has given her she was able to move forward and invest, she built a store for her diner and on the upper floors built her house.

Yolanda's dream is to keep on working.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Yolanda needs a loan of 2600 soles to buy beer, fizzy drinks and to do some repair work to the bathrooms of her diner./Yolanda necesita un crédito  de 2600 soles, para la compra de cerveza, gaseosa, y reparación de los baños de su local.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian, vive en la calle Sargento Carrasco de la zona Ballivian, de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El es un joven emprendedor ya que con el primer crédito que le concedimos en Abril del año pasado adquirió una computadora y ahora el nuevo crédito que solicita será utilizado en la ampliación de su oficina, donde se dedica a la intermediación de puestos de trabajo, entre personas que buscan un empleo y personas que requieren empleados de distinto rubro, generalmente mano de obra.

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de una computadora y así mejorar la enseñanza en sus alumnos.
 
Es el segundo   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Cristian lives on Sargento Carrasco street in the neighbourhood of Ballivian, in the city of El Alto. He is a young entrepreneur who used his first loan, which we granted him in April of last year, to buy a computer. He will use this new loan to expand his business, an employment agency where he is the intermediary between people looking for work and people needing employees in different areas, usually labourers. He will use the loan to buy a computer and in this way improve his students' education. This is his second loan with Impro; our evaluation determined that he qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer for his employment agency

loans.name: Iris Mercedes

texts.es:
Iris es socia del Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos.
Iris es  viuda, tiene 62 años cuatro hijos de 32, 29, 24 y 22 años trabajan y estudian.
Su esposo se enferma de cirrosis  ella no sabia que hacer para salir adelanté, vio que pocas personas vendían velas, averiguo donde vendían fue a comprar y  mirando como hacia las velas, aprendió  y ahora también las hace, vende artículos de iglesia, en la iglesia de Barranco  Santísimo Cruz  ella tiene una mesita.
Iris  necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles, para la compra de parafina, para hacer velas, un millar rosarios.
Con los prestamos de Finca, pudo comprar mas mercadería, aprendió a ahorrar, a sacar su ganancia y saber cuanto gana, ahora sabe como invertir.
El sueño que tiene Iris es juntar su dinero para abrir un bazar.
texts.en:
Iris is a member of the community bank Unidas Triunfaremos. Iris is a widow; she is 62 years old and has four children aged 32, 29, 24 and 22 who work and study. Her husband fell ill with cirrhosis and she did not know how she would survive. She noticed that there were few people selling candles. She found out where candles were sold; she went to buy candles and watched how they were made. She learned and now makes her own candles, sells church articles: she has a small table in the Santísimo Cruz church in Barranco. Iris needs a 1,800 soles loan to buy paraffin, to make candles and to buy a thousand rosaries. With the loans from Finca, she has been able to buy more merchandise, has learned to save, to make a profit and to know how much money she makes; she now knows how to invest. Iris dreams of saving up her money to open a bazaar.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Iris needs a 1,800 soles loan to buy paraffin, to make candles and to buy a thousand rosaries.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar  se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Además trabaja como empleado en una mina aurífera en la misma provincia .
 
Vive. en la comunidad Vilaque de la Provincia Loa Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su esposa quien le colabora en los quehaceres del ganado y su hogar. 
 
El crédito lo destinará en la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2007.
texts.en:
Edgar raises cattle and sells the milk to PIL Andina (Milk Industrialization Plant). He also works in the gold mine of his home province. He lives in the community of Vilaque in the province Loa Andes, department of La Paz, three hours from the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife who works with him in all his chores, both with their livestock and with their home. He will use the loan to buy a milk cow and so increase his milk production as well as his income. This is his second loan with Impro, the evaluation we carried out determined that he qualifies for the loan. He has been an IMPRO client since 2007.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milk cow to increase his milk production

loans.name: Diana Del Pilar

texts.es:
Diana  es socia del Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos.
Diana es casada, tiene 38 años, dos hijos de 15 y 13 años que estudian en la escuela estatal. 
 Diana estudió cosmetología y cosmiatria, actualmente enseña en un centro educativo por las mañanas, tiene un salón de belleza que lo abre por las tardes. 
Necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles,  para la compra de una maquina cortadora de cabello y también para la campaña escolar, comprar zapato, maletines, cartucheras. 
 El sueño de Diana es abrir una escuela de cosmetología.
texts.en:
Diana is a member of the "Together we will Succeed" Community Bank. She is 38 years old and married. Diana is the mother of two children, ages 15 and 13, who are still in school. Diana studied cosmetology, and currently teaches a morning class in an education center and operates her beauty salon in the afternoons. She is requesting a loan of 2000 soles to purchase a hair-cutting instrument as well as school materials such as backpacks and pencil containers. Diana's dream is to open her own cosmetology school.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a hair-cutting instrument, as well as school supplies.

loans.name: Ada Luisa

texts.es:
Ada es socia del Bancomunal  Unidas Triunfaremos.
Ada es viuda, tiene 69 años, 9 hijos, él ultima tiene 35 años, todos son mayores y están casados. 
Ada tenia un negocio de confecciones, contaba con  ocho maquinas y la asaltaron llevándose sus maquinas, al tiempo puso un negocio de cabinas de Internet, tenia 25 maquinas, un día  a las tres de la mañana  los asaltaron con pistola y en un camión se llevaron todo. 
Hace un año puso una  bodeguita en su casa.
Desde que esta en Finca, gracias a los prestamos ha podido surgir y volver a poner su negocio de bodega.  
Ada necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles, para la compra de cerveza, gaseosas, azúcar y la compra de cuadernos para la campaña escolar.
El sueño de Ada es que cada uno de sus hijos tenga su negocio.
texts.en:
Ada is a member of the community bank Unidas Triunfaremos (Together we will triumph). She is a 69-year-old widow with nine grown and married children (the youngest is 33 years old). Ada had a sewing business with eight machines but she was robbed and the machines stolen. With time she built up a business of Internet booths with 25 machines but one day at 3am she was robbed at gunpoint and everything was stolen and carried away in a truck. A year ago she started a small shop in her home. Since she has been living in Finca, thanks to loans, she has been able to build up her shop business. Ada needs a loan of 2600 soles to buy beer, sodas, sugar and school notebooks. Ada's dream is that each of her children be able to build their own business.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer, sodas, sugar, and school notebooks

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo  se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). 
También  trabaja en la recolección de arena en un río cercano a su población; dicha arena la vende a comerciantes del transporte que compran para la  posterior venta en la construcción de viviendas.
 
Vive. en la comunidad Vilaque de la Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su esposa quien le colabora en los quehaceres de su hogar y cuidado del ganado. 
 
El crédito lo destinará en la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2007.
texts.en:
Leonardo works raising cattle, and he sells their milk to the PIL Andina (the Andean Milk Processing Plant). He also works in the collection of sand from a nearby river; he sells the sand to transport merchants who buy it to then sell for home construction. He lives in the Vilaque community in Los Andes, La Paz, Bolivia which is located about 3 hours from the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife who helps him with the household chores and in caring for their cattle. The loan will be used to purchase another milking cow to increase their production of milk and, by that means, their income. This is his second loan through Impro; his evaluation has helped to qualify him for this loan. He has been a customer of Impro since 2007/

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a milking cow to improve the amount of milk he produces

loans.name: Umc Primary School, Makump Bama Village Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the United Methodist Church Primary School, Makump Bama village (UMC). Makump Bama village is about five miles from Makeni city, the northern provincial headquarters. This school was founded in 1970 by the United Methodist Church to give education to the children of the community and to build up the church. It is the oldest school in the community and one of two schools in Makump Bama village. It currently has a population of 297 pupils and a staff of six teachers.

Many children from this village and the surrounding villages passed through this school. The school has a proud history; it has produced alumni who are teachers, lawyers, and many other professional workers. Some former students are currently in colleges and universities.

One major constraint the school is currently facing is the lack of adequate furniture, especially benches and desks. In 2000–2002, rebels made Makump Bama village a base. During their stay in this village, they used all of the school’s furniture as firewood.

Edward N. J. is the Headmaster of this school. Edward was born sixty years ago in Yoyema village in Moyamba district in southern Sierra Leone. He is married with four children and four dependents (nephews and nieces). Two of his children are already grown-ups and the other two are in tertiary institutions. The four dependents are still in school. Edward has been a teacher since 1970. With this loan, he will pay the fees for his two children who are in tertiary institutions.

loans.use: Pay fees for children in tertiary institutions

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es socia del Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos.
Elizabeth es conviviente tiene  37 años, tres hijos de 21,16 y 4 años, los menores están en la escuela estatal.
El esposo de Elizabeth es cocinero, y hace un año, ambos decidieron poner un negocio de restaurante - picantería “El Erizo” abren su negocio partir de las seis de la tarde. Por las mañanas ambos trabajan en diferentes oficios, Elizabeth  trabaja en limpieza publica para la municipalidad.
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de víveres arroz, fideo, papa, carne. 
Desde que esta en Finca,  recibe apoyo, charlas que la orientan de cómo llevar su negocio. 
El sueño de Elizabeth es poder traspasar su negocio a otro sitio, por que le queda muy pequeño.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a partner of the Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos (We Will Prevail United Communal Bank). Elizabeth is in a co-op. She is 37 years old, and has three children ages 21, 16 and 4 years old. The younger ones are in a state school. Elizabeth’s husband is a cook, and a year ago both of them decided to open a restaurant business of spicy foods called “El Erizo.” They open their business starting at six in the afternoon. In the morning they both work in different offices. Elizabeth does public cleaning for the city. She needs a loan of 1000 soles, to buy staples of rice, noodles, potatoes and meat. Since she’s been on the Co-Op, she receives support and consultations that teach her about running her business. Elizabeth’s dream is to be able to transfer her business to another site, because it’s still very small where she is presently.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Elizabeth needs a loan of 1000 soles, to buy basics: rice, beans, potatoes, meat

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos.
Nancy es conviviente tiene 30 años, dos hijos de 9 y  3 años que van a la escuela estatal. 
Ella no estudia por de desde niña siempre trabajo, le ayudaba a su mama a vender fruta, ahora ella alquila un puesto en el mismo mercado vende fruta  cada día compra por lote (10 cajas de fruta) trabaja de 7am hasta las 5pm.  
Desde que esta en Finca le va mucho mejor, tiene mas capital, aprendió a ahorrar. Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para poner un negocio de comida, comprar sillas, mesas, platos. 
El sueño de Nancy es tener un negocio propio de venta de comida.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the community bank "Unidas Triunfaremos" (United we will triumph). She lives with her partner, is 30 years old, and has two children, aged 9 and 3, who attend the state school. Nancy herself never went to school because since she was a girl she has always worked, helping her mother to sell fruit. Now she rents her own locale in the same market, selling fruit. Each day she buys stock of fruit (10 boxes) and works from 7am to 5pm. She has done well since aligning herself with Finca; she has more capital and has learned how to save. Nancy needs a loan of 1200 soles to build a food-selling business and buy chairs, tables and plates. Her dream is to have her own business selling food.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a food-selling business and buy chairs, tables and plates.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia vive en la calle Sargento Carrasco de la zona Senkata, de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia.
 
El crédito lo destinará en la reparación de su movilidad la cual su esposo  utiliza como herramienta de trabajo en el sector de transporte publico. Por su parte la señora tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende materiales de construcción. 
 
Es el segundo   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgar el crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2007.
texts.en:
Julia lives on Sargento Carrasco Street in the Senkata neighborhood in the city of El Alto, Bolivia. She lives with her husband and her children in their own home. The loan will be used to repair their vehicle which her husband uses in his work providing public transport. To contribute to the family income, she also runs a small store selling construction materials. This is her second loan through Impro; her evaluation qualified her to receive this loan. She has been an Impro customer since 2007.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance and repair of their vehicle for public transport

loans.name: Sackohoin

texts.fr: A. sockohoin habite le quartier d’adidogomé, elle a pour activité la vente de fripperie, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2001 et ce de faisant de façon ambulante, actuellemenent  elle a un petit stock, son objectif est d’agrandir son stock de marchandies et trouver une placve dans un marché et y dresser un étalage c’est pour cela qu’elle s’adresse à wages pour obtenir un crédit afin de financer son projet. Elle est divorcée de son mari et à deux enfants, son mari contribue partiellement à la prise en charge de ses enfants
texts.en:
A. Sockohoin lives in the Adidogomé district. Her work involves selling used clothing, towels, and the like. She has been in this business since 2001 and goes door-to-door in her work. Currently, she has a small inventory of merchandise. Her objective is to expand it and to find a spot at a marketplace for setting up a display. That's why she's enquiring with WAGES for obtaining a loan, so as to finance this project. She is divorced from her husband and has two children. Her husband partially helps with supporting the children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa  vive en la calle Manuela Gutierrez de la zona Tahuantinsuyo de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a su  esposo el cual trabaja como minero en una mina cercana a la ciudad, tiene un pequeño hijo de tres años de edad.
 
Se dedica al comercio de papa y tunta (tunta es un derivado de la papa, que tiene diferente sabor y color), los cuales vende en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de  materiales de construcción, como ser calamina para el techo, estuco y otros y así realizar mejoras en la habitación que  ocupa de vivienda.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Tomasa lives on Manuela Gutierrez Street in the Tahunatinsuyo area of the city of El Alto. She lives with her husband who works as a miner in a mine near the city. She has a three-year-old son. She works selling potatoes and tunta (tunta is a derivative of potato, which has a different flavor and color) in different markets around the city. This loan will be used to purchase construction materials, such as calamine for the roof, stucco, etc., with which she can improve her home. This is her first loan with Impro; an evaluation determined her eligible for credit.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for home improvements

loans.name: Ana Cecilia,

texts.es:
Siendo aun muy joven, Ana Cecilia a sus veintitrés años es la dueña de un puesto en el mercado donde maneja un negocio de venta de lanas, ropa, y productos de aseo personal. Este negocio le pertenecía en un principio a su madrina quien se lo dejo a cargo hace cuatro años, puesto que iba a emprender otro negocio en un distrito diferente. 
Antes, Ana Cecilia se dedicaba a ofrecer servicio de tejidos para terceras personas. Ahora solo teje cuando es temporada alta en la venta de tejidos. 
Ana Cecilia además de microempresaria es madre de familia. Se encarga de cuidar el bienestar de su  esposo y de su única hija de cuatro años. Las ganancias de su negocio las destina para cubrir algunos gastos de su casa. 
Su meta es abrir una tienda en la avenida principal de su localidad donde pueda vender en mucha más cantidad.
texts.en:
Ana Cecilia is twenty-three years old, and despite her young age is the owner of a stall in the market, where she is in the business of selling wool, clothing, and personal hygiene products. This business initially belonged to her godmother, who left Ana Cecilia in charge four years ago when she went to launch another business in a different district. Previously, Ana Cecilia made her living by offering a weaving service for third parties. Now she only weaves during the high season for selling woolens. In addition to running a small business, Ana Cecilia is also a mother. She is in charge of looking after the well being of her husband and their four year-old daughter. The profits from her business go toward covering some of their household expenses. Ana Cecilia’s goal is to open a store on the main thoroughfare of her community, where she would be able to increase her sales significantly.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing school supplies for the school term, and purchasing wool

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur habite le quartier d’adidogomé, il a pour activité le commerce de ciments, il a ouvert à cet effet un magasin pour y exercer son activité, actuellement les commandes qu’il reçoi sont supérieure à son stock en magasin, il sollicite alors un crédit pour pouvoir acheter des ciments aux points d’approvisionnement de la société de ciment du Togo CIMTOGO pour répondre à la demande. Il est marié et père d’un enfant. Ce qu’il fait comme activité l’aide à satisfaire aux charges
texts.en:
This gentleman lives in the Adidogomé district. His work involves commerce in cement. For this, he opened a store to carry out his work. Currently, the orders he's received are greater than what is stocked in his store. So he's requesting a loan to buy cement from a supply outlet of the Togolese cement company CIMTOGO, so as to respond to the demand. He is married and a father with a child. The work he does helps him to meet his responsibilities.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Micaela  vive en la calle Julio Venegas de la zona Bautista Saavedra de la ciudad de El Alto, en la casa cuyos propietarios son los padres de su esposo. Vive junto a sus hijos, su esposo trabaja en el interior del país. 

Ella posee una pequeña tienda de abarrotes y como segunda actividad se dedica a la confección de mantas de lana en pequeña escala.
 
El crédito lo destinará para la compra  de mercadería para su tienda (sodas, dulces, fideo, arroz, etc.) y así aumentar sus ventas.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para  otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Micaela lives on Julio Venegas Street in the Bautista Saavedra area of the city of El Alto. She lives in a house owned by her parents-in-law with her children; her husband works in the country's interior. She has a small grocery store, and also makes wool blankets on a small scale. This loan will be used to purchase merchandise for her store (sodas, sweets, noodles, rice, etc.) and thus increase her sales. This is her first loan with Impro; an evaluation qualified her to receive credit.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (sodas, sweets, noodles, rice, etc.) for a grocery store

loans.name: Epifanía

texts.es:
Epifanía tiene veintiocho años y a parte de su negocio, se dedica a la crianza de su único hijo de cinco años. Dentro de poco gozará también del nacimiento de su segundo hijo, por lo que por ahora no puede hacer mucho esfuerzo en su trabajo, aunque eso no le impide continuar con sus labores diarias.
Hace diez años que se vende verduras en el mercado, contando con un puesto propio. Epifanía cuenta siempre haber trabajado en este rubro. El puesto tiene en total tiene veinte años. Al inicio lo manejaba su mamá, mientras ella la ayudaba, pero se la mamá se lo dejó a ella ya que regreso a su pueblo natal.
En un tiempo futuro, quisiera agrandar su puesto para que el negocio progrese. Con las ganancias de su trabajo cubre los gastos de su casa junto con su esposo.
texts.en:
Epifanía is 28 years old, and apart from her business, she spends her time raising her five-year-old son. In a short time, she will welcome her second child into the world. Because of this, she cannot put too much effort into her job at the moment, but it doesn't impede her carrying on with her daily chores. For the past 10 years, she has sold vegetables in the market from a post she owned herself. Epifanía has always worked in this field. The post is now 20 years old. In the beginning, her mother managed it while Epifanía helped, but she left it to Epifanía when she returned to the village where she was born. In the future, she would like to expand the post so the business will advance. Her earnings, along with her husband's, cover their household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carmen R.

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa vive  en la calle Versalles de la zona Bautista Zaavedra en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
La señora es separada de su esposo vive junto a sus hijos menores.
 
Se dedica a la confección de mantas de lana de vicuña, alpaca y otros, las cuales  comercializa en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinará en la compra de insumos (lana)al por mayor y así disminuir sus costos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa lives on Versalles Street in the Bautista Zaavedra neighborhood in the city of El Alto, Bolivia. She is separated from her husband and still lives with her young children. She works making wool blankets, made from the wool of vicuña, alpaca and other animals, which she sells in various markets in El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase materials (wool) wholesale so she can lower her costs. This is her first loan through Impro; her evaluation qualified her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of alpaca and vicuña wool to manufacture blankets and sell them in the markets

loans.name: Diabou

texts.fr: Diabou D., 57 ans est mariée avec 08 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Saré Yéroyel depuis 5 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des produits comme des arachides, du sucre, du thé, du lait et autres. Elle veut renforcer son commerce. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Diabou D., age 57, is married and has eight children to support. She has been a member of the village council of Saré Yéroyel for five and a half years. Her work consists in buying and reselling goods, such as peanuts, sugar, tea, milk, and more. She wants to boost her commerce. She's requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in peanuts, tea, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia solo cuenta con el apoyo de los prestamos de EDAPROSPO desde hace un año; sin embargo, su negocio tiene ya veinte años en funcionamiento. Empezó vendiendo como ambulante cuando aún el mercado donde trabaja ahora no existía. Luego de cinco años se mudó y montó un puesto improvisado en el mismo lugar donde, tiempo después, se ubicaría el mercado que hoy en día acoge a muchas más trabajadoras como Julia.
Con el objetivo de obtener mayores ingresos, ya que el negocio de verduras ha bajado, quisiera conseguirse una carreta para poder vender paralelamente golosinas y bebidas en el mercado.
Por otro lado, su esposo se desenvuelve en cualquier trabajo cuando lo requieren, aunque se especializa en el rubro de construcción. Entre ambos cubren los gastos de su casa y de la educación de sus cuatro menores hijos.
texts.en:
Julia has only been involved with EDAPROSPO for one year, but has had her business for twenty. She began working as a street vendor when the market where she now works did not exist. After five years, she moved and started a shop in the same location where the market now stands and where there are many more workers like Julia.

In order to increase her income, since profits from her business selling vegetables have decreased, she would like to get a cart from which to sell sweets and drinks in the market. In addition, her husband takes on any work he can find, although he specializes in construction. Between the two of them, they cover their household expenses and the cost of educating their four young children.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tiles to finish off her home.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: El señor Jesús es albañil desde hace 2 años para una constructora, su esposa la señora Claudia lo apoya con los pendientes del hogar y lo motiva a salir adelante ya que son una familia muy unida y responsable, ahora el esta solicitando este préstamo para la colocación del vitropiso de su casa para darle un estilo diferente y mas cómodo.
texts.en:
For two years, Jesús has been a bricklayer for a construction company. His wife Claudia helps him with household tasks and motivates him to get ahead. They are a very close and responsible family.

Jesús is requesting a loan to install tile floors in his home. This will make the home more comfortable and will give it a different style.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of tile floor

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). 
.
 
Vive en la comunidad Guaraya de la Provincia  Ingavi del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a  cuatro horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su hija menor la cual le colabora en el cuidado del ganado y su hogar. 
 
El crédito lo destinará en la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Francisca works raising cattle and sells their milk through PIL Andina (the Andean Milk Production Plant). She lives in the Guaraya community in Ingavi, La Paz, Bolivia which is located about 4 hours from the city of La Paz. She lives with her small daughter who helps her take care of the cattle and their home. This loan will be used to purchase a milking cow to increase the milk production and, by that means, their income. This is her first loan through Impro; her evaluation qualified her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a milking cow to increase her milk production

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
M.
Empezó vendiendo como ambulante hace más de diez años. Ella ya tenía experiencia en la venta de frutas, es por eso que cuando le nació la idea de poner un negocio propio no dudó en dedicarse a la venta de frutas. Al inicio solo contaba con un puesto ambulante, donde además de frutas vendía también gaseosas. Poco a poco fue creciendo en mercadería hasta que adquirió un puesto propio en el mercado.
Ella es madre de tres hijos, una de veintitrés, el segundo de veinte y el último de tan solo cinco años. Ella y su esposo, quien es chofer de taxi, además de cubrir los gastos se ocupan de la educación y crianza de su menor hijo ya que los dos mayores ya son independientes económicamente. 
Hoy en día goza de bastante clientela y una buena ubicación en el mercado. Más adelante, le gustaría poner una tienda en su propia casa.
texts.en:
More than ten years ago, Santos began working as a street vendor. She already had experience selling fruit, and so when she got the idea to start her own business she immediately decided to sell fruit. At first, she only had a cart, from which she sold soft drinks as well as fruit. Little by little, her business grew until she got her own stand in the market. She now has a substantial customer base and a good location in the market. In the future, she would like to have a shop in her own home.

Santos is the mother of three children, ages 23, 20, and 5. She and her husband, a taxi driver, work to cover their household expenses and those of raising and educating their youngest child, since the older two children are already financially independent.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruit and soft drinks

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia se caracteriza por ser una persona muy alegre y emprendedora. Siempre ha ocupado gran parte de su tiempo en el manejo de pequeños negocios. Hasta hace un año y medio vendía raspadillas y chicha (bebida peruana) como ambulante, en un paradero de ómnibus y también por las tardes en una cancha deportiva. Este negocio solo le duró mientras la temporada de verano y primavera también durara. Luego de seis meses la venta de chicha y raspadilla ya no le fue rentable y tuvo que pensar en cambiar de producto. Una amiga cercana le aconsejó que preparara mazamorra para la época invernal, ya que el rubro de los postres generaba ingresos considerables.
Es así que desde hace un año y medio  vende mazamorras en la calle principal cerca de su casa. Como le fue bien en la venta de este postre, aún lo continua preparando y vendiendo. Ahora se dedica a ofrecer variedades de sabores para continuar también la preferencia de sus clientes.
Más adelante le gustaría tener una cadena de puesto de mazamorras, ese es su sueño a largo plazo. Por ahora se encarga de cubrir algunos gastos de su casa, junto con el apoyo de su esposo, y de la educación de sus dos hijos de diecisiete años y cinco.
Compra de materiales para techo de su casa
texts.en:
Lidia is known for being a very happy and entrepreneurial woman. She has always spent a good part of her time managing small businesses. Until a year and a half ago, she sold shaved ice and “chicha” (a Peruvian beverage) as a street vendor in a bus station and in a sports stadium in the afternoons. She only had this business for the spring and summer. After six months selling shaved ice and “chicha,” it was no longer profitable and she had to think of a new product. A close friend advised her to prepare “mazamorra” (a Peruvian pudding) for the wintertime, as selling desserts generates considerable income.

Since selling “mazamorra” worked out well for her, she has continued preparing and selling it, and for the last year and a half she has sold the dessert in the main street near her home. Now, she offers a variety of flavors to suit her customers' preferences.

Her long-term goal is to have a chain of “mazamorra” stands. For now, she and her husband are focused on covering their household expenses and paying for the education of their 5- and 17-year-old children.

Purchase of roofing materials for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of roofing materials for her home.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en: G. and his wife want  to grow pigs together. They have a room for the animals in the court house in the town of Orhei where they have their place of business, They will store the necessary fodder there. Now they decided to ask for a loan to buy food for the pigs. G. and his wife work together in caring for the animals. He does not have any experience in this field, and he is in the process of launching his business. This is his first loan with MicroInvest. The pigs will multiply, and then be sold in the neighborhood market. In the future, this client plans to increase the number of pigs to sell and also to raise a new breed of pigs.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig fodder

loans.name: Nila Amanda

texts.es:
Hace dieciocho años Nila empezó a trabajar vendiendo abarrotes al por mayor en un centro comercial. Estuvo dedicándose a ello por ocho años, hasta que el alquiler de su local ya no le era nada rentable. Por este motivo estuvo un tiempo sin trabajar, solo viviendo de los ingresos de su esposo, quien es obrero de construcción.
Tres años después, en el 2001, se animo a vender abrir una pequeña tienda en su misma casa. Una tienda de abarrotes que solo cumplió cuatro años hasta que se mudo de casa. Una vez que se mudo demoro dos años para reabrir su tienda, ay que no tenia el capital suficiente .
Ahora su objetivo es ir creciendo de a pocos en la medida de lo posible en su negocio. Por otro lado, también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace medio año. Ella es madre de cinco hijos, todos una dependientes económicamente. Felizmente cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo quien colabora con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Eighteen years ago, Nila began selling groceries wholesale in a shopping center. She did this for eight years, until renting her shop was no longer profitable. After closing her shop, she spent some time unemployed, living off the income of her husband, who is a construction worker.

Three years later, in 2001, she decided to open a small shop in her own home. She had this grocery store for four years until she moved. After moving, it took two years to reopen her shop because she did not have enough capital. Now, her goal is to continue to develop her business in whatever way possible. In addition, for the last six months she has sold cosmetics.

Nila is the mother of five children, all of whom are still economically dependent on her. Happily, her husband helps her cover household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Servando

texts.es: El señor Servando al igual que su esposa la señora Sara tienen un negocio propio de venta de hamburguesas llamado “Los 4 Vientos “, ahora que su clientela se ha incrementado desean invertir en su negocio adquiriendo mas producto para le venta de sus hamburguesas y tacos es por lo que están solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Servando and his wife Sara have their own hamburger stand called “The Four Winds.” They are requesting this loan because now that their customer base has grown they would like to invest in their business by purchasing greater quantities of the supplies necessary for their hamburgers and tacos.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal Capuli.
Elsa es soltera y tiene 27 años, Elsa tiene un restaurante llamado Don Augusto en un local alquilado, su negocio esta ubicado en una avenida concurrida, cuenta con 4 personas que le ayudan en la atención, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Elsa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Elsa son tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the Banco Comunal Capuli. Elsa is 27 years old and single. She has a restaurant called Don Augusto in a rented space. Her business is located on a busy street, and she has four employees to assist her in the restaurant, which is open every day. Elsa needs a loan of 1000 soles, which will be invested in purchasing rice and sugar. Elsa dreams of owning her own space for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Daniel,

texts.es:
V.
Daniel Vásquez es un padre de familia muy responsable y comprometido con sus dos negocios, uno de los cuales los maneja junto con su esposa: su restaurante. El restaurante ya tiene quince años aproximadamente. La idea nació de su esposa quien preocupada por el mantenimiento del hogar y la crianza de su hija mayor, que en ese entonces tenia solo dos años, vio la necesidad de contar con más de un ingreso en la familia.
Por otro lado, Daniel, dedica gran parte de su tiempo en la fabricación de ladrillos de adobe. El dice haberle dedicado toda su vida a este negocio ya que su familia cuando era pequeño manejaban un negocio igual. Hasta que él creció, se casó e independizó construyendo un pequeño taller en el patio de su casa.
Mas adelante sus planes son el de construir habitaciones para alquilarlos y mejorar el local de su restaurante.
texts.en:
Daniel V. is a responsible family father who is dedicated to his two businesses, one of which he runs with his wife: their restaurant, which they've had for about 15 years. The restaurant was his wife's idea because she had been concerned about their household income and raising their oldest daughter who was then just two years old. She saw the need to rely on a second income for their family. At the same time, Daniel spends a great deal of his time manufacturing adobe bricks. He has worked in this business his whole life since his family ran a similar business when he was small. Once he grew up and married he built a small workshop in their home patio. In the future his plans include building rooms which they can rent and to make improvements on the restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina O. is 39 years old. She is married and has three children - one daughter and two sons. One of her sons is currently in the senior high school and the other is in the junior high school. Her daughter is in primary school. Faustina’s husband is a poultry farmer. Faustina also works to make some income to support her family. She and her family live in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Dormaa is an agricultural-dominated town. It is about a 45 minute drive from Sunyani, the regional capital. Faustina sells poultry feed. She procures the feed from big poultry feed dealers in Tema in the Greater Accra Region of Ghana. She sells it to poultry farmers in her community. Faustina has a storehouse where she stores and sells her goods. She has been in business for ten years. Faustina wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure poultry feed in bulk.

loans.use: To procure poultry feed

loans.name: Jhenny L.

texts.es:
Jenny, vive en la avenida Cívica de la zona Tejada Rectangular en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Está separada de su esposo, vive junto a su pequeña hija de y su madre en un pequeño departamento que su madre adquirió en anticrítico.
 
Se dedica al comercio de frazadas, edredones, zapatos y otros, los cuales adquiere en las ferias que existen en la frontera con el Peru y los vende en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinará en la compra de mayor mercadería, y así mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Jenny lives on Civica Avenue in the Tejada Rectangular neighborhood in the city of El Alto. She is separated from her husband and lives with her small daughter and her mother in a small apartment that her mother leases. She works selling blankets, comforters, shoes and other goods, which she acquires in the markets on Peru's borders and she sells them in the city of El Alto. This loan will be used to purchase more merchandise which will help her improve her income. This is her first loan through Impro; her evaluation qualified her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of blankets, comforters, shoes, and other products to sell in the markets of El Alto

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal Capuli.
Yolanda es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Yolanda vende calzados en un puesto del mercado 12 de abril, también viaja a ferias de la región 2 veces por semana y a diferentes fiestas, sus productos los compran en la ciudad de Lima.
Yolanda necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de calzados escolares.
Los sueños de Yolanda son surtir con mas productos sus negocios y tener un local estable.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the community bank Capuli. She lives with her partner, is 30 years old and has two children. Yolanda sells shoes from her locale at the "12th of April" Market. She also travels to regional fairs twice a week and to different festivals. She purchases her inventory in Lima. Yolanda needs a loan of 2000 soles, which she will use to purchase school shoes. Her dreams include providing a more varied inventory and to acquire a permanent shop location.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school shoes.

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Maimouna D., 37 ans est mariée avec 05 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Saré Yéroyel depuis 2 ans  Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des produits comme des arachides, de l’huile, du jumbo et du sucre. Elle veut renforcer son commerce. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Maimouna D., age 37, is married and has five children to support. She has been a member of the village council of Saré Yéroyel for two years. Her work consists in buying and reselling products, such as peanuts, oil, Jumbo (bouillon cubes), and sugar. She wants to boost her commerce. She's requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell consumables

loans.name: Martha Patricia

texts.es: La señora Martha es una mujer muy trabajadora, además de ser madre soltera de un joven ,que día a día le demuestra que hay que luchar y esforzarse para salir adelante. Ella labora para una institución de seguridad social con una antigüedad de 20 años. Poco a poco le ha ido haciendo mejoras a su vivienda, pero ahora tiene el proyecto de construir una barda para mayor protección de su hijo y de su hogar es por eso que esta solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Martha is a very hard-working woman and the single mother of one son for whom, day by day, she demonstrates that one must fight and make an effort to get ahead. She has worked for a social security institution for 20 years. Little by little, she has made improvements to her home. Currently, she has a project to build a wall to better protect her son and her house. It is for this reason that she requests this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall in front of her house.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Gullermina, vive en la calle Emeterio Cano de la zona 23 de Marzo en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a su hijo menor, su esposo trabaja en el interior del departamento.
 
Se dedica a la confección de mantas de Lana las cuales vende en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinará en la compra de insumos (lana e hilo) al por mayor y así disminuir sus costos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Guillermina lives on Emeterio Cano Street in the March 23 neighborhood in the city of El Alto, Bolivia. She lives with her small son while her husband works in the interior part of the province. She works manufacturing wool blankets which she sells in the different markets of El Alto. This loan will be used to purchase materials (wool and thread) wholesale to decrease her expenses. This is her first loan through Impro; her evaluation qualified her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool and thread to manufacture wool blankets

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth F. is 37 years old. She is married and has two children - a boy and a girl. Both of her children are currently in primary school. Her husband works with a building construction firm in their community. Ruth lives with her family in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Dormaa is an agricultural-dominated town. It is about a 45 minute drive from Sunyani, the regional capital. Ruth sells crates of eggs to make some income to support her family. According to her, she procures the eggs from the poultry farms in her community. Ruth sells the eggs at the local market square, mostly to retailers. She has been in business for three years. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure more eggs. She hopes to help her husband improve upon their standard of living and to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy crates of eggs

loans.name: Ramatoulaye

texts.fr: Ramatoulaye C., 31 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Médina Diambéré depuis 2 ans et demi. Elle veut  acheter de la farine, du sucre, de la levure et de l’huile pour renforcer son activité de  vente de beignets. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ramatoulaye C., age 31, is married and has three children to support. She has been a member of the village council of Médina Diambéré for two and a half years. She wants to buy flour, sugar, leavening, and oil to bolster her business selling beignets (fritters). The loan she's requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell fritters

loans.name: Claire

texts.es:
Claire es socia del Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos.
Claire es casada tiene 5 hijos de 31,27,21,13 y 7 años, los dos últimos están en la edad escolar. 
Claire es de Iquitos no pudo terminar de estudiar por que salió embarazada, y se dedico a criar a sus hijos,  su esposo no quiso que trabaje, su esposo es profesor  renuncio al trabajo y con la liquidación  se compró un carro ahora él es taxista. 
Claire necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, los va invertir en su carro, va pasar por revisión técnica. 
Desde que esta en Finca, los prestamos le son de mucha ayuda. Económicas, las cuentas en el  Bancomunal son trasparentes, todo legal y encuentra unidad entre las socias.  
El sueño de Claire es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Claire is a member of the community bank Unidas Triunfaremos (United we will triumph). She is married and has five children, ages 31, 27, 21, 13 and 7. The two youngest are of school age. Claire is from Iquitos - she did not finish school because she became pregnant and dedicated herself to raising her children. Her husband did not want her to work outside of the home. He was a professor but left his job and with his settlement bought a car and he now works as a taxi driver. Claire needs a loan of 1200 soles, which she will invest in the car, which needs an overhaul. Since she has aligned herself with Finca, the loans she has received have been of great help. She has found them to be economical, transparent, and legal, and she has found a unity among the membership. Her dream is that her children enter into professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the car, which needs an overhaul.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos en Quechua.
Gladys es conviviente, tiene 29 años y esta esperando a su primer hijo, Gladys junto a su esposo tienen una tienda de venta de computadoras, accesorios de computadora, tarjetas de celulares, además brindan servicio técnico.
Gladys necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tarjetas para celulares.
Los sueños de Gladys son tener capital propio e implementar otro negocio que le genere mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the 'Llapanchik' Community Bank, which means 'everyone' in Quechua. Gladys is 29 years old, lives with her partner, and is expecting her first child. Gladys and her husband own a shop selling computers, computer accessories and cell phone recharge cards, as well as offering repair services. Gladys is seeking a loan of 1000 soles to purchase cell phone recharge cards. Her goals are to build up her own capital and start another business to generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cell phone recharge cards

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia S. is 39 years old. She is a married and has two children - a boy and a girl. Both of her children are currently in the primary school. Her husband sells eggs and she is a seamstress. Cecilia lives with her family in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Dormaa is an agricultural-dominated town. It is about a 45 minutes drive from Sunyani, the regional capital. Though a professional seamstress, Cecilia partners with her husband in the egg trading business to make more income to support the family. According to her, she procures the eggs from the poultry farms in the surrounding villages. She sells them at the local market square, mostly to retailers. Cecilia says she has been in this business with her husband for three years. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure more eggs. She hopes to help her husband improve upon their standard of living and to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy crates of eggs

loans.name: Fatou
