texts.fr: Fatou D., 31 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Médina Diambéré depuis 2 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des draps de lit. Elle veut  renforcer son captal. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fatou D., age 31, is married and has three children to support. She has been a member of the village council of Médina Diambéré for two and a half years. Her work consists in buying and reselling bed sheets. She wants to build up her capital. She's requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in bed sheets

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos en Quechua.
Norma es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Norma tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery garcía en donde vende flores variados, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 4 de la mañana.
Norma necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gladiolos, rosas.
Los sueños de Norma son salir adelante y darles una profesión a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the 'Llapanchik' Community Bank, which means 'everyone' in Quechua. Norma is 36 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children. Norma has a stall in the Nery García market where she sells a variety of flowers. She works in the stall every day starting at 4.00 am. Norma is seeking a loan of 2,000 soles to purchase gladioli and roses. Her dreams are to move forward in life and help her children to pursue professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase gladioli and roses

loans.name: Bertha Lucia

texts.es: La señora Bertha labora para una maquiladora durante toda la semana y el fin de semana trabaja como mesera en un  restauran – bar, su esposo es albañil independiente y su mama la señora Cecilia trabaja como secretaria de una oficina, ellos como una familia trabajadora están solicitando este crédito para la terminación de un  cuarto en construcción, es por lo que están solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Bertha works for a "maquiladora" [a bonded assembly plant set up by a foreign firm near the US border] during the week and, on the weekend, works as a waitress in a restaurant bar. Her husband is an independent bricklayer and her mother, Cecilia, works as a secretary in an office. They, as a working family, are asking for this loan to finish constructing a room.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish the construction on a room

loans.name: Haydee Maritza

texts.es:
Haydee se dedica a la venta de mazamorras como ambulante desde  hace tres años, siempre vendía en la puerta de un colegio cercano a su casa. Anteriormente a este trabajo  vendía comida a pensión eventualmente durante cuatro años, según las temporadas de trabajo de los obreros (sus clientes). Cambió de negocio ya que la venta de mazamorras le era mucho más rentable. 
Empezó vendiendo frutas, cuando era más joven, en un mercado grande de otra localidad, Sin embargo cuando se mudo de vivienda se dedico por un tiempo al cuidado de sus hijos, uno de trece años y el segundo de siete.
Más adelante quisiera tener una tienda en su casa. Por otro lado, su pareja es chofer de una empresa de transportes, con este trabajo él se encarga de mantener el hogar. Por el momento Haydee ahorra sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Haydee sells mazamorras (a puréed corn dish) door-to-door for the past three years, whereas before she sold from the door of the school near her home. Before that she sold food to boarders for four years, with business dependent upon the seasonal workers (her clients). She changed businesses since selling mazamorras is more profitable. She started by selling fruits, when she was younger, at a large market in another neighborhood - when she moved, however, she spent time taking care of her children who are aged 13 and 7. In the future she would like to have her own shop from her home. At the same time, her partner, a driver with a transport company, maintains the family household. For now, Haydee is saving her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies for their children.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas.
Margarita es casada tiene 65 años, cuatro hijos mayores  que trabajan y están casados.
Margarita trabajo vendiendo frutas, pero lo dejo por que la fruta no dura mucho se malogra rápido  hay  mucha perdida; entonces decidió vender  tubérculos y verduras papa, camote, olluco entre otros.
 Desde que Margarita  está en Finca su negocio está creciendo, quiere poner otro negocio va  alquilar un local para poner una bodega. Le gusta la trasparencia con que llevan las cuentas en el Bancomunal.
Margarita necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles para la compra de verduras, cebolla, papa y productos para la bodega que va abrir como, azúcar, harina, leche.
El sueño de Margarita es seguir trabajando, hasta donde las fuerzas se lo permitan
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the 'Avancemos Juntas' Community Bank, meaning 'together we advance' in Spanish. She is 65 years old, is married, and has four grown children who are all working and married. Margarita used to work selling fruit, however she stopped this because the fruit did not last long and decomposed quickly, leading to a lot of waste. She decided to sell root vegetables instead, such as potatoes, sweet potatoes and olluco (a vegetable similar to a potato). Since Margarita has been working with Finca her business has been growing, and she wants to start another business by renting a storefront and opening a small grocery store. She likes the transparency of accounts in the Community Bank. Margarita is seeking a loan of 3,000 soles to buy vegetables, onion and potatoes, and products for the grocery store she is going to open, including sugar, flour and milk. Margarita's dream is to continue working for as long as she is able.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy vegetables, onion and potatoes, and products for the grocery store she is going to open, including sugar, flour and milk.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos en Quechua.
Cirila es casada, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Cirila viaja a las ferias de la región 2 veces por semana, en donde compra quesos, cereales, papa, animales, productos que comercializa en el mercado Nery García.
Cirila obtuvo un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de haba, trigo y cebada.
Cirila sueña con sacar adelante a sus hijos brindándoles una buena educación, mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Cirila is a member of the 'Llapanchik' Community Bank, which means 'everyone' in Quechua. Cirila is 39 years old, is married, and has two children. Cirila travels to the regional market twice each week to buy cheese, cereals, potatoes, animals and other products which she then sells in the local Nery García market. Cirila will use her loan of 1,000 soles to buy broad beans, wheat and barley. Her dreams are to help her family move forward in life by offering her children a good education, and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase broad beans, wheat and barley

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata S., 44 ans est veuve avec 05 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Médina Diambéré depuis 2 ans et demi. Son activité est le commerce de pâte d’arachide et d’huile de palme. Elle achète des graines d’arachide pour les transformer en pâte d’arachide. L’huile est achetée puis revendu au détail. Elle veut  renforcer son captal. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Aminata S., 44, is a widow with 5 children for whom she is responsible. She has been a member of the village bank of Médina Diambéré for two and a half years now. Her business is selling peanut butter and palm oil. She buys peanuts that she processes into peanut butter. The oil is bought and then sold retail. She wants to bolster her capital. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single payment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: preparation and sale of peanut butter and sale of palm oil

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort Y. is thirty-seven years old. She is a married woman with four children: two boys and two girls. She says one of her children is currently in junior high school and two are in primary school. The last born, however, is too young to attend school.

Comfort lives with her family in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Dormaa is an agricultural dominated town. It is about a forty-five minute drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Her husband trades cereal, mostly maize. Comfort says she has been in this business with her husband for four years in an effort to make more income to support the family. According to Comfort, she procures the bags of maize from farmers in the surrounding villages and sells them at the local market square, mostly to food vendors.

Comfort is requesting a loan to increase her working capital, so she can procure more bags of maize. She hopes to help her husband improve their standard of living and give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: Procure more bags of maize

loans.name: Juana Elsa

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas.
Juana es conviviente tiene 36 años, tres hijos de 18 y 8, que están estudiando, y un último hijo de tres años.
Hace diez años se le presento la oportunidad de comprar un  puesto en el mercado, en la sección de carnes,  con los ahorros que tenia lo adquirió, ella vende carne de res, carnicería JHOANNA,  diario vende 20 kilos de carne.    
Necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de mercadería, mondongo, hígado, bofe.
Desde que está en Finca ha podido invertir más, su economía ha mejorado, su puesto era rustico lo ha mejorado, y se ha podido comprar dos puestos más, y  una maquina exhibidora.
El sueño de Juna es  comprarse una cámara frigorífica y una cortadora de carne.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Community Bank, "Avancemos Juntas" ["We Make Progress Together"]. Juana is a common law wife and is 36 years old. She has three children; two that are studying and are 18 and 8, and one that is 3. Ten years ago, Juana had the opportunity to buy a stand in the market in the meat section. With the savings that she had, she acquired the stand. She sells ground beef at Jhoanna's Butcher Shop and sells 20 kilos of meat daily. Juana needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy merchandise, tripe, liver, and lungs. Since she became a member of Finca, she has been able to invest more and her business has improved. Her stand was rustic and has improved, and she has been able to buy more stands and a display machine. Juana's dream is to buy a refrigerator and a meat slicer.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise, tripe, liver, and lung

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: El señor Jesús López y su esposa la señora Silvia tiene su propio negocio de venta de quesadillas, de nombre “ Quesadillas el Gallo “negocio que tiene fruto desde hace 5 años, aparte tiene un segundo ingreso ya que labora para un periódico reconocido de la ciudad. Ellos están solicitando este crédito para la inversión en su negocio, quieren extenderse y seguir creciendo para obtener mayores ventas.
texts.en:
Jesús López y his wife, Silvia, have their own business selling quesadillas. The business is called "Quesadillas el Gallo" and has been around for 5 years. Aside from this, Jesús has a second income given that he works for a well-known newspaper in the city. They are asking for this loan to invest in their business. They want to expand their business and continue growing to increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his quesadilla business

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Angélica es socia del Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas.
Angélica es conviviente, tiene 39 años, cuatro hijos, de 22, 19, 16 y 13 años, los dos mayores trabajan y los dos  últimos están en la escuela estatal.
Angélica  desde joven trabajo para mantener  a sus hermanos por  eso no pudo estudiar nada; tuvo sus hijos y se dedico a cuidarlos, pero la necesidad  era mucha   se puso a  vender verduras, no le iba nada  bien,   junto un dinero y  decidió cambiar de giro, puso una tienda  de abarrotes.  
Angelica  necesita un préstamo de préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, harina. 
Desde que está en Finca, ha crecido en el negocio, tiene más  capital y más mercadería, aprendió a no gastarse el capital, sacar su ganancia y ahorrar. 
El sueño de angélica es abrir otra bodega, y vender productos de buena calidad.
texts.en:
Angélica is a member of the Community Bank, "Avancemos Juntas" ["We Make Progress Together"]. Angélica is a common law wife and is 39 years old. She has 4 children- a 22 year old, a 19 year old, a 16 year old, and a 13 year old. The two older children work and the two youngest are in public school. Since she was young, Angélica has worked to support her siblings. For this reason, she couldn't study anything; she had children and dedicated herself to caring for them. But when it was necessary she began to sell vegetables, but nothing good was coming. With her money, she changed direction and opened a grocery store. Angélica needs a loan of 800 soles to buy rice, sugar, milk, and flour. Since she became a member of Finca, her business has grown and she has more capital and merchandise. She has learned not to spend the capital, but to take her earnings and save. Angélica's dream is to open another store and to sell high quality products.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk and flour

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Olga es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Olga tiene un restaurante llamado El Misquicha que Significa El Riquísimo en quechua, que se ubica en una avenida concurrida, Olga esta culminando sus estudios de Cheff y piensa implementar su negocio con la venta de comida china.
Olga necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, harina, menestras y sal.
Los sueños de Olga son comprar una casa, tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the Community Bank, "Tarpuy", which means sowing in quechua. Olga is married, is 35 years old and has 2 children. Olga has a restaurant called "El Misquicha", which means "the deliciousness" in quechua. The restaurant is located on a busy avenue. Olga is finishing her culinary studies and is thinking of beginning her business with the sale of chinese food. Olga needs a loan of 3000 soles to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, flour, vegetable soups, and salt. Olga's dreams are to buy a house and to have her own premises for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, flour, vegetable soups, and salt.

loans.name: Marlene Yolanda

texts.es:
Marlene es socia del Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas.
Marlene es casada  tiene cuatro hijos de 19, 14,8 y 6 años que están en la escuela estatal, y el mayor.
Marlene   puso una bodega en su casa, porque en la zona donde vivía no había bodega cerca, un día fue a comprar a la bodega que quedaba más cerca, pero quedaba  lejos, cuando volvió a su casa le habían robado. Hace cinco años   ella decidió poner una bodega - bazar en su casa, sus hijos atienden en la bodega. En las mañanas ella trabaja en el mercado,  su hermana le dejo en herencia, un puesto donde  vende plásticos y descartables.
Marlene necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, para compra de una fotocopiadora, para ponerla en su bodega, también quiere comprar servicios de cocina.
Desde que está en Finca, ha podido salir de las deudas en que estaba, con Finca aprendió a ahorrar, aprendió a llevar la contabilidad de su negocio, gracias a las charlas que recibe en  el Bancomunal.
El sueño de Marlene es ser mayorista  de plásticos y descartables.
texts.en:
Marlene is a member of the "Let's Advance Together" Community Bank. She is married with four children, ages 19, 14, 8 and 6 whom are still in school. Marlene opened a convenience store in her house because in her neighborhood there wasn't one near by. One day Marlene went out to to purchase supplies from a near by store and when she returned she discovered that her store had been robbed. Marlene has operated the store for 5 years with the help of her children. In the mornings, Marlene works in the market at a booth selling plastic and disposable container that she inherited when her sister passed away. She is requesting a loan of 3000 soles to purchase a photocopy machine and cooking utensils to put in her convenience store. Since she has joined FINCA, Marlene has been able to pay off her debts. Through the Community Bank's lectures, FINCA has helped her begin saving and using accounting techniques in her store. Marlene's goal is to be come a disposable container wholesaler.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a photocopy machine and cooking utensils

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio G. G., reside en San Martín, junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos. Hace ocho años que cuenta con una tienda, en la cual vende productos de primera  necesidad tales como cereales, pan, sopas entre otras más. José Antonio desea aumentar los productos de su tienda para que de esta manera logre obtener mayores ventas, las cuales le beneficien a su economía familiar. José Antonio sueña con ver que sus hijos continúen con sus estudios y logren ser personas profesionales en un futuro, es por ello que el solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda mejorar su negocio y de esta manera lograr mejores ingresos familiares los cuales beneficien a su familia.
texts.en:
José Antonio G. G. lives in San Martín, together with his wife and two children. He has had a store for eight years now, in which he sells basic necessities such as cereals, bread, and soups, among other items. José Antonio wants to add to the quantity of products in his store so that he can increase sales levels, which will benefit his family financially. José Antonio dreams of seeing his children continue with their studies and manage to become professionals in the future. It’s for this reason that he requests a loan, through which he will be able to improve his business. This will help provide greater economic stability for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the products in his business.

loans.name: Rosa Leny

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas. 
Rosa es casada tiene 47 años, dos hijos de 20 y 24 años que trabajan  y estudian. 
Rosa estudio secretariado pero no ejerció por que se caso.  Tenía un negocio de venta de fruta durante siete años, pero en la venta de fruta  hay pérdida por que la fruta se malogra rápido, decide cambiar de negocio hace ocho años, actualmente  se dedica a la   venta de  ropa de casa en casa, también ofrece  a sus amigas y vecinas.  
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para  comprar ropa en gamarra, y venderla.
Desde que está en Finca trabaja con un capital seguro, con confianza, en las reuniones del Bancomunal aprende de las demás socias, y le gusta la confraternidad que hay entre las socias.
El sueño que Rosa tiene es tener su propio negocio en su casa, quiere poner un bazar.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the "Let's Advance Together" Community Bank. She is 47 years old and has two children, ages 20 and 24 whom are working and studying. Rosa studied to be a secretary but never entered this line of work because she got married. For 7 years she owned a fruit business, but due to losses from spoiled produce she decided to shift lines of work 8 years ago. Currently, Rosa sells clothing door-to-door and to her friends and neighbors. She is requesting a loan of 1200 soles to purchase clothing in bulk and sell it. Since she has been involved with FINCA, she has had access to loans and confidence in her business. In the Community Bank meetings she enjoys learning from the other members, and enjoys the camaraderie. Rosa's goal is to open a business in her house, possibly a corner store.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk to sell

loans.name: Alicia Santa

texts.es:
Desde que cursaba sus estudios secundarios, Alicia se interesó por el arte de confección textil. Una vez que se caso empezó a trabajar en una empresa textil. Ella se encargaba de aplicar los bordados. Ahí aprendió mucho y cuando logro reunir un poco de capital se independizo.  
Ahora se decía a la confección y compostura de ropa en su propia casa, negocio que ya lleva diez años en funcionamiento. Y aunque le ocupa la mayor parte de su tiempo, Alicia aun no deja de asistir cada vez que la solicitan en la empresa donde continua haciendo bordados en temporadas altas de venta de ropa.
Parte de las prendas que confecciona por su cuenta las vende en un el mas grande centro comercial de Lima, gracias a una amiga pudo contactarse con algunos comerciantes del lugar. En el futuro le gustaría comprar una máquina remalladora para confeccionar más variedad de prendas de vestir y en mayor cantidad. 
Por otro lado, a veces también ofrece servicio de lavado de ropa en casas.
Ahora Alicia esta separada de su esposo, pero aun cuenta con la ayuda económica de él para cubrir gastos de la casa. Por ahora ella destina las ganancias de su trabajo para su casa y al a crianza de sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Since being enrolled in secondary school, Alicia became interested in the art of clothing making. At one time she worked in a clothing company where she was in charge of embroidery. There she learned a lot and was able to raise a little money and become independent.

Now she works in the manufacture and design of clothing in her own home business, a business that has already been in operation for ten years. And although this takes up most of her time, Alicia does not stop helping every time the clothing company requests that she continue doing embroidery in times of high clothing sales.

Part of the garments she made on her own are sold in the biggest shopping center in Lima, thanks to a friend who contacted some traders there. In the future she would like to buy a mending machine to make better quality and more varieties of clothing.

She also sometime she offers laundry services in her home.

Now Alicia is separated from her spouse, but she has financial help from him to cover household expenses. For now, she is using the profits from her work for her home and for raising her three children.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy textile for her clothing orders

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha  es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Bertha es casada, tiene 53 años y 7 hijos, Bertha vende pescado de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery García, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos con la ayuda de sus hijas.
Bertha necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescado jurel.
Los sueños de Bertha son techar el primer piso de su casa con material noble e implementar una tienda.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the "Tarpuy" Communal Bank which means "Sowing" in the Quechua language.

Bertha is married, is 53 years old, and has 7 children. She peddles fish in the Nery García, an activity that she carries out on Saturdays and Sundays with the help of her daughters.

Bertha needs a loan of $625 which she will invest in the purchase of mackerel.

Bertha's dream is to roof the second floor of her house with high quality material and to open a shop.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mackerel for resale

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
Bernarda es socia del Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas.
Bernarda es casada, tiene 49 años, dos hijos de 26 y 24 años que trabajan. 
Hace ocho años Bernarda vio que por la escuela donde sus hijos habían estudiaban no había librería, entonces ella decidió alquilar un local y poner una librería, se llama Librería  LUCY, empezó con pocas cosas, actualmente sus hijos le ayudan cada día.
Bernarda  necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para comprar útiles escolares, papel, cuadernos, lapiceros, de diferentes marcas. 
En Finca aprendió a través de las charlas  de negocio  cómo  administrar mejor su librería, le gusta la solidaridad entre las socias y ha hecho buenas amigas. 
El sueño de Bernarda es que el negocio crezca y dejar el negocio a sus hijos, y poner otro negocio.
texts.en:
Bernarda is a member of Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas. Bernarda is married, 49 years old, and has two children, 26 and 24 years old, who work. Eight years ago Bernarda noticed that there was no bookstore near the school where her children had studied, so she decided to rent a place and start a bookstore called Librería LUCY. She started with just a few things, and now her children help her every day. Bernarda needs a loan for 1000 soles to buy various brands of school supplies, paper, notebooks, and pens. At Finca, she learned from business talks how to run her bookstore better, she likes the support she gets from the members, and she has made good friends. Bernarda's dream is for the business to grow so she can leave it to her children and start a new business.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bernarda needs a loan for 1000 soles to buy various brands of school supplies, paper, notebooks, and pens.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es socia del Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas.
Elizabeth es del departamento de Iquitos, conviviente, tiene 35 años, dos hijos de 15 y 12 años que estudian en la escuela estatal.
Elizabeth trabajo desde los doce años, no estudio porque sus padres se separaron y se vino a vivir a Lima, el tiempo paso, y salió en embarazada  se dedico a cuidar a sus hijos; en las mañanas trabaja por años en un comedor cocinando, en Tablada de Lurín. Hace tres años trabaja por las tardes en un taller de carpintería junto con sus esposo, ella arma las cosas de madera mesas, sillas, el dueño del taller les permite que  invierten su dinero en el taller, es así como ellos sacan dinero extra, están comprando herramientas para abrir en un futuro su taller.
Elizabeth  necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles,  para comprar madera, cola, clavos entre otras cosas.
El sueño de Elizabeth es tener su propio  taller de carpintería con su esposo.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas. Elizabeth is from the Department of Iquitos. She is 35 years old, married, and has two children, 15 and 12 years old, who go to the public school. Elizabeth has worked since she was twelve. She did not go to school because her parents separated, and she came to live in Lima. After a time, she left, pregnant, to take care of her children. For years she worked mornings as a cook in a restaurant called Tablada de Lurín. For three years she has worked in the afternoon in a carpentry shop with her husband. She assembles things made out of wood, like tables and chairs. The owner lets them invest their money in the workshop, so they have been able to get extra money. They are buying tools to open their own workshop in the future. Elizabeth needs a loan for 1000 soles to buy wood, glue, and nails among other things. She hopes to have her own carpentry workshop with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Elizabeth needs a loan for 1000 soles to buy wood, glue, and nails among other things.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina Mintah is forty two years old. She is married with three children; a boy and two daughters. She says one of her children is in the primary school while the other two are in the junior high school. Regina lives with her children and husband in a family house, in a town called Dormaa Ahenkro, in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Dormaa is an agricultural center. It is about a forty five minutes drive from Sunyani, the regional capital. Regina’s husband is a commercial driver. She works very hard to support her husband in providing for the family. 

Regina is engaged selling in fuel; charcoal and firewood. She procures bags of charcoal from nearby villages and resells them in her community. Women, usually food vendors, use the charcoal and firewood for fires to cook their foods. Regina has been in business for two years. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure the fuel in bulk. She hopes to improve upon their standard of living and give all of her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Berta

texts.es:
Berta es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Berta es conviviente, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Berta tiene un puesto en el mercado Chorro en donde vendía fruta variada, pero como no le generaba muchas ganancias, alquilo el puesto y ahora viaja a las ferias en donde vende frutas y de las ferias compra cereales.
Berta necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de frutas variadas.
Los sueños de Berta son techar el segundo piso de su casa y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Berta is a member of the Tarpuy Communal Bank. In Quechua, 'tarpuy' refers to sowing the fields. Berta is married and has 4 children. She had a locale in the Chorro Market where she sold fruits, but since she did not earn much money from it, she rented it out. Now she travels to markets where fruits are sold and buys grains there. Berta needs a loan for 1200 soles that she can use to purchase fruits. She hopes to put a roof on the second floor of her house and wants her children to finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits

loans.name: Ines Jacqueline

texts.es:
Inés  es socia del Bancomunal  Los Claveles.
Inés es conviviente, tiene 31 años, tres hijos de 3, 9 y 12 años, estudian en la escuela estatal.
Inés vive en casa de sus padres, es allí donde su papa tenía un negocio de villar por cuatro años, pero cuando fueron llegando los nietos y creciendo vio que no era saludable para los niños, tuvo que cerrarlo y vender  todo  dándole el dinero a su hija Inés para que  empiece  un nuevo negocio. Inés  no sabía nada de negocio pero en Finca aprendió, como administrar su negocio es de bodega- bazar. 
Desde que está en Finca, ha sido una ayuda para su negocio, por las charlas que recibe, ha aprendido a ser responsable  y solidaria.
Inés necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de útiles escolares, cuadernos cartulinas, lapiceros, y compra de golosinas, galletas, chocolates, para la bodega.  
El sueño de Inés es surgir en su negocio, y dar mercadería de calidad.
texts.en:
Inés is a member of the Los Claveles Communal Bank. She is 31 years old and married. She has three children, 3, 9, and 12 years old, who go to public school. Inés lives with her parents. Her father had a billiards room in the house for four years. When the grandchildren arrived and started to get older, he realized that it was not a good environment for the children. He closed the business and sold everything, giving the money to his daughter, Inés, so she could start her own business. Inés knew nothing about business, but through Finca, she learned how to run a store. Finca's talks have helped her, and she has learned to be responsible and to work together with others. Inés needs a loan for 2000 soles to buy school supplies like notebooks, posterboard, and pens, and to buy sweets like cookies and chocolates for the store. Inés hopes to excel at her business and offer quality merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inés needs a loan for 2000 soles to buy school supplies like notebooks, posterboard, and pens, and to buy sweets like cookies and chocolates for the store.

loans.name: Renee

texts.es:
Renee es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Renee es soltera, tiene 28 años y 1 hijo, Renee vive en casa de sus padres en donde tiene una tienda, vende abarrotes en general, carnes, verduras, bebidas, también brinda servicio de fotocopiado.
Renee necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerveza por cajas.
Renee sueña con construir su casa y brindar una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Renee is a member of the Tarpuy Communal Bank. In Quechua, 'tarpuy' refers to sowing a field. Renee is single, 28 years old, and has one son. She lives at home with her parents where she has a store selling groceries like meat, vegetables, and drinks, and where she also offers photocopying. Renee needs a loan for 600 soles to buy beer by the case. She hopes to build a house for herself and offer her son a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beer by the case

loans.name: Dina Angelica

texts.es:
Dina es socia del Bancomunal Los Claveles.
Dina es casada tiene 39 años, tres hijos de 18, 13 y 7 años, el mayor está en la universidad y los menores estudian en la escuela estatal.
La mama de Dina empezó vendiendo plásticos y descartables por ocho años en el mercado  ella le ayudaba, cuando su mama se enferma deja de trabajar y le deja el negocio a su hija Dina, ella decide ampliar el negocio a una librería-bazar-regalos “ROGER”.  
Dina necesita un préstamo de 2200 soles, para la compra de útiles escolares, cartulina cuadernos, hojas.
Desde que está en Finca, los préstamos le han ayudado, a tener mas mercadería;  en su persona esta mas sociable, porque era tímida ahora tiene más amigas, le gusta las reuniones del Bancomunal por que se distrae.  
El sueño de Dina es terminar de construir su casa, que sus hijos sean profesionales, quiere comprar una fotocopiadora.
texts.en:
Dina is a member of Bancomunal Los Claveles. Dina is 39 years old and married. She has three children, 18, 13, and 7 years of age. The oldest is in college, and the younger ones go to public school. Dina's mother started selling plastic and disposable items at the market. For eight years Dina helped her, and when her mother got sick, she left her the business. Dina decided to expand the business into a bookstore and gift shop called "ROGER." Dina needs a loan for 2200 soles to buy school supplies, binders, and paper. Since she has been with Finca, the loans have helped her get more merchandise. She used to be shy but is more social now, and has more friends. She likes the Bancomunal meetings because they are fun. Dina hopes to finish construction on her house and see her children learn a profession. She would like to buy a photocopier.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Dina needs a loan for 2200 soles to buy school supplies, binders, and paper.

loans.name: Jose Edgar

texts.es: Don josé nació Cochabamba, una pequeña ciudad ubicada en el ra gión central del país, desde hace más de 15 años que radica en la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la Sierra, Bolivia. Actualmente lleva unos 10 años en el rubro del transporte público de pasajeros, durante los primeros años como chofer asalariado y desde los dos ultimos años como chofer propietario de un microbus y no hace mas de un año que ha adquirido la accion como socio del sindicato de transportes, casi todo su patrimonio lo a hecho con la ayuda de creditos en otras instituciones. Vive con su familia, tiene una hija y todos viven en la casa de su madre, es cliente nuevo en la institucion con muchas ganas de superacion.
texts.en:
José was born in Cochabamba, a small city located in the central region of the country. For more than 15 years, he has settled in the city of Santa Cruz de la Sierra, Bolivia. Currently, he has 10 years of experience in the area of public transportation of passengers. For the first few years, he worked as a salaried driver. For the past two years, however, he is the proprietor of a microbus. It’s been only one year since he acquired membership in a transportation syndicate. Almost all his personal assets have been obtained with the help of loans with other institutions. He lives with his family, has a daughter, and they all live in his mother’s house. He is a new client of the institution who has a great desire to supersede.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tires.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina es socia del Bancomunal  Los Claveles.
Valentina es casada, tiene 52 años, tres hijos de 23, 20 y 18 años, ellos están estudiando estudios superiores.
Valentina tiene trabajando en la venta de verduras hace 20 años, primero empezó trayendo de la chacra de Lurín de poquito, ahora compra en la parada. 
Desde que está en Finca ha aprendido a  invertir su dinero en su negocio y pudo construir su casa, para ella las reuniones en el Bancomunal son de edificación, se distrae, por que se encuentra con sus amigas, es un día muy esperado. 
Valentina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de verduras, sacos de papa, camote, cebolla, zanahoria.
El sueño de valentina es abrir un mini marqués en un nuevo local.
texts.en:
Valentina is a member of the Communal Bank Los Claveles. Valentina is married, is 52 years old, and has 3 children ages 23, 20, and 18, who are all in the midst of their higher education studies. Valentina has been working in the sale of vegetables for the past 20 years; she began by bringing small amounts from a small farm in Lurín, and now she buys her goods at La Parada, a wholesale market in Lima. . Since she has been part of Finca she has learned how to invest her money in her business and was able to build her house. For Valentina the meetings in the Communal Bank are edifying; she gets distracted because she meets with her friends, and as such the meeting days are always eagerly awaited. Valentina needs a loan of 2000 PEN to purchase general vegetables, sacks of potatoes, sweet potatoes, onions, and carrots. Valentina’s dream is to open a mini-mart in a new locale.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Valentina needs a loan of 2000 PEN to purchase general vegetables, sacks of potatoes, sweet potatoes, onions, and carrots.

loans.name: Luisa Julia

texts.es:
Luisa es socia del Bancomunal Los Claveles.
Luisa es casada tiene 63 años, tres hijos todos  mayores que están casados.
Luisa siempre se dedico a su casa, pero hace ocho años se animo a poner una bodega en su casa, empezó vendiendo gelatina, marcianos, galletas poco a poco fue comprando mas y mas cosas, hoy en día su esposo la ayuda.
Luisa necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles, para comprar gaseosa, arroz, azúcar, una vitrina exhibidora.
Con Finca pudo invertir más,  ahora su tienda D. abarrotes esta surtida, aprenD. mucho D. las experiencias D. las demás socias.
El sueño D. Luisa es seguir adelante y ayudar a sus hijos a que progresen.
texts.en:
Luisa is a Member of the Communal Bank Los Claveles. Luisa is married, is 63 years old, and has 3 older children who are married. Luisa always dedicated herself to her home, but 8 years ago she felt inspired to open a small grocery store in her home. She began by selling gelatin, popsicles, and cookies, and little by little she continued buying more and more things; nowadays her husband helps her. Luisa needs a loan of 2000 PEN to purchase soda, rice, sugar, and a display case. With Finca Luisa was able to invest more, and today her grocery store is well stocked; she learns a lot from the experiences of the other bank members. Luisa’s dream is to continue moving forward and to help her kids make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Luisa needs a loan of 2000 PEN to purchase soda, rice, sugar, and a display case.

loans.name: Elizabeth Teodora,

texts.es:
A sus treinta y dos años y con una hija de cinco años, Elizabeth maneja un negocio de comida desde hace un par de años. Gracias a su mamá pudo obtener una casa propia para ella y sus hermanas, donde actualmente vive con su familia. Como llevaba alrededor de cinco años vendiendo comida en un puesto ambulante que tenia, cuando obtuvo la propiedad de su casa no dudó en ambientar un espacio para abrir su restaurante.
Por el momento solo vende comida china y caldos a partir de las seis de la tarde. Con la ayuda de su hermana lleva para adelante el negocio con la idea de que un futuro pueda tener el capital suficiente para agrandar el local.
Ella cubre la mayoría de los gastos de su casa, pues su esposo no tiene un trabajo estable y solo aporta económicamente en el hogar por temporadas de trabajo.
 Compra de abarrotes e implementos  para su negocio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, a 31-year-old mother with a 5-year-old daughter, has been running a fast food business for a couple of years. Thanks to her mother, she was able to obtain her own house, where she and her family currently live, for her and her sisters. Because she had been selling fast food for around five years as a street vendor, she did not hesitate in setting up a restaurant in her own home as soon as she got it.

She only sells Chinese food and soup starting at 6pm for now. With her sister’s help, Elizabeth is moving the business forward with the idea that they will one day have enough capital to expand the business space.

She covers most of the household expenses because her husband does not have a steady job, so he is only able to earn income when he is employed.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food and supplies for business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda  es socia del Bancomunal Los Claveles.
Hilda es casada tiene 45 años, dos hijos D. 17 y 12 años que estudian en L. escueL. estatal.
Hilda es D. Trujillo, trabajaba en una fábrica D. mermeladas tuvo que dejar D. trabajar  por que sus hijos se quedaban solos en casa, hace cuatro años elL. empezó a vender ropa a sus vecinas y familiares, actualmente  tiene  clientelas que siempre le están pidiendo ropa.
Hilda necesita un préstamo D. 1800 soles, para comprar ropa pantalones, zapatillas, zapatos.
En Finca ElL. aprendió a cómo manejar su negocio gracias a las charlas que recibe en el Bancomunal,  aprendió a trabajar con empeño para conseguir sus sueños. 
El sueño D. Hilda es tener un puesto propio D. venta D.  ropa en el mercado.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the Communal Bank Los Claveles. Hilda is married, 45 years old, and has two children ages 17 and 12 that study in the state school. Hilda is from Trujillo and worked in a marmalaD. factory but had to stop working because her children were left alone at home. Four years ago she began to sell clothing to her neighbors and family members. Currently, she has clients that are always asking her for clothing. Hilda needs a loan of 1800 PEN to purchase clothing, pants, sneakers, and shoes. In Finca she learned how to manage her business thanks to talks they receive at the Communal Bank; she also learned to work with determination to fulfill her dreams. Hilda’s dream is to have her own clothing sales stall in the market.

Translated from Spanish by MarieL. Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hilda needs a loan of 1800 PEN to purchase clothing, pants, sneakers, and shoes.

loans.name: Reveca

texts.es:
Reveca es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Reveca es casada, tiene 32 años y 4 hijos, Reveca vende flores por mayor y menor de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Magdalena, además Reveca también se dedica a la producción de flores pero en menor proporción.
Reveca necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de remedios y abono.
Los sueños de Reveca son tener una florería en un local estable y brindar buenos estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Reveca is a member of the Communal Bank Tarpuy which means Harvest in Quechua. Reveca is married, 32 years old, and has 4 children. Reveca sells flowers wholesale and retail as a street vendor in the Magdalena Market. In addition, Reveca dedicates herself to flower production but in smaller proportion. Reveca needs a loan of 1000 PEN, money which will be invested in the purchase medications and fertilizer. Reveca’s dream is to have a flower shop in a stable locale and to offer her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase medications and fertilizer.

loans.name: Idomilia

texts.es:
Idomilia es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Idomilia es soltera, tiene 31 años y 1 hija, Idomilia tiene un puesto en el mercado de las Américas en donde vende ropa, calzados, actividad que realiza los días domingos, mientras los días de semana viaja a las ferias.
Idomilia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de calzados para escolares.
Los sueños de Idomilia son construir su casa y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Idomilia is a member of the Banco Comunal Tarpuy, which means "Sowing" in Quechua. Idomilia is 31 years old. She is single and has one daughter. Idomilia has a stand in the Las Américas market, where she sells shoes and clothing every Sunday. During the week she travels to the street markets. Idomilia needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will use to buy children's shoes. Idomilia dreams of building her own house and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy children's shoes

loans.name: Julia Elvira

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Bancomunal Los Claveles.
Julia es casada tiene 50 años, tres hijos de 29, 19 y 17 años que trabajan, estudian en la universidad.
Ella estudio administración de empresas, trabajo en una óptica por catorce años, dejo el trabajo por motivos personales; hace dos años  es directora de ventas de productos de belleza por catalogo, en la zona donde vive ella capacita  a mujeres para que vendan productos de belleza por catalogo,   
Julia necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles, para la compra de productos de belleza por catalogo, colonias, cremas entre otras cosas.  
Desde que pertenece al Bancomunal de Finca, ha sido una ayuda para incrementar su stock de productos de belleza por catalogo.  
El sueño de Julia es poner una óptica, porque ella trabajo por catorce años, y conoce el negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Bancomunal Los Claveles. Julia is 50 years old. She is married and has three children, 29, 19, and 17 years of age, who work and attend the university. She studied business administration and worked at an optician's for 14 years. She left that job for personal reasons, and for two years has been a director of catalog sales of beauty products in the area where she lives. She trains women to sell beauty products from a catalog. Julia needs a loan of 2600 soles in order to buy catalog beauty products, colognes, and creams, among other things. Ever since she joined the Finca Bancomunal, it has helped her increase her stock of beauty products. Julia's dream is to start an optician's shop, because she worked in one for 14 years and knows the business.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy catalog beauty products, colognes, and creams

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita M. D. M., resiD. en Lourdes Colón, departamento D. La libertad, junto a sus hijos y su esposo. Ella posee un pequeño negocio D. productos varias, tales como accesorios para bebés, collares, papelería y pan dulce, este último es  un tipo D. pan típico D. El Salvador, el cual lleva azúcar e incluso en algunos casos jalea. Margarita desea ampliar su negocio, es por ello que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual logre comprar muchas más cosas para su tienda y D. esta manera poder estar dentro D. la preferencia D. las personas aledañas a su negocio. Todo esto lo hace con el deseo D. brindarles una vida mejor a sus hijos y poder colaborar con los gastos del hogar junto a su esposo, ya que por el solo no da abasto con todo lo necesario para su familia, es por ello que es D. mucha importancia para Margarita mejorar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Margarita M. D. M. lives in Lourdes Colón, in the La Libertad department, together with her children and husband. She owns a small business of varied goods, carrying items such as baby products, necklaces, paper goods and “pan dulce”. Pan dulce is a traditional bread of El Salvador maD. with sugar and, in some cases, jelly. Margarita wishes to expand her business, which is why she is requesting a loan through which she will be able to purchase many more products for her store. In this way, she can attract customers from the vicinity of her enterprise. She does all this with the aim of providing a better standard of living for her children. She also does it to help her husband pay for the household expenses, since his earnings alone do not cover the family’s needs. These are the reasons why it is so important to Margarita to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more products for her general store.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Mariela Ines

texts.es:
Mariela es socia del Bancomunal Los Claveles.
Mariela es madre soltera, tiene 38 años, tres hijos de 16, 13 y 3 años, que estudian en la escuela estatal.
Mariela trabajaba en una tienda pero ganaba muy poco, decidió tener algo propio hace tres años tiene un negocio de maquinas tragamonedas, con un familiar que alquilo un local  actualmente tiene dos maquinas en el local. 
Mariela necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para comprar fichas, y premios para dar en su negocio, como  artefactos eléctricos.
Con Finca aprendió en las capacitaciones, como administrar su negocio, también aprendió de las experiencias de las otras socias, le gusta pertenecer a Finca por que ve que las cosas son transparentes, aprendió a ser responsable con los pagos y a no endeudarse.
El sueño de Mariela es tener una tienda de bazar-librería.
texts.en:
Mariela is a member of Bancomunal Los Claveles. Mariela is 38 years old. She is a single mother of three children, 16, 13 and 3 years of age, who attend public school. Mariela worked in a store but didn't earn much, so three years ago she decided to start her own business. With a family member she rented a space and at the moment has two slot machines installed. Mariela needs a loan of 1000 soles to purchase tokens and prizes to give out in her business, such as small electric appliances. Finca has trained her in running her business, and she also learned from the experiences of other members of her bancomunal. She likes belonging to Finca because she can see that there is transparency. She learned to be responsible with her payments and not to go into debt. Mariela's dream is to have a store for general merchandise and office supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tokens and prizes

loans.name: Juana Elena

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Bancomunal Los Claveles.
Juana es casada tiene 58 años, cinco hijos, los mayores están casados, los últimos hijos de 18 y 16 años estudian en la escuela estatal. 
Juana desde joven ha trabajado en casas, pero empezó a juntar su dinero y se compro embases de gaseosas, cervezas y también  compro golosinas,  empezó a vender en su casa, sus vecinas le animaban a que cada vez venda más cosas, fue así como fue creciendo  su bodega. 
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para comprar  sacos de arroz, azúcar, golosinas, gaseosa.
Desde que está en Finca con los préstamos y las charlas  que se dan en el Bancomunal aprendió a llevar el negocio, a separar el capital de las ganancias para poder invertir.
El sueño de Juana es tener una tienda de abarrotes  bien surtida.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Los Claveles Village Bank. She is 58, married, and has 5 children, the oldest of whom are married. The youngest children are 18 and 16 and go to public school. Juana had been working in houses since she was a child, but then she started saving up her money, buying cases of soft drinks, beer and candy, and selling them from her house. Her neighbors encouraged her to sell even more things, and so her grocery store grew. Juana needs a loan of 1600 soles to buy sacks of rice, as well as sugar, candies, and soft drinks. Since she's been with Finca, between the loans and the chat sessions her Village Bank offers, she has learned a lot about running a business, and how to use part of her earnings for investment capital. Juana's dream is to have a fully-stocked grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Juana needs a loan of 1600 soles to buy sacks of rice, sugar, candies, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel es una mujer muy activa. A sus treinta años no solo se dedica a la crianza de su única hija de doce años, ella, desde hace cuatro años vende ropa bajo pedido. No obstante, ese no es el único rubro en el que sabe desenvolverse. Eventualmente desde hace un año que también ofrece el servicio de cocina ayudando a cocinar a una señora para la venta de almuerzos a obreros de una fabrica.
El negocio de ropa nació a raíz de que el hermano de Maribel creciera en su negocio de confección de ropa en un centro comercial. Él se convirtió en proveedor de Maribel para ayudarse entre los dos. Aunque Maribel cuenta que también se abastece de ropa en otros puntos de venta, todo depende de sus pedidos.
Las ganancias que recibe de sus negocios las ahorra, para en un futuro poder tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Maribel is a very active woman. At 30 years of age, she not only raises her 12-year-old daughter, but she has also been selling clothing for four years. This, however, is not the only field she knows. For the past year, she has been helping a cook prepare lunches for factory workers. Her clothing business originated from her brother's clothing manufacturing business, located in a shopping center. He became Maribel's supplier to help them both. Although Maribel can also procure a supply of clothing from other outlets, everything depends on her orders. She saves the earnings from her business so that she may one day own her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes for school

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sulma

texts.es:
Sulma es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos en quechua.
Sulma es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, Sulma vende quesos que adquiere en la comunidad de Sachabamba que se ubica a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, sus ventas los realiza por mayor en los mercados.
Sulma necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos.
Sulma sueña con comprar su casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sulma is a member of the Llapanchik (which means "Everyone" in the Quechua language) Village Bank. She is 26 and has a common-law husband and one son. She gets cheeses from Sachabamba, which is 2 hours from the city of Ayacucho, and sells them wholesale in the markets. Sulma needs a loan of 2000 soles to invest in cheeses. She dreams of buying her house and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheeses

loans.name: Gloria Rita

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Bancomunal Los Claveles.
Gloria es conviviente tiene 34 años, un hijo de 1 año. 
Ella trabajaba con su mamá en la venta embutidos, pero su mama viajo a provincia  a Yauca y dejo de vender  ella se quedo con el negocio obtuvo más clientes, ahora su mamá le envía quesos  y aceitunas para que venda. 
Gloria necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para las compras de queso, aceituna negras y secas.
Desde que está en Finca aprendió el movimiento del negocio, aprende como las demás socias  invierten y usan estrategias, para mejorar su negocio, ve muchas mujeres esforzadas, y eso le anima mucho.
El sueño de Gloria es crecer más en el negocio, tener un puesto en el mercado y  personas que trabajen para ella.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Los Claves Village Bank. She is 34, and has a common-law husband and a one-year-old baby. She had been working with her mother selling sausages, but her mother has stopped selling and gone to the Yauca province, leaving Gloria with the business. She has gotten a lot of clients, and now her mother sends her cheeses and olives to sell. Gloria needs a loan of 1600 soles to buy cheeses, black olives, and sun-dried olives. Since she's been with Finca she has learned how a business operates. She's learning how the other members invest and strategize, so now she can improve her own business. She sees a lot of hard-working women, which really motivates her. Her dreams include growing her business even more, having a stand at the market, and hiring people to work for her.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Gloria needs a loan of 1600 soles to buy cheeses, black olives, and sun-dried olives.

loans.name: Marcia Leticia

texts.es: La señora Marcia Leticia tiene la edad de 35 años, habita en el barrio San Caralampio, junto a sus hijos,  se dedica a la agricultura y en tiempos que no hay producción se dedica a administrar su salón de belleza. Ya que tiene a su cargo dos pequeños que tiene que darle ala educación para que sean hombres de bien,  los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su hogar, y incrementar  su inventario,  doña Marcia. Esta obcionado a este crédito para invertir en comprar insumos agrícolas para mejorar el cultivo, para que de una buena cosecha y vender a buen precio al mercado y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Señora Marcia Leticia is 35 years old and lives in the neighborhood of San Carlampio, with her children. She works in agriculture and in seasons where there is no production she works in her beauty parlor. Since she is responsible for two small children who she wants to be educated in order to become good men, her plans for the the future are to better the living conditions of her home and increase her inventory. The goal of this credit is to invest in purchasing agricultural supplies to improve the cultivation of her crop, so that there will be a good harvest she can sell for a good price at the market and obtain better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides to improve her crop.

loans.name: Maria Flor

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos en quechua.
Maria es conviviente, tiene 26 años y 2 hijos, Maria vende quesos que adquiere en la comunidad de Sachabamba que se ubica a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, sus ventas los realiza por mayor en los mercados. Además compra animales que vende vivo en el camal de la ciudad.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos.
Maria sueña con que su negocio prospere y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Llapanchik (which means "Everyone" in the Quechua language) Village Bank. She is 26 and has a common-law husband, and two children. She gets cheeses from Sachabamba, which is 2 hours from the city of Ayacucho, and sells them wholesale in the markets. She also buys live animals that she sells to the city slaughterhouse. Maria needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she'll invest in buying cheeses. She dreams of having a prosperous business and seeing that her children get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheeses

loans.name: Nancy Edith

texts.es:
Nancy tiene tan solo treinta y cinco años pero todo un proyecto de vida casi realizado. Ella es madre de tres hijos, uno de diecinueve, el segundo dieciséis y el ultimo de ocho años. Hace un tiempo se encuentra separada de su esposo pero eso no es un obstáculo para el cumplimiento de sus metas personales.
Con la venta de quesos y carnes empezó adquirir cierta experiencia en el comercio. Luego de un par de años decidió asociarse con su hermano para abrir un taller de repuestos de carro. Ella Nancy tenia ahorrado un pequeño capital y su hermano aporto la experiencia en el rubro de mecánica. Hoy en día ya han cumplido tres años vendiendo repuestos. 
Con el fin de obtener un ingreso a aparte para solventar los estudios de Electricidad mecánica del mayor de sus hijos, Nancy no dudó en emprender un nuevo negocio, pero esta vez por su cuenta. Hace un año y medio ambientó un espacio de su casa  para abrir una pequeña bodega donde hoy vende todo tipo de abarrotes.
Más adelante, su meta es abrir junto con su hijo un a tienda de mecánica propia, para independizarse de su hermano y progresar más.
texts.en:
Nancy is only 35 years old, but has almost completed her entire life plan. She is the mother of three children--a 19-year-old, a 16-year-old and an eight-year-old. She separated from her husband some time ago, but this is not an obstacle to achieving her personal goals. By selling cheese and meat, she began to acquire some business experience. After a couple of years, she decided to partner with her brother to open a car repair shop. Nancy had saved a bit of capital and her brother contributed his experience in mechanics. Now, they have been selling replacements for three whole years. In order to obtain the funds to send her eldest son to school for electrical mechanics, Nancy did not hesitate to start a new business, this time on her own. A year and a half ago, she set aside a space in her house to open a small shop where she now sells all kinds of groceries. Later on, her goal is to partner with her son in their own mechanic shop to become independent from her brother and progress even further.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Giovana Jessica

texts.es:
Giovanna es socia del Bancomunal Los Claveles.
Giovanna es  madre soltera, tiene 38 años tres hijos de 13, 7 y 6 años, que están en la escuela estatal.
Giovanna es la mayor de cinco hermanos, por causa de la enfermedad de su papa, ella no pudo terminar de estudiar  se dedico a trabajar para sus hermanos, ella vendía lápices y lapiceros en los carros, hasta que conoció a Finca y con los prestamos pudo invertir cada vez más, ahora  tiene un puesto donde vende útiles escolares y cosméticos.
Giovanna necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de cuadernos, lapiceros, lápices, de diferentes calidades y marcas.
Desde que está en Finca aprendió a administrar su dinero, aprendió a ahorrar, aprendió a  ser amiga, ve como socias que no tienen nada,  ahora administran un negocio.
El sueño de Giovanna es  tener una librería grande.
texts.en:
Giovanna is an associate of the communal bank The Carnations. Giovanna is a single mother, and is 38 years old with three children who are 13, 7, and 6 years old who attend state school. Giovanna is the oldest of five brothers, and because of her father's ill health she could not finish school herself, instead working to support her brothers. She sold pencils and mechanical pencils in the streets, until she was introduced to Finca, an affiliate of Kiva . With the loans Finca gave her, she could invest more each time, and now is in a position where she sells cosmetics and school supplies. Giovanna needs a loan of 1200 suns, for the purchase of notebooks, mechanical pencils, and pencils of different qualities. Since she joined Finca, she has learned how to administer her money, how to save, how to be a friend. She sees associates that do not have anything and now administer their own business. Giovanna's dream is to have a large bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Giovanna needs a loan of 1200 soles in order to buy notebooks and pencils of different qualities.

loans.name: Frida Gloria,

texts.es:
Frida ha estado trabajando en el rubro de cosmetología toda su vida. De joven estudió para ser cosmetóloga, y tras finalizar sus estudios trabajó de empleada y ayudante en un salón de belleza, a modo de prácticas. Sin embargo, ella siempre había querido ser independiente, así que pronto empezó su propio negocio de servicios y artículos de belleza.
Hace cuatro años abrió su peluquería unisex en Huaycan, donde también vende varios artículos de belleza. Los préstamos que empezó a recibir de EDAPROSPO hace dos años y medio siempre los ha utilizado para invertir en su negocio, como también lo que le sobra de sus ganancias después de haber cubierto sus gastos personales, del hogar, y de la crianza de su hija menor. Sus otros tres hijos ya son mayores de edad y económicamente independientes.
Por lo tanto, a sus cincuenta años Frida, que es separada, está completamente dedicada a la mejora y ampliación de su negocio, y de esto quiere ocuparse en los próximos años.
texts.en:
Frida has been working in the area of cosmetology her whole life, having studied for this career when she was young. When she finished her studies, she worked as an assistant and employee at a beauty salon. Despite this, she always wanted to be independent and she soon started her own business providing beauty products and services. Four years ago, she opened her own unisex beauty salon in Huaycan, where she also sells beauty products. She has invested the loans she started to get from EDAPROSPO two years ago into the business. What is left over from her earnings, she uses to pay for personal and household expenses, and also for her young daughter. Her other three children are grown and financially independent. At fifty years of age and separated from her husband, Frida is completely dedicated to improving and expanding her business. She intends to occupy herself with this activity for upcoming years.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new supplies and expand her business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel es uno de nuestros clientes más antiguos de la institución, es una persona muy trabajadora y siempre se ha cracterizado por su responsabilidad y puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
Vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus hijos, todos ellos aun pequeños y en edad escolar.
La actividad a la que se dedica es la de transporte en motocicletas actividad en la cual trabaja hace unos tres años.
El Sr. está muy agradecido con  el microcrédito por que gracias a esto actualmente cuenta con sus herramientas de trabajo, que son sus medios de subsistencia y con lo cual mantiene a su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is one of the oldest clients of the institution. He is a very hard worker and has always characterized himself by his responsible and timely manner of paying his monthly loan installments. He lives in his own home with his wife and their children who are still young and in school. The activity he has dedicated himself to for the past three years is motorcycle transportation. He is very thankful for the microcredits because, thanks to them, he has tools for his work. This allows him the means by which to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a motor.

loans.name: Ligia Maria

texts.es: Doña Ligia tiene la edad de 40 años, reside en laureles sur, tiene dos hijos que estudian la primaria, su esposo trabaja junto con ella enana pulpería que tiene desde hace seis años que inicio con una liquidación de la empresa donde laboraba en la zona franca anteriormente. Sus planes es seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para que sea rentable y poder organizarse con su familia ya que su objetivo es poder terminar de construir su casa, a que a sus hijos reciban una buena educación. Afodenic le ha brindado la oportunidad para aumentar el inventario es por eso que da las gracias por las mejoras que ha hecho en su vida personal como en la inversión de su negocio esta es la sexta solicitud que va invertir en comprar productos variados como: productos enlatados, carnes, golosinas entre otros que cubra la necesidad y alimentación de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Doña Ligia is 40 years old and resides in Laureles Sur. She has two children who are in elementary school. Her husband works with her in a small local store which they have had for six years, since it began with a liquidation of the business in the duty-free zone where she worked previously. Their plans are to continue investing in their business so that it will be profitable and they will be able to organize their family. Their objective is to be able to finish the construction of their house and for their children to receive a good education. Afodenic, an affiliate of Kiva, has offered them the opportunity to enlarge their business inventory. This is their sixth request, and will be invested in buying various products like canned products, meats, and delicacies, among other things, that will cover the needs and diet of their clients.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy canned products, delicacies, and beef.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos en quechua.
Emilia es soltera, tiene 48 años y 1 hijo, Emilia venD. quesos que adquiere en L. comunidad D. Sachabamba que se ubica a 2 horas D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho, sus ventas los realiza por mayor en los mercados. Además compra animales que venD. vivo en el camal D. L. ciudad.
Emilia necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. quesos.
Emilia sueña con comprar un terreno para construir su casa y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Emilia is an associate of the Communal Bank Llapanchik, and which means "All" in Quechua. Emilia is single and 48 years old with one son. Emilia sells cheeses that she acquires in the community of Sachabamba, located two hours from the city of Ayacucho. Her sales are carried out wholesale in the markets. Furthermore, she buys animals that she sells to the city slaughterhouse. Emilia needs a loan of 1000 suns that will be invested in the purchase of cheeses. Emilia dreams of buying land to build a house and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: In order to buy cheese.

loans.name: Leoncia ,

texts.es:
Leoncia tiene un negocio D. venta especias y condimentos secos desD. hace un año y medio. Trabaja D. vendedora ambulante en el mercado D. Huaycan. Además arregla ropa bajo pedido, poniéndole botones y decoraciones.
Anteriormente trabajaba D. empleada en una tienda D. ropa interior, pero le era complicado tener que movilizarse tan lejos D. su casa y dejar a su hija todavía menor D. edad. Es así que intentó empezar un negocio que le dejara más tiempo para cuidar D. su hogar. Gracias a los préstamos D. EDAPROSPO que recibe desD. hace nueve meses ha podido salir adelante con su comercio.
Por otro lado, como otra entrada más tiene dos mototaxis que alquila, aunque a veces las usa uno D. sus tres hijos mayores D. edad.
Leoncia es casada y comparte con su esposo los gastos del hogar y D. la familia. Lo que le sobra D. sus ganancias las reinvierte en su negocio; a sus cuarenta y cuatro años está esperando poder seguir agrandando su negocio y quizás en un futuro tener su propio puesto en el mercado para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Leoncia has owned a business selling spices and dry condiments for the last year and a half. She works as a traveling saleswoman at the Huaycan market. She also mends clothing when requested and adds buttons and decorations.

Prior to this she worked as an employee in an underwear shop, but it was complicated for her to have to travel to so far away from home and leave her underage daughter alone. This is why she started a business that will leave her more time to take care of her home. Thanks to the loans she has received from EDAPROSPO in the last nine months, she has been able to move forwards with her business.

On the other hand, as another source of income she also rents out mototaxis, although sometimes they are used by one of her 3 children who are of age.

Leoncia is married and shares the household and family expenses with her husband. She reinvests what is left of her takings in her business; at forty-four years of age, she is hoping to continue growing her business and perhaps in future have her own stall at the market to sell her products.


Translated from Spanish by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in merchandise for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cynthia Iveth

texts.es:
Cynthia es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos en quechua.
Cynthia es soltera, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Cynthia vende papa por mayor, sus ventas los realiza en la ciudad de Ica a donde envía sus productos con su papa, la papa lo adquiere en su puesto del mercado Las Américas.
Cynthia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa.
Cynthia sueña con seguir ahorrando para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Cynthia is a partner of the Communal Llapanchik Bank which means “everything” in Quechua (native local language). Cynthia is single; she’s 25 years old and has one child. Cynthia sells potatoes primarily. Her sales are conducted in the city of Ica where she sends her products with her father. Her father gets a stand in the Las Americas marketplace. Cynthia needs a loan of 1000 soles that will be invested in the purchase of potatoes. Cynthia dreams of saving money to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes

loans.name: Luz  Magaly

texts.es:
Luz es socia D. Bancomunal Mujeres Progresando
Luz es soltera, trabajo como cajera para una empresa grande, por varios años, aprendió hacer anticuchos, parrilladas, participa  en los festivales gastronómicos  realizados por la municipalidad, D. distrito donde vive. Con sus ahorros hace ocho años  pudo alquilar un local donde puso una bodega, ella trabaja todo el día.
Desde que está en Finca, agradece por a los préstamos puede invertir, aprendió la importancia de ahorrar y ha ser solidaria.
Necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos para surtir su bodega.
El sueño de Luz es tener una casa propia, ella vive con sus padres.
texts.en:
Luz is a partner of the Bancomunal Mujeres Progresando (Communal Bank of Progressing Women). Luz is single and works as a cashier in a large business. For several years she’s learned to make grilled “anticuchos.” She participates in the food festivals held in her municipality in the district where she lives. With her savings from eight years ago she was able to rent a space to sell groceries and works all day long. Since she’s been in the Finca (co-op), she’s thankful for the loans she can use to invest, and for learning the importance of saving and to show solidarity. She needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy rice, sugar, milk, and noodles to supply her grocery store. Luz’ dream is to have a house of her own; she lives with her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Needs a loan of 1000 soles, to buy rice, sugar, milk and noodles to supply her grocery store.

loans.name: María Elena,

texts.es:
Invirtió en la mejora del terreno donde quiere construir su hogar, para poner desagüe.
Como su trabajo es bastante estable y no necesita mucha inversión María puede invertir los préstamos que recibe desde hace nueve meses de EDAPROSPO en la mejoría de su terreno y la compra de materiales para construir una casa para su familia. 
Anteriormente vendía dulces, durante cuatro años, pero desde que se repuso de sus dos primeros embarazos, hace tres años, empezó a trabajar como cobradora junto a su esposo que es chofer de combi. 
Las ganancias de su negocio de transporte las utiliza para cubrir los gastos de sus tres hijos de seis, cuatro y un año de edad, y para pagar las mensualidades de los préstamos.
A sus veintitrés años los planes de María de construir una casa en su propio terreno, para que sus hijos crezcan en un ambiente del hogar sólido y sereno, ya se están concretizando; así, ella puede visualizar un futuro mejor para su familia.
texts.en:
She invested in making improvements to the land where she would like to build her house, so she can add a drainage system. Since her business is very stable and doesn’t require much investment, María has been able to invest the loans that she has received from EDAPROSPO for the past nine months in improving her land. She has also used these to purchase construction materials to build the family’s home. She previously sold candy for four years. However, after recovering from her first two pregnancies three years ago, she started working in collections. Her husband drives a van. The earnings from the transportation business help to pay for the expenses of their three children, ages six, four and one, and to pay their monthly loan installments. At twenty-three years of age, María’s plans include building a house on her own land so her children can grow up in a safe, calm environment. In this way, she can visualize a better future for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She invested in making improvements to the land where she wants to build her house, so she can add a drainage system.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Giovanna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Giovanna es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Progresando.
Giovanna es casada tiene 38 años, tres hijos de 13, 10 y 7 años que estudian en la escuela estatal.
Giovanna  desde los doce años hacia tamales con su familia, cuando termino la escuela  estudio secretariado, se caso, tuvo sus hijos pero tuvo que dejar el trabajo  por no podía dejar solos a  sus hijos, nuevamente se dedico a la venta de  tamales los  vende  a fuera de una panadería por su casa,  semanal hace 600 tamales, cuenta con la  ayuda de  sus hijos.   
Giovanna necesita un préstamo de 2200 soles, para comprar una  cocina a gas, ollas, comprar maíz, especerías para la preparación de los tamales. 
Desde que está en Finca ha surgido más, aprendió a aprovechar las oportunidades de trabajo  cuando se presentan,  aprendió ahorrar y ha ser solidaria. 
El sueño de Giovanna comprar un carro con sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Giovanna is a member of the “Mujeres Progresando” (“Women Making Advances”) cooperative bank. She is married, 38 years old, and has three children ages 13, 10, and 7 that are studying at the state school. For the past twelve years, Giovanna has worked making tamales with her family. When she finished secretarial school, she married, had children, and had to leave her job to care for them.
