She then newly dedicated herself to making tamales, which she sells outside of a bakery near her house. With help from her children, she makes 600 tamales on a weekly basis. Giovanna needs a loan of 2,200 soles to buy a gas stove, pots and pans, corn, and other specialties needed for the elaboration of tamales. Since she has been with Finca she has made better progress, learning to take advantage of work opportunities as they present themselves and how to save. Giovanna’s dream is to buy a car with her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Giovanna needs a loan of 2,200 soles to buy a gas stove, pots and pans, corn, and other specialties needed for making her tamales.

loans.name: Hugo Edgardo

texts.es:
Hugo es socio del Bancomunal Mujeres Progresando.
Hugo es conviviente, tiene 54 años, tiene un de 28 años que es  soltero que trabaja con él.
Hugo empezó a trabajar a los diecisiete años, aprendió todo sobre mecánica, por que trabajaba en una empresa donde el manejaba maquinaria pesada, asfalto caliente, con sus ahorros pudo comprar su primer carro.
Hugo tiene un negocio de alquiler de carros, empezó comprando un carro y lo alquilo, actualmente tiene tres carros, su hijo le ayuda en el negocio.  
Hugo necesita 3000 soles, para la revisión técnica a sus carros y pintarlos.
Desde que está en Finca aprendió a ahorrar, los préstamos que ha pedido todo lo invierte en el negocio, porque quiere surgir más. 
El sueño de Hugo es llegar a tener diez carros y el administra su negocio.
texts.en:
Hugo is a member of the “Mujeres Progresando” (“Women Making Advances”) cooperative bank. He is married, 54 years old, and has a 28-year old son who is single and helps him with the business. Hugo started working at seventeen years of age, learning everything mechanical while at an enterprise working with heavy machinery and paving. He was able to buy his first car with his savings. Hugo has a car rental business, having started by renting out his first car. Currently, he has three cars and the help of his son. Hugo needs 3,000 soles for mechanical repairs and new paint for his cars. Since he has been with Finca, he has learned to save. The loans he’s requested have been wholly invested into the business because he wants to further succeed. Hugo’s dream is to get up to ten cars and managing his business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hugo needs 3000 soles for mechanical repairs and new paint for his cars.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
A pesar de haber tenido una vida muy difícil con la crianza de sus ocho hijos, Lorenza a sus sesenta y ocho años confiesa no tener otra opción mas que seguir adelante pues aun sueña con tener un estilo de vida mas estable económicamente. Poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo lo esta logrando.
Hace dos años Lorenza empezó con el negocio de alquiler de trajes y disfraces. Empezó rentando un local para su negocio un poco lejos de su casa, donde no duró más de medio año ya que la renta subió de precio. Luego de ello, estuvo un tiempo ofreciendo el mismo servicio en un puesto de una amiga suya en el mercado de su localidad; sin embargo, la dueña del puesto se lo reclamó, es por eso que decidió mudarse nuevamente de local. Esta vez consiguió un local más cómodo y cerca de su casa donde se mantiene hasta la actualidad.
Por lo pronto se encuentra creciendo en la variedad de trajes para el alquiler, no obstante su meta a futuro es conseguir un local ubicado en una zona mas comercial, y sobretodo poder pagarlo.
Por ahora, ella esta separada de su esposo, los gastos de su cada los cubre ella; además esta juntando dinero dentro de poco brindarle educación superior a su nieta de dieciocho años de quien es su apoderada.
texts.en:
Despite having led a very difficult life with the raising of her eight children, Lorenza, at sixty eight years of age, confesses that she has no other option than to forge ahead as she still dreams of a more financially stable lifestyle. Little by little, and with much effort, she is achieving this. Two years ago, Lorenza started a business renting suits and costumes. She began by leasing a site that was somewhat far from her house, a location that she didn’t last at for more than six months because they raised her rent. After this, she spent some time offering her goods from a friend’s stall at the market in her area. However, her friend then reclaimed her location, forcing her to move again. This time, she was able to obtain a more comfortable site closer to her home that she still has. She finds her supply of rentals growing, yet her goal for the future is to get a spot in a more commercial area that she can, above all, afford. For now, she is separated from her husband, and she must cover all her own expenses. In addition, she is saving money to provide an education for her 18-year old granddaughter, who she supports.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For her granddaughter's education and for the purchase of new suits.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Orestes

texts.es:
Orestes es socio del Bancomunal Mujeres Progresando. 
Orestes es casado, tiene 58 años, siete hijos el mayor tiene 33 años, y el menor 19 años que está estudiando, superior.
Hace años atrás Orestes trabajo en una carpintería metálica donde aprendió y con el tiempo alquilo un local y puso una carpintería metálica, empezó poco a poco  hoy en día Orestes tiene una carpintería metálica se llama  P..
Necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para comprar ángulos, planchas, fierros redondos.
En finca aprendió a que el dinero que tiene lo invierte en mercadería para que su negocio crezca, en las reuniones del Bancomunal ve ayuda mutua entre las socias, y le gusta el compañerismo.  
El sueño de Orestes es que su hija termine su carrera, y tener un local propi
texts.en:
Orestes is a member of the “Mujeres Progresando” (“Women Making Advances”) cooperative bank. Orestes is married, 58 years old, and has seven children. His oldest is 33 years old, and the youngest is 19 and studying. Many years ago, Orestes worked in a metal workshop where he learned everything about the trade. Over time, he rented his own space and started his own business doing the same. Things started slowly and, today, he has a shop called P.. He needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy angles, irons, metals. Through Finca, he learned to invest the money he has into his business to make it grow. At meetings of the bank, he sees mutual assistance among the members and he enjoys the companionship. Orestes dreams of his daughter completing her education and of becoming proprietor of his own location.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy angles, irons, and metals.

loans.name: Rosario Elizabeth,

texts.es:
Rosario, con veinticuatro años y madre de dos niños de cuatro y dos años, vende refrescos durante las tardes y todo el día los fines de semana en un puesto ambulante ubicado en una cancha deportiva. El negocio lo empezó hace medio años a raíz de que vio la oportunidad de vender refrescos a los jugadores que terminaban muy fatigados y con sed su jornada deportiva, un día cuando ella misma iba también a jugar algún partido.
Anteriormente estuvo vendiendo junto con su madre golosinas y abarrotes en una tienda, pero no duro mas  un año y  medio ya que no había mucha salida. En un futuro quisiera vender gas en su casa bajo consignación, no como una tienda, solo por pedidos ya que seria más rentable.
texts.en:
Rosario is twenty-four years old and the mother of two children ages four and two. Sells beverages during weekday afternoons, and all day on weekends, from a kiosk at a sports field. She started the business 6 months ago when she attended a game there, and saw the opportunity to sell beverages to the players who ended their matches very tired and thirsty. Previously, she sold snacks and groceries with her mother at a store. She didn’t do this for more than a year, due to lack of business. In the future, she would like to sell gas in her house on consignment. She’d rather sell based on orders, rather than as a store, as this would be more profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sugar and other supplies for her business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Blanca Obdulia

texts.es:
Blanca es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Progresando.
Blanca es casada, tiene 56 años, cuatro hijos de 28, 24, 19 y 17 años, loa mayores trabajan y los últimos van a empezar a estudiar.  
Blanca empezó vendiendo plátanos en un puesto alquilado, hoy en día  su puesto es propio su esposo, vende fruta de primera calidad, se levanta a las seis de la mañana para comprar en la parada, ella trabaja con su esposo todo el día. 
Blanca necesita 1800 soles, para la compra de frutas de la estación de primera calidad.
Desde que está en Finca, gracias a los préstamos pudo invertir y salir de las deudas que tenia.  
El sueño de Blanca es tener una casa propia y que sus hijos puedan estudiar.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the “Mujeres Progresando” (“Women Making Advances”) cooperative bank. Blanca is married, 56 years old, and has four children ages 28, 24, 19 and 17. The older ones are working, while the younger ones are studying. Blanca started out selling bananas from a rented location. These days, she owns her own site and sells high-quality fruit. She rises at 6 am to make her purchases at the street market. She works all day with her husband. Blanca needs 1,800 soles to buy high-quality seasonal fruits. Since she has been with Finca, she has thankfully had the loans to invest and to get out of the debt she was in. Blanca’s dream is to own her own home, and for her children to be able to study.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Blanca needs 1800 soles to buy high-quality seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Z. es padre de familia y tiene dos hijos para los cuales desea lo mejor para ellos. 
Don Carlos ya a tenido un crédito con FVP el cual pago puntual mente y lo utilizo para la construcción de un cuarto el cual le está haciendo falta los acabados de exterior e interior, por tal motivo nos está solicitando nueva mente un préstamo para llevar acabos la mejora y así tener terminada la recamara de sus hijos, que necesitan su propio espacio.
texts.en:
Carlos Z. is a head of household, and has two children for whom he wishes only the best. Carlos already has had credit with FVP, repaid by him in a timely manner, that he used to build a room in his house. This addition is still lacking some interior and exterior finish work, which is why he is again seeking a loan through us. He would like to finish the improvements that would complete his children’s bedroom, as they need their own space.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete interior and exterior finish work to an addition on his house.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nancy Delfina

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Progresando.
Nancy es casada, tiene 35 años, dos hijos de 14 y 3 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Nancy se dedica a la venta de tamales, es un negocio familiar, sus padres hacían tamales, ella creció viéndolos trabajar y a la edad de siete años ella ayudaba, actualmente ella y su hermano tomaron el negocio, tienen diez trabajadores, hacen dos mil tamales semanales. 
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles para la compra de maíz, hoja de plátano, achote, ajonjolí.
En Finca encontró gran ayuda gracias a los prestamos que realizan, pudo invertir y comprar varias cosas para su negocio, compro su cocina a gas, encuentra en el Bancomunal compañerismo, tiene muchas amigas.
El sueño de Nancy es crecer como micro empresaria.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the “Mujeres Progresando” (“Women Making Advances”) cooperative bank. Nancy is married, 35 years old, and the mother of two children ages 14 and 3 who attend the state school. Nancy dedicates herself to the sale of tamales, which is a family business. Her parents made tamales, and she grew up watching them work and started helping them at seven years of age. Currently, her and her brother have the business. They have ten workers and make two thousand tamales per week. Nancy needs a loan of 1200 soles to purchase corn, banana leaves, achote (annato, a spice), and sesame seeds. In Finca, she found a great deal of assistance thanks to the loans they helped her obtain. She was able to invest in her business and purchase a number of items for her endeavor, such as a gas stove. She finds companionship in the bank, and has many friends there. Nancy’s dream is to grow as a micro-entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Nancy needs a loan of 1200 soles to purchase corn, banana leaves, achote (a spice), and sesame seeds.

loans.name: Carmina

texts.es:
Después de una vida trabajando brindando servicios de casa, a sus cuarenta y ocho años y desde hace un año, Carmina se animó a abrir una tienda de dulces, abarrotes y gaseosas. Eso fue principalmente gracias a sus hijas que le aconsejaron que ya había pasado demasiado tiempo haciendo estos trabajos de casa que son muy exigentes físicamente y que a largo plazo le pudieran generar graves problemas de salud. 
Carmina ayuda su negocio y el de su cónyuge con los préstamos de EDAPROSPO desde hace ocho meses, y ambos juntan sus ganancias para cubrir los gastos del hogar y de sus dos hijitas de catorce y once años, juntos se encargan también de pagar las mensualidades de los préstamos.
En un futuro a Carmina le gustaría agrandar su tienda hasta convertirla en un mini-mercado, especializándose en todo lo que es gaseosas, cervezas y dulces, ya que estos son los productos con los cuales se gana más y a diferencia de los abarrotes, no se malogran. 
De cualquier modo, antes de invertir mucho más en su negocio quiere invertir en la educación de sus hijas, y cuando ya ellas hayan acabado de estudiar dedicar todas sus inversiones a su negocio.
texts.en:
After a life of housekeeping, a year ago, at the age of 48, Carmina opened a store selling sweets, groceries, and soft drinks. That was mainly thanks to her daughters, who advised her that she had already spent too much time doing physically demanding work in people's homes which could lead to long-term health problems. Carmina has supported her business and that of her husband through loans from EDAPROSPO for the past eight months. Both of them have pooled their incomes to cover the expenses of their home and their 14- and 11-year-old daughters. Together, they also make the monthly repayments on their loans. In the future, Carmina would like to expand her store into a mini-mart, specializing in soft drinks, beer and sweets, as these are the products she profits most from, and unlike groceries, they don't spoil. At any rate, before she invests much more in her business, she wants to invest in her daughters' education, and once they have completed their studies she will invest everything in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest part in her store, and the rest in her husband's recycling business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva  es socia del Bancomunal Avancemos Juntas.
Elva es casada tiene 36 años, tres hijos de 14,9y 4 años están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Elva  trabajaba en una fábrica y llegaba por las noches a su casa, sus hijos se quedaban solos empezó a tener problemas, en casa ella tuvo que renunciar quedándose sin trabajo.   Hace tres años no sabía qué hacer, empezó vendiendo dos cajas de cerveza con mucho temor de que no le compren, pero vendió todo, hoy en día se dedica a la venta de Cerveza en su casa.
Elva necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, para la compra de cajas de cerveza, de varias marcas, franca, Trujillo.
Desde que está en Finca, su negocio se ha levantado mas, vende más porque tiene capital para invertir, le gustas las reuniones del Bancomunal por que se relaja después de un día de trabajo.
El sueño de Elva es alquilar un local y poner un depósito de cerveza.
texts.en:
Elva is a member of the "Let's Advance Together" Community Bank. She is 36 years old and has three children, ages 14, 9 and 4, whom are still in school. Elva used to work long hours in a factory and arrive home late at night; this required her to leave her children home alone for long periods of time, which began to cause problems. As a result, Elva had to quit her job to stay with her children at home. Three years ago she didn't know what to do, so she began by selling two boxes of beer. Initially she feared that no one would buy from her, but she was able to sell everything, and today her primary occupation is selling beer from her house. Elva is requesting a loan of 1400 soles to purchase cases of beer of different brands. Since she has been involved with FINCA, business has improved; she sells more because she has the capital to invest in her business. Elva enjoys the Community Bank meetings because she is able to relax after a long day of work. Her goal is to rent a storefront and open a beer stand.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer to sell

loans.name: Jose Ernesto

texts.es: Don José tiene 52 años de edad, reside en laureles norte, sus hijos son independientes, su negocio es juegos mecánicos lo cual anda en departamento oh por todo el país, que andan recorriendo las fiestas patronales. Tiene veinticinco años que heredo de sus padres, el cual era su sustento para su familia,  esta es su quinta solicitud en Afodenic que es de mucho beneficios para la inversión de su negocio con este crédito va a comprar dos juegos mecánicos.  Sus planes es poder cambiar de motor a los juegos como pintar todos lo juegos para brindar un mejor servicios a sus clientes y seguir con la tradición y trabajo de su negocio.
texts.en:
José is 52 years old and lives in Laureles Norte. His children are independent. His business is mechanical toys, which can be found in his department and throughout the country, and during various celebrations. He inherited this from his parents 25 years ago, and it has provided a livelihood for his family. This is his fifth loan from Afodenic, whose investment has been very beneficial to his business. He will use this loan to purchase mechanical toys. He plans to change the toys' motors and paint them all, providing better service to his customers and continuing the tradition of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase mechanical toys

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Angélica ya lleva doce años con su negocio de pescado en el mercado de Huaycán. Con su esposo tiene un puestito, juntos trabajan e invierten en su negocio, y juntos cubren los gastos de su hogar. Los tres hijos que tienen ya son mayores de edad e independientes económicamente.
Anteriormente Angélica trabajaba en servicios de casa, además se ocupaba de la crianza de sus hijos cuando todavía eran menores. Sin embargo, a sus treinta y siete años y desde hace doce años, se animó a intentar formar un negocio propio, y le fue bien. 
Aunque en los últimos tres años, durante los cuales ha estado recibiendo los préstamos de EDAPROSPO, ha podido invertir más en su negocio. En un futuro le gustaría cambiar de comercio y en vez de un puesto de pescado en el mercado, tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Angélica has been selling fish in the Huaycán market for 12 years. She shares a post with her husband, and they work, invest and cover their expenses together. The three children they have are grown up and economically independent. Previously, Angélica worked as a housekeeper in addition to bringing up her children while they were still young. At the age of 37, however, and for the past 12 years, she has been driven to form her own business, and it has gone well. In the past three years, while receiving loans from Edaprospo, she has been able to invest even more in her business. In the future, she would like to switch from selling fish at the market to running a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in capital for fish business and cover some personal costs

loans.name: Eulalia Sindolfa

texts.es:
Eulalia lleva más de veinte años trabajando como vendedora ambulante de accesorios de carros, durante los días de la semana va con su triciclo por una avenida principal de su localidad y durante los fines de semana se va a provincia a vender en los mercados.
También, hace tres años empezó un negocio de tejidos bajo pedidos, esto con el fin de tener unos ingresos más para mantener  a su familia y cubrir los gastos del hogar.
A sus cuarenta y un años Eulalia todavía se está encargando de los estudios de sus tres hijos de veinte, veintidós y veinticuatro años, que, ella calcula, le ocupará sus inversiones principales durante unos cinco años más. Pero una vez que sus hijos estén todos con algún título de estudio, le gustaría invertir en una tienda para tener un puesto fijo donde vender sus accesorios de carro.
texts.en:
Eulalia has worked as a traveling car accessory saleswoman for more than 20 years. During the week, she rides down the main street of her neighborhood on her tricycle, and on the weekends she travels around the province to sell in markets. Also, three years ago she started a weave-to-order business in order to earn a better income to provide for her family and cover her household expenses. At 41 years of age, Eulalia is still encouraging the education of her three children of 20, 22 and 24 years of age. She estimates that this will constitute the bulk of her investments for the next five years. Once her children all have their degrees, she would like to invest in a store with a fixed location from which to sell her car accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in merchandise for her business, car accessories and fabrics for weaving

loans.name: Sosima Victoria,

texts.es:
Sosima ya lleva cinco años con su tienda de abarrotes, hace el mismo tiempo también que recibe los préstamos de EDAPROSPO. Anteriormente y por cuatro años, vendía verduras de ambulante en el mercado de Huaycán, pero se animó a empezar un negocio en un local, ya que estar por las calles todos los días ya se estaba convirtiendo muy peligroso para ella.
Aunque es soltera, Sosima junta sus ganancias con su pareja para cubrir los gastos del hogar, invertir en su negocio, y pagar los estudios de sus cinco hijos, una de los cuales todavía es menor de edad y vive con sus padres.
A sus cuarenta y ocho años ella espera poder, tras el cumplimiento de los estudios de todos sus hijos, seguir invirtiendo para agrandar su tienda y manejar un negocio más estable.
texts.en:
Sosima has had her grocery store for five years, the same length of time she has been receiving loans from EDAPROSPO. Before that, for four years, she sold vegetables walking through the market of Huaycán, but she decided to open a business in a fixed location because it was becoming too dangerous for her to continue being in the streets all day. Although unmarried, Sosima combines her profits with her partner to pay the household expenses, invest in her business, and pay for the studies of her five children, one of whom is still a minor and lives with her parents. At 48 years of age, she hopes to be able, because all her children will have completed their studies, to continue investing to expand her store and manage a more stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She invested in merchandise for her store, mainly in beer.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
La señora Adriana L. y su esposo el señor Esteban Evaristo tiene dos hijos a los cuales les quieren lo mejor para ellos. En esté momento se les presento un problema que tiene que pagar el semestre de la universidad de su hija pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero para poder liquidar la inscripción, es por eso que nos esta solicitando un préstamo,para poder  pagar la escuela de su niña y que pueda terminar sus estudios.
Planean pagar este crédito con los ingresos de su trabajo como cajera de un súper mercado, su esposo Don Esteban se dedica a la construcción.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adriana L. and her husband, Mr. Esteban Evaristo, have two children and they want the very best for them. Right now the family has a problem, they are not able to pay the university tuition for their daughter. This is why they are requesting a loan, to be able to pay for their daughter's schooling and so that she is able to finish her studies. They are planning to repay this loan with the income they receive from their jobs. Adriana works as a checker in a supermarket, and her husband Don Esteban works in construction. (Translated by Mariela of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for a university tuition

loans.name: Juan Roney

texts.es: El joven Juan tiene 28 años de edad, reside en laureles sur, su esposa le tiene un niño de 10 años, ella lava y plancha para ayudar con los gastos de su hogar ya que todo esta caro, el se desempeña de albañil y soldador desde hace quince años, inicio trabajando con su padre de donde aprendió de albañil, lo cual ahora lo ejerce por su cuenta propia para el sustento de su familia, con este crédito va invertir en comprar materiales de construcción para cambiar el techo de su casa que esta en mal estado y desea reparar ante del invierno, da las gracias Afodenic por que ha logrado hacer las mejoras a su casa de habitación. Sus planes a futuro es poder ayudar a su hijo que tenga una buena educación.
texts.en:
Young Juan is 28 years old, lives in Laureles Sur, and has a 10-year-old son with his wife. She washes and irons clothing to help cover their expensive household costs. Juan has worked as a mason and welder for 15 years. He started by working with his father, who taught him masonry, and now does it himself to provide for his family. This loan will be used to purchase construction materials to replace the roof of his house, which is in poor condition and needs to be replaced before winter. He gives thanks to Afodenic for being able to make improvements to his home. His future plan is to support his children in getting a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to replace roof of house

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es:
Dalila recién empezó, con su hija, su negocio de cabinas públicas de internet, solamente tiene dos meses.
Inicialmente tenía un taller de artesanías junto a su esposo, y así cubrían los gastos de la familia y del hogar. Lamentablemente su esposo se falleció bastante joven, y Dalila tuvo que encontrar otro trabajo. Empezó trabajando en servicios de casa, y luego vendió golosinas, chupetes, gaseosas y detergente como ambulante en Huaycán, su distrito, durante siete años. 
A sus cincuenta y ocho años se ha juntado a su hija para empezar con este negocio nuevo, y también cuenta en el apoyo ella para cubrir sus gastos de subsistencia. En el futuro, esta pensando  poner una vitrina de golosinas en la tienda de Internet.
texts.en:
Dalila started an internet cafe with her daughter just two months ago. Initially, she had an handicrafts workshop with her husband, which they used to cover their family expenses. Unfortunately, her husband died quite young, and Dalila had to find another job. Over the past seven years, she worked in other people's homes and then worked as a traveling saleswoman in Huaycán, selling candy, pacifiers, soft drinks and detergent. At 58 years of age, she has united with her daughter to start this new business, and counts on her to help cover living expenses. In the future, she hopes to put a candy case in her internet cafe.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in internet cafe business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marlene Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Marlene tiene 38 años de edad, habita en el barrio la primavera en la ciudad de Managua, tiene dos hijos que están estudiando la secundaria, su esposo trabaja de electricista automotriz, con ahorro logro tener una pequeña pulpería que administra desde hace cuatro años. Con este crédito quiere comprar dos pacas de ropa usadas ya que se venden a buen precio por ser buena, bonita y por su precio accesible. Con esto espera tener mejores ingresos. Sus planes a futuro es poder tener una tienda de ropa y vender variedad que pueda sastifacer a su clientela  a si como captar otros clientes.
texts.en:
Marlene is 38 years old and lives in the La Primavera neighborhood of Managua. She has two children studying in secondary school, and her husband works as an automotive electrician. With their savings, she has been able to run a small grocery store for the past four years. With this loan, she would like to buy two bales of used clothing, so she can sell good, beautiful clothes at a reasonable price. She hopes this will bring in better earnings. Her future plan is to have a clothing store, where she will sell a variety that will satisfy her customers as well as attract new ones.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two bales of clothing

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Bertha Alicia M. trabaja en un consultorio medico en el departamento de encargado, este es el ingreso de su familia ya que es madre soltera y tiene solo un hijo pequeño de edad para el cual quiere lo mejor.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para pagar el medicamento y tratamiento que le están haciendo a su papá ya que es una persona mayor de edad.
En este momento ella no cuenta con el dinero  necesario para pagar los gastos médicos de su papá.
texts.en:
Bertha Alicia M. works in a medical billing office. As a single mother, the money she earns in this job is her only source of income to take care of her young son. She is requesting a loan so that she can pay for medicine and treatment for her elderly father. Right now she does not have the money to cover his medical expenses.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To help cover medical expenses for her elderly father.

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es: María de Jesús R. R., reside en una casa muy humilde en Lourdes departamento de La Libertad, a sus 58 años trabaja arduamente por obtener los ingresos para poder tener una vida digna junto a su familia. Ella posee un negocio de hacer pupusas (pupusas es un platillo típico de El Salvador, el cuál es como una tortilla con frijoles queso y chicharrón, lo cual se revuelve con la masa de maíz y se la da la forma de tortilla y se cocina). Las personas llegan a comprar las pupusas para llevar o para comer ahí. Margarita cuenta con una muy buena demanda, sobre todo por las personas que comen en el lugar, ya que acompañan sus pupusas con alguna bebida que ella también vende. El deseo de Margarita es poder invertir más en su negocio, de manera que los clientes la prefieran, es por ello que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda mejorar sus negocio y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maria de Jesus R. R., lives in a humble house in Lourdes, department of La Libertad. At 58, she works hard to obtain the income needed to have a dignified life for her and her family. She has a business that makes pupusas (pupusas are a typical dish from El Salvador, which is like a tortilla mixed with beans, cheese and fried pork rinds, this is all combined with the corn mix to form the tortilla and then it gets cooked). The people that come to buy her pupusas either buy them to stay or to go. Margarita has good demand for her products, specially from the locals, who also buy drinks that she also sells. Margarita’s wish is to invest a bit more in her business, to be preferred by her clients, this is why she requests a loan to improve her business and increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Vicenta Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Vicente reside en el barrio san Luís de Armando Guido 2 ½ c al sur en la ciudad de Managua, tiene veintiún años de vender variados productos como: ropa, útiles escolares y productos omnilife. Tiene 44 años de edad sus hijos están casado, cuando inicio sus ventas lo hizo con ingresos de una liquidación de su trabajo que era en un supermercado, su crecimiento en su inventario ha sido por el apoyo que Afodenic le ha dado, es el tercer ciclo los dos anteriores lo ha invertido en infraestructura que han sido de muchos beneficios, con esta solicitud va a comprar ropa y productos omnilife que de gran demanda de sus clientes. A futuro es seguir creciendo en las ventas.
texts.en:
Vincente lives in the neighborhood of San Luis de Armando Guido in the south of Managua. For 21 years she has been selling various goods such as clothing, school supplies, and products by Omnilife. She is 44 years old and her children are grown up and married. When she began her business, she started with income she had from her work in a supermarket. The growth in her inventory has been thanks to support from Afodenic. This is the third loan for Vincente. She used the previous loans to invest in her business. With this loan, she will buy clothing and more Omnilife products which are popular with her customers. IIn the future she would like to continue to grow her business.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her business

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia Elizabeth R. D. M., resiD. en San Martín, vive junto a su esposo, tres hijos y su abuela. Ella posee un negocio D. productos textiles, tales como camisetas, toallas entre otras más, dicho negocio tiene por nombre “taller Costura”. Tiene más D. ocho años D. poseerlo,  y este es la mayor fuente D. ingreso para su familia. Sonia desea poder comprar más materia prima la cual la utilizará para producir más producto, ella desea mejorar su negocio y poder ampliarlo, D. manera que pueda percibir mayores ingresos los cuales logren cubrir los gastos familiares y sobre todo las necesidades más primordiales D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sonia Elizabeth Ramirez D. Martinez, lives in San Martin, with her husband, three children and her grandmother. She has a business that makes textile products, such as t-shirts, towels and more, her business is called “sewing shop”. She’s had it for more than eight years, it is the primary source of income for her family. Sonia wishes to purchase more materials to make more items, improve her business and expand it, this way she will have more income to cover family expenses and the basic needs of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for business

loans.name: Doribel Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Doribel tiene 35 años de edad, habita en  villa Reconciliación de la planta de Enel 2 ½ c al norte en la ciudad de Managua,  tiene dos hijos de 12 y 13 años de edad, su esposo es comerciante de madera que ambos administran llevan doce años en las ventas, iniciaron con dinero propio y la venta de ganado, luego con préstamo en Afodenic, este es su octavo préstamo el cual va invertir en la compra de madera en 1625 pulgadas de madera de caoba. Sus metas es poder seguir con las ventas cada aumentar el inventario para poder obtener mejores ganancias y formar un buen capital para ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Mrs. C. C. is 35 years old and lives at Villa Reconciliacion (Reconciliation Village) in Enel, north of the city of Managua. She has two children ages 12 and 13 years old, respectively. Her husband is a lumber merchant and both of them administer the business. They have been in business for twelve years. They started their business with their own savings and by selling cattle. After that, they were granted a loan with Afodenic. This will be their eighth loan with them. They plan to invest the money in buying lumber, especifically 1625 inches of mahogany lumber. Their goals are to continue with the sales and increase their inventory to get better profits and build a good capital to help their children with their education.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying mahogany lumber

loans.name: Rosa Ysabel,

texts.es:
Rosa, a sus cuarenta y dos años es madre de tres hijos, el mayor de veinticuatro, el segundo de dieciocho y el último de seis años. Los dos mayores son independientes económicamente. Por lo que solo se dedica a cuidar y criar a su menor hijo junto con su es poco, quien trabaja como mecánico.
Siempre se ha dedicado a su casa. Sin embargo, gracias a los consejos de una amiga se animó a convertirse en consultora de productos de belleza, vendiendo a través de la muestra de catálogos. Poco apoco ha ido aumentado la mercadería que tiene como stock y gracias a que consiguió reunir un capital extra se animo a vender otras dos marcas mas de cosméticos.
Las ganancias de su trabajo las comparte con su esposo para los gastos de su casa. Ha pensado en el futuro poner un negocio de comida, tal vez un restaurante en su propia casa.
texts.en:
Rosa, at 42, is mother of three children, the oldest one is 24, the second one is 18 and the youngest is six. The two older children are financially independent and Rosa along with her husband, who works as a mechanic, only have to take care of their youngest son. She has always been a housewife, however, thanks to the advice of a friend she decided to become a beauty products consultant, selling through a catalog. She has slowly increased the stock of merchandise and thanks to some extra capital she started selling other brands of cosmetics. The earnings from her work are shared with her husband to cover the house expenses. She thinks of starting in the future a food business, maybe running a restaurant from her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay fees for the cosmetics she sells

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa Trinidad,

texts.es:
DesD. hace diez años Rosa venD. gaseosas y todo tipo D. golosinas al por menor en el centro D. L. capital.  No cuenta con un puesto propio es por eso que su mercadería L. ubica en una canasta granD. y se pasea por las calles vendiendo como ambulante. Eventualmente, también obtiene un ingreso extra con L. venta D. cosméticos a sus amigos y familiares.
Empezó con su negocio D. ambulante a raíz D. que su hermana anteriormente tenia el mismo trabajo y generaba ingresos considerables D. dinero. 
Ya que tenia cuatro hijos a quienes mantener y no era suficiente con el aporte económico D. su esposo, quien trabaja como electricista independiente, Rosa se animó a seguir los pasos D. su hermana. Más adelante le gustaría abrir una tienda en su casa y  no tener que ir vendiendo por las calles, pues es un trabajo muy pesado y que requiere D. mucho esfuerzo físico.
texts.en:
10 years ago Rosa started selling sodas and all types of snacks in the capital’s centre. She doesn’t have her own location, that’s why she puts her merchandise in a big basket and walks with it around the streets selling her products. Eventually, she also obtains extra income with the sale of cosmetics to her friends and family. She started the food business because her sister also did the same type of work and maD. a considerable amount of money. She had four children to support and it wasn’t enough with the income from her husband, who works as an independent electrician, Rosa decided to follow the steps of her sister. Later on she would like to open a store from her house and not have to sell around the streets, because it’s hard work that requires a lot of physical effort.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mercedes Elizabeth

texts.es: Mercedes Elizabeth L. D. H., resiD. junto a su esposo Rafael H. en el municipio D. Aguilares, Mercedes trabaja arduamente días tras día en su propio salón D. belleza para lograr una mejor vida junto a su esposo, ya que él a pesar que cuenta con trabajo aporta muy poco a los gastos familiares, es por ello que Mercedes solicita un préstamo, a través del cuál pueda comprar más productos para su salón y D. esta manera aumentar sus ganancias, brindándoles un  servicio más completo a sus clientes. D. esta manera ella desea contribuir  con los gastos D. su hogar y poder brindarle ayuda a su esposo y D. esta manera lograr tener una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Mercedes Elizabeth L. D. H., lives with her husband Rafael H. in the municipality of Aguilares, Mercedes works hard day after day in her own beauty salon, to have a better life with her husband, because even though he works, he contributes very little to the family expenses, that’s why Mercedes requests a loan, through which she can buy more products for the beauty salon and this way have more income by providing full service to her clients. This way she will be able to contribute to the home expenses and help her husband and afford to have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for beauty salon

loans.name: Carmelita Rene,

texts.es:
Con sesenta y seis años de edad y a pesar de sus constantes malestares en el cuerpo debido al dolor en sus extremidades inferiores, Carmelita es una persona muy trabajadora y optimista.
Desde hace cuatro años vende condimentos en un mercado grande de su localidad. Anteriormente, también vendía como ambulante pero se dedicaba a la venta de verduras ya que tenía ciertos conocimientos en el rubro. Cuando era mas joven dedicaba todo su tiempo a trabajar una tierra sembrando y cultivando vegetales y también criando ganado.
Se mudó a Lima una vez que se separo de su esposo, se fue a vivir junto a sus hijos mayores. De los doce hijos que Carmelita ha tenido, solo diez de ellos viven. La mayoría ya son independientes y tienen sus respectivas familias. Por ahora Carmelita solo se dedica a manutener a su menor hijo de veintidós años y a su nieta de dieciocho.
texts.en:
Sixty six years old and in spite of the constant ache in her body due to pain in her lower extremities, Carmelita is a very hardworking and optimistic person. She has sold condiments in a big local market for four years. Before, she used to sell vegetables because she had knowledge of the business. When she was younger she used to work the land full time growing vegetables and raising cattle. She moved to Lima once she got separated from her husband, and went to live with her older children. Of the 12 children that Carmelita had, only 10 live. The majority of her children are independent and have their own families. For now Carmelita only takes care of her youngest son that is 22 and her granddaughter who is 18.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a motorized taxi cart

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: El Sr. Andrès tiene 56 años, es soltero y presta servicio de tractor para excavaciones de piedras de canteros , flete para el transporte de ladrillos de las hornerìas del interior del paìs hasta los depositos de materiales de Asunciòn. Tambièn presta servicios a los viveros para el transporte de las plantas. El credito será de ayuda para poder completar el monto que necesita para adquirir un nuevo tractor y de esta forma ampliar su area de cobertura y otorgar empleo a otras personas en la conduccion de los vehiculos.
texts.en:
Mr. Andrés is 56 years old and single. He works in construction as a tractor-operator during excavations of rock which are baked and transported to Asunción. Andres also operates a tractor in a nursery, helping to transport plants. He is requesting a loan to help him purchase a new tractor, which will help him increase his coverage and service more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a tractor

loans.name: Olga,

texts.es:
Con treinta años de edad Olga ha cumplido veinte años vendiendo canela molida embasada por ella misma al por mayor ofreciéndolas en tiendas minoristas. No obstante,  no es el único trabajo que maneja  Desde hace cuatro años también atiende en su puesto ambulante de abarrotes y verduras  Negocio que por ahora su esposo se encarga de mantener mientras el esta de vacaciones y ella se encuentra delicada de salud debido a su embarazo. Por otro lado, Olga también vende carbón en su casa.
Olga y su esposo, son jóvenes aun pero tienen mucha fuerza para llevar a cabo diversos proyectos. Todo siempre con el fin de mantener el bienestar de su hogar y la educación de sus tres hijos mayores, de catorce, once y ocho años.
Dentro de poco, Olga y su esposo piensan abrir una tienda de abarrotes en su propia casa. Solo esperan poder reunir todo el capital que requieren para ello.
texts.en:
Olga is 30 years old and has been bottling and selling ground cinnamon to small shops. In addition to this business, Olga has also been selling basic groceries and vegetables from her small cart for the last four years. Her husband is now managing this business as Olga health is delicate due to her pregnancy. Olga and her husband are young, but they work hard to make their businesses successful so that they can provide a good home and a good education for their three children ages 14, 11 and 8.

In the near future, they would like to open a shop in their own home, instead of selling items from the cart. They will use the loan to make this investment.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for a shop they want to set up in their home

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: El señor Andres tiene 44 años, vive con su hijo, quien le ayuda a elaborar los detergentes , este negocio es vital para la familia, ya que es el sustento diario. Andres comenzo trabajando en una empresa que fabrica detergentes en donde aprendio el oficio .El se independiso aproximadamente hace 10 años y provee a las despensas del barrio . El necesita de este crédito para seguir elavorando mas productos ya que su negcio funciona muy bien. En el futuro desea comprar un vehiculo para realizar sus ventas en el interior del pais.
texts.en:
Andrés is 44 years old and lives with his son. The two of them make detergents to sell, which is their primary source of income. Andres began working in a business that made detergents, which is where he learned the trade. Approximately 10 years he began his own business and now supplies his neighborhood with detergent. Andres is requesting the loan to purchase materials to make his detergents, including hypochlorite, bleach, and sodium hydrosulfite. In the future his goal is to purchase a vehicle to transport his detergent to other parts of the country and sell it.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make detergents, including hypochlorite, bleach, and sodium hydrosulfite, etc.

loans.name: Germán Alberto

texts.es: Germán Alberto G. A., reside en cantón el Zunzal, junto a su esposa e hijos. Posee una venta de medicinas naturales, las cuales las distribuye de manera ambulante en los diferentes cantones del puerto de La Libertad, así también los vende en su hogar. Germán tiene 50 años de edad y posee una excelente reputación por ser una persona muy responsable y trabajadora. Cada día Germán sale de su hogar decidido a vender lo más posible con el fin de poder brindarle un mejor estilo de vida a su familia y un mejor futuro a sus hijos, ya que el sueña con que sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios para que puedan tener una vida mejor. Es por ello que Germán solicita un préstamo el cual le permita comprar más medicinas para poder tener mayor variedad y poder  brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ya que esto contribuirá a que obtenga mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Germán Alberto G. A. resides in the zone of Zunzal, together with his wife and children. He has a business selling natural medicines, which he distributes door to door in the different zones of the port of La Libertad. He also sells them in his home. Germán is 50 years old, and possesses an excellent reputation for being a very responsible and hard-working person. Every day Germán leaves his house determined to sell the most that is possible, at the end hoping to be able to give a better lifestyle to his family and a better future for his children. He dreams that his children achieve finishing their studies so that they can have a better life. It is for this that Germán is seeking a loan, which will permit him to buy more medicines to be able to have a better variety and give a better service to his clients; and this will contribute to obtaining better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more medicines for his business

location.town: Puerto de La Libertad, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Salome

texts.es: El señor Salome A. B. habita en el barrios los ríos , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa he hijos , ella trabaja como comerciante en el mercado para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , don salome tiene veinte años trabajando las tierras que sus padres le heredaron , con el financiamiento que le hemos brindado durante cinco ciclo a establecido piña , los sueños de don Salome es poder establecer dos manzanas mas de cultivo para que en futuro darle la parte que le corresponde a cada uno de sus hijos. Con este crédito va a comprar fertilizantes para mejorar los cultivos y obtener una mejor producción.
texts.en:
Mr. A. B. lives at Los Rios (The Rivers) barrio, located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. He lives with his wife and children. She works as a merchant at the market to support with the household expenses. Don Salome has been working the land that he inherited from his parents for twenty years. With the financing that we provided durint five cycles, he has been able to establish a pineapple plot. Don Salome's dreams is to be able to establish two more plots so in the future, he can pass them down to each of his children. With this loan, he will buy fertilizers to improve the farming and get a better production.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizers for the crops

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar M. Ishaq Group

texts.en:
Naseem akhtar baji has been a resident of the city of Vehari, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Her husband, M. I., works in a factory. Naseem baji is the mother of two children; one son and one daughter. Both of her children get an education at the local school. Naseem baji is a very hardworking lady. She sews clothes without caring whether it is day and night. She sews clothes to pay off the school fees of her children. Her family is very happy with her kind and loving behavior. She is applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine so that she sews more clothes and save time. 

She is a group leader of several other women of her locality. Naseem begum baji wants a loan to pay the installments of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Syeda touqeer baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to sell. Hamidan baji wants a loan to buy thread to sell. Anwar begum baji wants a loan to buy beams for her window shutter business. Taish naz baji wants a loan to buy clothes for her clothing selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Bayardo Manuel

texts.es: El señor Bayardo Manuel Vásquez, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa y hijos, la esposa trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar tiene una tienda de ropa usada en su casa, don Bayardo trabaja como supervisor de guarda de seguridad, desde hace cinco años, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, la mayor dificultad que ha tenido en construir su vivienda por falta de financiamiento; ya que su salario es bajo. Con esta solicitud va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer mejoras a su casa y poder tener una casa digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. V. lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe together with his wife and children. His wife works to support with the household expenses. She has a used clothes store at her home. Don Bayardo has worked for five years as a security guard supervisor. His future plans are to improve the living conditions of his family. The greatest difficulty that he is facing is building his home due to a lack of financing since his salary is low. With this request, he is going to buy construction materials to make improvements to the home and be able to have a home worth of his family.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials to improve and finish his home.

loans.name: Tahira M. Nadeem Group

texts.en:
Tahira baji is the wife of M. N., who is a driver and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).Tahira baji owes a two room brick house and has lived there, with her family for the past 10 years. Tahira baji is a lady who believes on hard work. She has taught this strength to her son. Her son attends 7th grade and studies hard. Tahira baji wishes to give him a good future. For this reason she makes embroidered dresses and takes orders from her neighbors and relatives. She charges $3 for per dress. She is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s auto-rickshaw so that he will be able to continue his work. 

She is a loan group leader of some other women in her locality. Shakeela baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (wires and switch boards) for her electric supplies selling business. Aqsa baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal selling business. Waziran baji and Bushra baji wants a loan to buy meat for their meat selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.es:
La señora Apolonia S. tiene 32 años y es soltera .

Ella tiene este negocio en un barrio de la ciudad de Capiata, que es donde vive. Apolonia provee de alimentos, materiales de limpieza, productos básicos de la canasta familiar a sus vecinos. Ella se levanta muy temprano para ir al Mercado de Abasto, lugar donde compra todo lo necesario para surtir la despensa ya que es la unica en la zona. Con este negocio logro constuir una pequeña vivienda en el terreno que le heredo sus padres. Apolonia nesecita de este credito para ampliar su despensa ya que tiene una buena clientela formada y cada vez tiene mas pedidos.
texts.en:
Ms. Apolonia S. is 32 years old and is single. She has a business in the Capiata neighborhood, where she also lives. Apolonia sells food, cleaning products, and basic household products to her neighbors. She gets up very early to go to the Abasto Market, where she buys everything necessary to stock her store, which is the only one of its kind in the area. With this business she has been able to build a small home on the land she inherited from her parents. Apolonia needs this loan to better stock her business, as she has regular customers and every day gets more orders.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour, sugar, rice, noodles, milk, meat, eggs, mate (tea), bread, etc.

loans.name: Sugran Shahnawaz Group

texts.en:
Sugran baji is the wife of S. and they have resided in a city called Vehari, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Sugran baji is a mother of two kids: one son and one daughter. Both of her kids are getting education from a school located near their house.

Sugran baji is a very simple lady. She spends her time doing household work and taking care of her family. Her husband runs a PCO (public call office, where people come to make calls and must pay a fee). Sugran baji is applying for a loan to buy calling cards to expand her husband’s business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Rubina kosar baji and Nazia baji each want a loan to buy wood for their furniture-making businesses. Saima baji wants a loan to pay the installments on her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Salma baji wants a loan to buy electrical supplies (wires and switchboards) to sell. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy calling cards for PCO

loans.name: Bendicion Group

texts.es: El comité Bendición es un comité que se encuentra en el 4to. Ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendadoras.  El comite tiene un ahorro de 4.500.000.  Las integrantes son señoras que viven en la villa CONAVI, de la ciudad de San Lorenzo. Todas las mujeres son muy responsables y activas, y ellas realizan actividades para ayudar a sus vecinos.  Ellas aprecian mucho las capacitaciones que reciben a traves del programa de Fundacion Paraguaya. Pues así aprenden a ahorrar y administrar mejor su negocio. Las integrantes de Bendicion están trabajando hace mas de 2 años con la fundación.
texts.en:
The Blessing Group is a group currently in its fourth cycle of the Enterprising Women program. The group has a savings of 4,500,000 Paraguayan Guaraní. The members are women who live in the Conavi neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo. All of the women are very responsible and active, and they do activities to help their neighbors. They very much appreciate the trainings that they have received through the Fundación Paraguaya program. Through the trainings they have learned to save and to better administer their businesses. The members of the Blessing Group have been working with Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya for more than two years.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise such as clothing for children, teens and adults; underwear; cosmetics; vegetables; animals; fabric, thread, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Parveen M. Aslam Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji is the wife of M. A. who runs a tea stall near their house. Parveen baji owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past 20 years. M. A. has a good number of customers at his tea stall. He keeps his wife’s home-cooked items, e.g. snacks and sweets, in the tea stall. Parveen baji is applying for a loan to buy materials (tea and sugar) to expand her husband’s tea stall.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Parveen Akhtar baji and Shabina baji each want a loan to buy seasonal fruit for their fruit-selling businesses. Khalida baji wants a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shop. Allah Rakhi baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for running a tea stall

loans.name: Nelson Enrique

texts.es: El señor Nelson Enrique  habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa e hijos, la esposa trabaja con él en el mercado Oriental de la capital, ellos con sus propios esfuerzos han logrado mantener su negocio, que es la venta de pollo, chorizo y otra variedad de carne blanca producto que es el consumo diario de los Nicaragüense por su rica carne, nutritiva, y por su precio que es mas accesible que la carne res. Con esta solicitud que esta haciendo es para invertir  más en su  inventario en la venta de pollo para ofertar a sus clientes la variedad, y cumplir con la demanda. Sus planes es captar clientes nuevos, y poner otro puesto de venta de pollo.
texts.en:
Nelson Enrique lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe together with his wife and children. His wife works with him at the Oriental market in the capital. With their own efforts, they have been able to maintain and sustain their business. They sell chickens, sausage and other varieties of white meat which are consume daily by the Nicaraguans because of its richness and nutritional content. Its price makes it more accessible than beef. With this request that they are making, they will invest it in getting more inventory for selling chickens and to offer a variety to their customers so they are able to supply the demand. Their plans are to get new customers and establish another stand for selling chicken.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying chicken, sausage, and other varieties of white meat

loans.name: Ulfat Ghulam Rasool Group

texts.en:
Ulfat baji is a wife of G. R. who has a cold drink corner in the community for the past 5 years. Ulfat baji is the mother of three kids: one son and two daughters. All of her kids are getting an education from a school located near their house. Ulfat baji is a seamstress. She sews clothes, taking orders from her neighbors. She uses her income to pay the school fees of her kids. She is applying for a loan to buy cold drinks for her husband’s cold drink corner.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Latifan baji wants a loan to buy dried fruits to sell. Naziran baji wants a loan to change the body of her family's auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Haseena baji wants a loan to buy shoes for her shoe-selling business. Another Haseena baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cold drinks for cold drink corner

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El comité PRIMAVERA es un comité que se encuentra en el 6to. Ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendadoras.  Las integrantes tienen un ahorro de 3.000.000Gs. Es un comité antiguo, con mas de 2 años trabajando con Fundación Paraguaya. Entre sus actividades se encuentran la venta de comida rapida como empanadas, panchos, hamburguezas, sandwichs, tortillas, etc, y las que tienen despensa venden de todo ,tanto artículos para limpieza, comidas,cuadernos, lapices, golosinas, etc. las señoras más antiguas tienen carnicerias y proveen en la zona. Son señoras muy trabajadoras, se unieron para la construccion de una escuela.

1	Blanca Teresa S. Sanaria.	Venta de ropas.
2	Irma T..	Venta de carteras.(artesanales)
3	Maria Fariña.
	Venta de joyas y ropas.
4	Lucia S..	Venta de frutas, verduras,ropas, etc.
5	Marta S.	Venta de comidas.
6	Gloria O..	Venta de comidas.
7	Natalia M..	Venta de artesanias.
8	Silvia C..	Costurera.
9	Dominga G..	Venta de ropas para niños.
10	Maria O..	Venta de comidas.
11	Perla S.	Despensa.
12	Maria C..	Venta de comestible.
13	Pastora S..	Trabaja en una fruteria, venta de cosmeticos.
14	Pablina S.	Venta de bebidas.
15	Mirian O..	Venta de ropas.
16	Olga S.	Venta de comidas.
texts.en:
The PRIMAVERA group is a group that finds itself in its sixth cycle of the “Mujeres Emprendadoras” (“Enterprising Women”) program. The members have savings of 3 million Paraguayan. It is an old group that has more than 2 years of working with Fundación Paraguaya. Their activities include the sale of fast food such as empanadas, panchos, hamburgers, sandwiches, tortillas, etc. Those who have stores sell all types of articles such as cleaning supplies, food, notebooks, pencils, sweets, etc. The older members have meat shops and supply the area. They are very hard-working women who joined together to help build a school. 1. Blanca Teresa S. Sanaria. Clothing sales. 2. Irma T.. Sells handmade purses. 3. Maria Fariña. Jewelry and clothing sales.  4. Lucia S.. Sells fruits, vegetables, clothes, etc.  5. Marta S.. Food sales. 6. Gloria O.. Food sales. 7. Natalia M.. Sale of crafts. 8. Silvia C.. Seamstress. 9. Dominga G.. Children’s clothing sales. 10. Maria O.. Food sales.  11. Perla S.. General store.  12. Maria C.. Food sales.  13. Pastora S.. Works at a greengrocer’s, sells cosmetics.  14. Pablina S.. Beverage sales.  15. Mirian O.. Clothing sales.  16. Olga S.. Food sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Depending on the woman's type of business, loan funds will be destined to purchase merchandise such as vegetables, meats, clothing, fabric, shoes, eggs, flour, gold and silver jewelry, cosmetics.

loans.name: Amelia Rosalina,

texts.es:
Al inicio, cuando recién empezó a trabajar, Amelia se dedicaba a vender especerías y condimentos en un puesto ambulante. Estuvo buen tiempo en ello hasta que tuvo la oportunidad de hacerse de un puesto propio en un mercado nuevo cerca de su casa. Una vez en su puesto de abarrotes cambió la venta de condimentos a la de abarrotes.
Hoy ya lleva ocho años en su negocio. Más adelante le gustaría tener el capital suficiente para comprar un mototaxi y alquilarlo.
En su hogar se encarga de cubrir los gastos de alimento, mientras que su esposo cubre los demás gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Initially, when she started working, Amelia sold spices and condiments from a traveling cart. It took a long time before she had the opportunity to open her own small store in a new market near her home. Once she opened her grocery store, she changed her business focus from condiments to groceries. She has now had her business for eight years. In the future, she would like to have enough money to buy a mototaxi to lease out. In her household, she is responsible for paying for the food while her husband is responsible for the rest of the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es: La señora Isabel Cristina habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo e hijos, su esposo trabaja  y la apoya con los gastos del hogar, ya que tiene dos hijos a su cargo, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida en su hogar ya que actualmente vive con su mamá, doña Isabel se dedica al comercio  en la venta de cosmético y otros productos, las ganancias son factibles ya que ha logrado captar clientes vende por encargo y siempre tiene mercadería que vende al contado y al crédito, con esta solicitud va a comprar cosméticos para ofertar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Isabel Cristina lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe with her husband and children. Her husband works and supports her with the household expenses since they have two children to care for. Their future plans are to improve their living conditions at their home since at the present they live with her mom. Dona Isabel sells cosmetics and other products. Her earnings are good because she has been able to get customers and always has merchandise available. She accepts cash and credit. With this application, she will be able to buy more cosmetics to increase her inventory and offer them to her customers.

.La señora Isabel Cristina habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo e hijos, su esposo trabaja y la apoya con los gastos del hogar, ya que tiene dos hijos a su cargo, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida en su hogar ya que actualmente vive con su mamá, doña Isabel se dedica al comercio en la venta de cosmético y otros productos, las ganancias son factibles ya que ha logrado captar clientes vende por encargo y siempre tiene mercadería que vende al contado y al crédito, con esta solicitud va a comprar cosméticos para ofertar a sus clientes.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cosmetics products

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El Sr. Mario tiene 54 años, esta casado con la Señora Fermina Duarte y tienen 2 hijos menores en edad escolar. Hace 16 ( Dieciseis años) aprendiò a elaborar las guampas (que la gente se usa para beber mate y terere), cuando estaba en la Penitenciaria Nacional de Tacumbù. Don Mariò ingresò a la correccional por un error de la Justicia Paraguaya. Su conyuge es profesora de peluquerìa y tiene montado en su domicilio un instituto de enseñanza y de esta forma generar otro ingreso para la afamilia. El credito será destinado a la compra de cuernos de vacas y toros y asi poder elaborar sus productos atendiendo a la demanda actual.
texts.en:
Mario is 54 years old; he is married to Fermina Duarte and they have two minor school-aged children. Sixteen years ago, he learned to make guampas (glasses made from horn which people use to drink mate and terere - traditional herbal drinks) when he was in the National Penitentiary of Tacumbù. Mario was sent to the detention centre due to an error made by Paraguayan Justice. His spouse teaches hair styling and runs her school in their home in order to have another income for their family. The loan will be used to buy cows' and bulls' horns to be made into products on demand.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cows' and bulls' horns

loans.name: Isabel,

texts.es:
Desde hace quince años Isabel se dedica a la venta de productos naturales y extracto de rana. Además de este puesto también tiene otro propio en el mismo mercado. Este último lo alquila a una compañera. Sin embargo, dentro de poco piensa abrir una nueva tienda ahí. En la cual tiene pensado vender ropa y productos de bazar. 
Isabel tiene una familia conformada por sus cinco hijos y su esposo, quien trabaja vendiendo repuestos de carro. No obstante, actualmente solo se encarga de criar a su última hija de un año y medio, sus demás hijos ya son independientes económicamente. 
Ella ya lleva cinco años con los prestamos de EDAPORSPO, gracias a ellos ha podido aumentar su mercadería y mejorar la infraestructura de sus dos puestos.
texts.en:
For 15 years Isabel has been selling natural products and frog extract. Besides this location she also has another stall in the same market. The latter she rents to a friend. However, she is thinking of opening a new store there soon. She would like to sell clothing and other products there. Isabel has a family made up of her five children and her husband, who works selling auto parts. Currently she is raising her youngest daughter, age 1 1/2, and her other children are economically independent. She has been working with EDAPORSPO for 5 years, and thanks to the loans she has received she has been able to increase her merchandise and improve the infrastructure of her two stalls.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Naida

texts.es:
La Sra. Naida tiene 25 años es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres en Fernando de la Mora, no tiene hijos.

La Sra. Naida se dedica a la venta de perfumes y ropas hace 5 años. Sus ventas lo realiza en distintas ciudades. Tambien es docente hace 3 años donde enseña en una escuela cerca de su casa.

Este credito es para la compra de mayor cantidad e menor costo de las mercaderias que ella vende.
Es una persona que ha progresado mucho en la vida y agradece a la Fundaciòn Paraguaya por el apoyo que le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Ms. Naida A. is a 25-year-old single woman who lives in her parents’ house in the Fernando de la Mora neighborhood. She has no children.

Ms. A. has been selling perfume and clothing for 5 years. She sells her products throughout various cities. She has also been a teacher at a nearby school for 3 years.

This loan will be used to purchase a greater quantity of merchandise at a low price.

She is a person who has really made progress in life. She would like to thank Fundaciòn Paraguaya for all the support it has given her.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfume and apparel

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El Sr. Alfredo tiene 49 años y esta casado con la Sra. Asuncion y tiene tres hijos de edad escolar.
El Sr. Alfredo se dedica a la costura hace 16 años. Anteriormente trabajaba para una marca de ropas muy conocida como costurero, luego se decidio a crear su propia mini empresa de costura y bordados de ropas para todo tipo de empresa. Los pedidos y las cobranzas lo realiza su Sra.

Gracias al esfuerso de toda la familia terminaron de construir su vivienda propia y solventar los gastos de estudio de sus hijos, tambien estan creciendo comercialmente.

Este credito invertira en la compra de materia prima para la fabricacion de uniformes para colegios.
texts.en:
Mr. Alfredo G. is a 49-year-old man who is married with Ms. Asuncion. They have three school age children together.

Mr. G. has been a tailor for 16 years. He previously worked for a popular clothing brand as a tailor, but he later decided to start his own small tailoring and embroidery business. His wife takes the orders and collects the payments. Thanks to the family’s efforts, they finished building their own house and always manage to cover the children’s educational expenses. Their business is also growing.

This loan will be invested in purchasing the supplies needed to make school uniforms.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, etc.

loans.name: Vacilia,

texts.es:
Vacilia ha trabajado por su cuenta la gran parte de su vida. Siempre se ha visto en la necesidad de buscar un ingreso económico propio para el mantenimiento de su hogar y en un principio, de sus siete hijos de los cuales, cinco ya son independientes.
Hace veinticinco años cuando recién se mudó a Huaycán  empezó a vender frituras en la calle, a veces ofrecía la comida que preparaba de casa en casa cuando aún el distrito no estaba muy habitado; sin embargo, la mayor parte del tiempo vendía en el paradero principal de su localidad. 
Hoy en día continúa con la venta de frituras, pero solo por las tardes. Por el día y en sus tiempos libres vende gaseosas y cervezas en su casa. Este último negocio ya ha cumplido diez años, y empezó a raíz de que la clientela iba a buscarla en su casa pidiéndole gaseosas, pues ya conocían su negocio en el paradero.
Ella se encuentra separada de su esposo, pero aun cuenta con su ayuda económica para el mantenimiento de su hogar y educación de sus dos menores hijos de veintidós y diecinueve años. Más adelante quisiera abrir un kiosco en la puerta de su casa para vender mayor cantidad de mercadería, por ahora no ya que hay mucha competencia.
texts.en:
Vacilia has supported herself for the majority of her life. She has always felt the need to seek her own income in order to maintain her home and her seven children, of which five are now independent. 25 years ago when she had just moved to Huaycan, she began to sell fried foods on the street, sometimes she would offer food that she prepared at home (even before the district became more populated). However, the majority of the time she would sell in the general area of her home. Nowadays she continues selling fried foods, but only in the evenings. During the day and in her spare time she sells soda and beer in her home. She has had this business for 10 years, and she started it with the customers that already knew her from the neighborhood. She now is separated from her husband, but still relies on his economic support for the maintenance of her household and the education of her two younger children, aged 22 and 19 years. In the future she would like to open a kiosk in the front of her home in order to sell a greater quantity of merchandise, since right now there is not much competition.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soda

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa tiene 48 años, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijas mayores en edad Escolar Secundaria. Se iniciò en la actividad de ventas ambulantes hace cinco años, cuenta con una camioneta de carga, en la cual realiza diariamente sus ventas, por los barrios de San Lorenzo, Villa Elisa, Fdo. De la Mora y Ñemby. 

El credito será destinado a la compra de las mercaderias ya mencionadas mas arriba y de esta forma cumplir con la demanda actual.  Siempre hay mas interes en sus productos alrededor de la semana santa. La Sra Rosa sueña con poder adquirir un vehicula de mayor porte y ampliar sus zonas de venta.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa I. is a 48-year-old single mother with two daughters in high school. She started her street vending business five years ago. She has her own cargo van out of which she sells her products throughout the San Lorenzo, Villa Elisa, Fdo. De la Mora and Ñemby neighborhoods.

The loan will be used to purchase merchandise so that she can meet customer demand. Her products are quite popular around Holy Week. Ms. Rosa dreams of getting a bigger vehicle and expanding her sales area.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase eggs, plastic bags, cheese, and cornmeal

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Luchadoras nace hace cerca de dos años, después del fin de otro comité. Varias señoras se unieron y decidieron formar un nuevo comité en el barrio y les fue muy bien hasta ahora. No tienen atrasos y tienen un ahorro de más de dos millones. Ellas realizan actividades para ayudar a alivianar el pago de las cuotas. Las señoras que integran este comité se dedican a la venta de artículos en el barrio en el cual residen.  Trabajan así como en el centro de la ciudad de San Lorenzo como en otros B. de la misma ciudad. 

En promedio reciben cada una 666.667 gs., el cual será invertido en la compra de artículos que serán vendidos en sus respectivas actividades comerciales


Nº	Nombre y Apellido	Actividad
1	Ysidora Galván	Venta de Carbón
2	Rossana V.	Masajista
3	María Galván (NO SE ENCUENTRA EN LA FOTOGRAFIA)		Despensa
4	María B.	Venta de ropas
5	Gladys R.	Despensa
6	Inocencia M.	Venta de comidas y bebidas 
7	Ruth T.	Venta de ropas
8	Antonia V.	Despensa
9	Beatriz B.	Venta de lencería
10	Carmen V.	Modista
11	Carolina M.	Venta de lencería y ropas
12	Gricelda A.	Venta de jugos naturales
13	María D.	Venta de comidas
14	Sixta S.	Venta de bebidas
15	Andrea M.	Venta de lencería
texts.en:
The Mujeres Luchadoras Group was created two years ago, after an earlier group was disbanded.
