Several of the earlier group's members got together and decided to form a new group for their neighbourhood, and everything has gone very well for these women since then. They have never been late with their payments and even have collective savings of 2 million gs. Each of the women runs a business and all of them help make the payments. The group's members dedicate themselves to a variety of activities, selling products in their neighbourhood, in the center of San Lorenzo city. On average, they will each receive 666,667 gs. which they will use to buy the products they sell in their respective shops and stalls. Ysidora Galván sells charcoal; Rossana V. is a masseuse; Antonia V., Gladys R., and María Galván (who is not in the photograph) run grocery stores; María B., Ruth T., Andrea M., Carolina M., and Beatriz B. sell clothing and lingerie; Carmen V. is a tailor; María D. and Inocencia M. sell meals; and Gricelda A. and Sixta S. sell drinks and natural juices.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lingerie, meat, vegetables, soft drinks, wine, beer, cloth, sugar, beans, rice, oils, and cosmetics

loans.name: Las Puntuales Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "Las  Puntuales" están representadas por la señora Amalia cecilia y residen en la villa 1ro D. mayo  en la urbanización la cruz donD. todas son del barrio y se conocen entre ellas, existe un parentesco entre la señora Celina con la señora cecilia que son madre e hija pero ambas tienen sus propias familia y sus ingresos totalmente independientes. Todas las señoras tiene sus negocios propios como ser: promotoras D. cosméticos, venta D. comida, ayudante D. costura, venta D. pan, frutas y abarrotes. Las socias aceptan que existe gran competencia en el mercado comercial pero gracias a su experiencia y manejo D. su mercadería saben como salir adelante. El crédito esta destinado al incremento D. su negocio comprando mayor cantidad D. materiales e insumos y mejorando la calidad D. sus productos para tener una mayor cantidad D. ingresos para cumplir con sus obligaciones y llevar el pan D. cada día a sus familias. Las socias integrantes tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios ya que trabajaron con instituciones semejantes a la fundacion agrocapital quien  les brinda la oportunidad D. mejorar sus ingresos y la calida D. vida D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Las Puntuales" (The Punctual Women) Communal Bank is represented by Amalia Cecilia and they live in the village Primero D. Mayo (May 1st) in the La Cruz development, where everyone in the neighborhood knows everyone else. Cecilia and Celina are mother and daughter, but both have their own families and their incomes are totally independent. All of the women have their own businesses such as: promoting cosmetics, food sales, assistant seamstresses, and bread, fruit, and grocery sales. The members accept that there is great competition in the marketplace, but thanks to their experience and the management of their merchandise they know how to move forward. The loan is intended to increase their business, allowing them to buy greater quantities of materials and supplies and improving the quality of their products and have greater profits to meet their obligations and proviD. for their families. The partner members have experience in such groups. They already work with institutions similar to the Fudacion Agrocapital who proviD. them with opportunities to improve their profits and the quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Rukhsana Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana baji is the wife of M. A. and has resided in a city named Riwind, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Rukhsana baji is the mother of three kids: one son and two daughters. All of her kids are getting an education from a local school. Rukhsana baji belongs to a family of farmers, so she mostly spends time with her buffalos and taking care of them. Presently she has two buffalos at her house. She gets milk from them and sells it to the milk shops. She is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to expand the milk-selling business

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Rubina Naz baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (lentils, cooking oil, and spices) for her food-selling business. Safaide baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk-selling business

loans.name: Yanett Ela

texts.es:
Yanet es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos en quechua.
Yanet es soltera y tiene 29 años, Yanet tiene un Multiservicios en la casa de un familiar, en donde vende abarrotes, útiles de escritorio, regalos, brinda servicios de fotocopiado, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de su mama y hermana.
Yanet necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cuadernos.
Los sueños de Yanet es ampliar su multiservicio.
texts.en:
Yanet is a member of the Llapanchik Communal Bank, which means "Everyone" in Quechua. Yanet is 29 years old and single. Yanet has a multi-service store in a relative's home where she sells groceries, desk supplies, gifts, and photocopying services, which she provides with the help of her mother and sister. Yanet needs a loan of 1,000 soles to invest in the purchase of notebooks. Yanet dreams of exanding her multi-service store.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of notebooks.

loans.name: Las Magnificas Group

texts.es: El grupo "Las  Magnificas" están representadas por la señora Ana Maria, todo el grupo resiD. en el plan 30000 en el barrio Urkupiña y se conocen entre si; existe un parentesco familiar entre la señora Natali y Patricia ambas son hermanas pero tienen ingresos totalmente independientes por los que no existen riesgos en el grupo. En general las socias se dedican a actividades como la confección D. prendas D. vestir, transporte público D. pasajeros y a la venta y comercialización D. pan, comida, abarrotes, cosméticos y ropa. Las socias aceptan que existe gran competencia en el mercado comercial y laboral pero siempre se pueD. salir adelante con experiencia y ganas D. trabajar. El crédito esta destinado a  compra D. materiales e insumos y a la mejora D. sus productos terminados para incrementar sus ingresas para poD. cumplir con sus obligaciones y llevar el pan D. cada día a sus familias. Las socias integrantes tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios ya que trabajaron con instituciones semejantes a la fundación Agrocapital quien  les brinda la oportunidad D. mejorar sus ingresos y la calida D. vida D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The group "Las Magnificas" (The Magnificent Ones) is represented by Ana Maria. Everyone in the group lives in the 30000 plan in the Urkupiña neighborhood where everyone knows each other. Natali and Patricia are sisters but they have totally independent sources of income so that no risks exist within the group. In general, the members dedicate themselves to activities such as clothing, public transportation, and bread, meal, grocery, cosmetics and clothing sales. The members know that there is great competition in the comercial and labor markets, but they are always able to move forward with their experience and their earnings. This loan is intended to purchase materials and supplies and improve their end products to increase their profits so that they can fulfill their obligations and proviD. for their families. The member partners have experience in such support groups. They already worked with institutions similar to the Fudaction Agrocapital that provided them with the opportunity to improve their profits and the quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos en quechua.
Maria es soltera, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Maria es feriante, viaja  dos veces por semana en donD. compra quesos, cereales y luego lo comercializa en los mercados D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además Maria tiene un carro que realiza transporte a L. ciudad D. Sachabamba.
Maria necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. neumáticos para su carro.
Los sueños D. Maria es comprar otro carro moderno.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Llapanchik Communal Bank, which means "Everyone united in Quecha." Maria is single, 23 years old and has one child. She is a "feriante." She travels two times a week to buy cheeses and grains and later sells them in markets in the city of Ayacucho. Maria also has a car that she uses to go to the city of Sachabamba. Maria needs a loan of $625 to invest in tires for her car. Maria's dream is to buy another, more modern car.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tires for her car.

loans.name: Fatima Akhtar Hussain Group

texts.en:
Fatima baji, the wife of A. H., has lived in Riwind, Pakistan for the past 12 years. She is the mother of two sons who are in kindergarten. Faima baji’s husband runs a barber shop where he cuts hair and shaves. Fatima baji is applying for a loan to buy razors and scissors for her husband’s barber shop. 

She is a the leader of a group of women in her locality. Khursheeda baji and Nasira baji each want a loan to buy a buffalo for their milk-selling businesses. Nusrat baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a barber shop

loans.name: Corazon De Maria Group

texts.es: El grupo "Corazón D. Maria" es un grupo muy unido y representado por la señora Nancy, ella al igual que sus compañeras resiD. en resiD. en el barrio las Gramas donD. todas se conocen d varios años, Dentro del grupo existe un parentesco familiar entre la señora Nancy y Maria del Carmen las cuales son hermanas pero con ingresos independientes. La mayoría D. las socias se dedica al comercio D. productos como cosméticos, pan ropa, refrescos, comida, abarrotes, dulces y al transporte público D. pasajeros. Dentro del ámbito comercial siempre existe la competencia es por eso que se debe D. contar con productos D. buena calidad y con una buena calidad humana para no perder clientela y poder D. esa manera llegar con el pan D. cada día a sus hogares. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. insumos y materiales para incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos para brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. Las socias no cuentan con mucha experiencia en grupos solidarios pero conocen la responsabilidad que implica un financiamiento y no quieren fallar a la Fundación agrocapital quien confía en su capacidad y honestidad.
texts.en:
The group "Corazón D. Maria" (Mary's Heart) is a very united group represented by Nancy. She, like her partners, lives in the Gramas neighborhood where everyone has known each other for many years. Within the group. there is a familial relationship between Nancy and Maria del Carmen - they are sisters, but with independent incomes. The majority of the members sell products like cosmetics, bread, clothing, drinks, meals, groceries, sweets and transportation. With commercial success, there always exists competition, which is why they should rely on good quality products and with good quality workers so as not to lose clients and proviD. for their families. The purpose of this loan to buy supplies and materials to increase their sales, improve their profits, and proviD. their families with a better quality of life. The members do not have much experience with support groups, but they know the responsibility that it entails and they do not want to disappoint the Fundacion Agrocapital who trusts in their ability and honesty.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.
Hermelinda es casada, tiene 60 años y 7 hijos, Hermelinda tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco en donD. venD. carne, los animales los adquiere en las ferias D. la región y luego los beneficia en el camal D. la ciudad.
Hermelinda necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ganado vacuno.
Hermelinda sueña con ahorrar para construir el segundo piso D. su casa, tener capital propio e implementar su puesto con una maquina cortadora.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is a member of the Wiñarisun Communal Bank, which means "Let's Grow" in Quecha. Hermelinda is married, 60 years old, and has seven children. She has a stand in the F. Vivanco market where she sells meat. She buys the animals at regional fairs and later brings them to the city slaughterhouse. Hermelinda needs a loan of $925 to purchase cattle. Hermelinda dreams of saving up to build a second floor on her house, to have her own capital and supply her stand with a meat cutting machine.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Saima M. Imran Group

texts.en:
Saima baji is a 34-year-old married woman who has been a citizen of Riwind, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband, M. I., runs a barber shop in the community. He has been running the shop for the past 7 years. Saima baji is a seamstress. She sews clothes to share the financial burden of her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy razors and scissors for her husband’s barber shop. 

She is the leader of a group of women of her locality. Najma baji wants a loan to buy flour to sell. Yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Iqbal baji wants a loan to buy iron to make iron rods to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: 'Baji,' which means 'older sister,' is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a barber shop

loans.name: Temporal Group

texts.es: El Grupo " Temporal" esta conformado por 12 integrantes y representado por la señora Maria Antonieta. En su mayoría el grupo se dedica ha actividades como el transporte público D. pasajeros, empleados y ala venta D. comida, repostería y refrescos. Los negocios siempre prosperan si se tienen entusiasmo y ganas D. trabajar es por eso que los integrantes del grupo no temen a la competencia. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. insumos y materiales para incrementar y mejorar sus negocios para ofrecer a  los clientes una mejor calidad D. servicio y D. productos para mejorar los ingresos y la calidad D. vida D. sus familias. Las socias no tienen experiencia en grupos solidarios  pero saben como manejar fondos y crecer con ellos y también son gente responsable y honesta.
texts.en:
The group " Temporal" is maD. up of 12 partners and is represented by Maria Antonieta. The majority of the group is dedicated to such activities as public transportation and food, pastry and beverage sales. The businesses always prosper if they have enthusiasm and a willingness to work. For this reason, the group partners do not fear the competition. The purpose of this loan is to purchase supplies and materials to increase and improve their businesses and offer clients a better quality of service and products, which will improve profits and the quality of life for their families. The members do not have experience with support groups, but they know how to manage money and grow their businesses with it. They also are responsible and honest people.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Gertrudis

texts.es:
Gertrudis es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.
Gertrudis es casada, tiene 48 años y 1 hijo, Gertrudis se dedica a la venta D. alfalfa que compra D. los productores, sus ventas los realiza D. tienda en tienda para lo cual cuenta con un carro. Además Gertrudis cría cuyes que venD. en los diferentes recreos.
Gertrudis necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. alfalfa.
Los sueños D. Gertrudis son mejorar su casa y tener a toda su familia unida.
texts.en:
Gertrudis is a member of the Wiñarisun Communal Bank, which means "Let's Grow" in Quechua. Gertrudis is 48 years old and married with one son. Gertrudis sells alfalfa that she buys from producers. She makes her sales by traveling from store to store, for which she needs a car. Gertrudis also raises guinea pigs that she sells in various "recreos" (privately owned village centers for recreation and food). Gertrudis needs a loan of 1,000 soles to invest in the purchase of alfalfa. Gertrudis dreams of making improvements to her home and of having her whole family united.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of alfalfa.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.
Yolanda es soltera, tiene 21 años y vive con sus padres, Yolanda viaja a los diferentes pueblos de la región en donde compra cuy y luego los vende en los recreos, restaurantes.
Yolanda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cuy.
Los sueños de Yolanda son tener un negocio estable y grande, tener un recreo turístico.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Communal Bank of Wiñarisun, which means "Let's Grow" in Quechua. Yolanda is 21 and single and lives with her parents. Yolanda travels to different towns in the region where she buys guinea pigs and later sells them in "recreos" (privately owned village centers for recreation and food) and restaurants. Yolanda needs a loan of 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of more guinea pigs. Yolanda dreams of having a large, stable business and of owning a recreo for tourists.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of guinea pigs.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.
Reyna es soltera, tiene 48 años y 2 hijos, Reyna vive en el distrito de Quinua en donde tiene una tienda en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Reyna vende ropa en épocas de fiestas y ferias.
Reyna necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo, aceite.
Reyna sueña con construir su casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho y seguir ampliando su negocio.
texts.en:
Reyna is a member of the Communal Bank of Wiñarisun, which means "Let's Grow" in Quechua. Reyna is 48 and single with two children. She lives in the Quinua District where she has a small store. She sells groceries, produce, and drinks every day of the week. Additionally, Reyna sells clothes in times of fairs and festivals. Reyna needs a loan of 2,000 soles to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, pasta and oil. Reyna dreams of constructing her own house in the city of Ayacucho and of continuing to build her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, sugar, pasta  and oil.

loans.name: Silvia  Elena

texts.es:
En el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Silvia P. con mucho esfuerzo se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual posee desde hace tres años con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su hogar y brindarle las condiciones de vida necesarias a sus hijos. Se dedica arduamente a asu actividad día a día y ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio. Ademas es importante destacar que ella posee conocimientos en la actividad de ganadería por lo que también puede desempeñarse en esta por medio de la crianza de ganado.

La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la mercadería ya que sus estantes se están agotando. Con este crédito se beneficia grandemente y beneficia a su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
For the past three years, in the city of Cinco Pinos, in the town of Chinandega, Mrs. Silvia Perez has dedicated herself and put all efforts toward a convenience store business. She wanted to able to provide support to her household and the necessary living conditions for her children. She works very hard everyday in order to make her business prosper. Additionally, it is important to mention that she possess cattle raising knowledge and she could work in this area as well. The reason she was lead to Ceprodel was to benefit from a credit line that could enable her to purchase merchandise to fill up her business' emptying shelves. This loan would greatly benefit herself and, specially, her family that needs so much support.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise purchase

loans.name: Jesus Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.es:
Es un banco comunal compuesto por 18 personas, la mayoría D. los clientes se dedican al comercio D. ganado, ropa, cosméticos, frutas y venta D. comidas.
LIDIA I. C..- Es la líder del banco D. emprendimiento, es una D. las fundadoras del banco.
La Sra. Lidia vive en el barrio Arco Iris del km.9, D. la localidad D. El Torno en el Departamento D. Santa Cruz, cuenta con casa propia, tiene como actividad la venta D. comida actividad que viene realizando desD. hace 2 años en su mismo domicilio.
Su esposo el Sr. German Moncada se dedica al transporte urbano. El objetivo D. ambos es comprarse un vehiculo propio.
HERNAN L.- Es el secretario del banco comunal, vive en el barrio Arco iris, en una casa alquilada, la actividad a la que se dedica, es el servicio D. transporte urbano con el que viene trabajando desD. hace unos 10 años.
El Sr. Hernán se encuentra en el quinto ciclo D. préstamo en este banco comunal, durante este tiempo ha demostrado responsabilidad, es D. esta manera que se le ha dado el cargo D. tesorero del banco.
Su esposa la Sra. Neneth Soruco se dedica al comercio y elaboración D. horneados en el mismo barrio en el que vive.
INGRID V. A..-  LA sra. Ingrid es la secretaria del banco comunal la cual vive en el mismo barrio que los anteriormente mencionados, en el barrio arco iris la Sra. Cuenta con casa propia, se dedica ala actividad D. peluquería con la cual trabaja desD. hace unos 2 años atrás.
Ella tiene 2 hijos y vive con su esposo el mismo que tiene como actividad D. chofer.
Su objetivo D. la Sra. Es ahorrar un poco mas D. dinero para colocar su propio salón D. belleza.
texts.en:
This community bank is composed of 18 members and the majority of its clients sells cattle, clothes, cosmetics, fruits and food in general. LIDIA I. C. is the bank's entrepreneurship leader and one of its founders. Lidia lives in the 9th Kilometer's Arco Iris municipality, situated in El Torno in the department of Santa Cruz. She owns her own home and from that location she has been selling cooked food for the past two years. Her husband, Mr. German Moncada, is engaged in urban transportation. Their main objective is to purchase their own vehicle. HERNAN L. is the community's bank secretary. He lives in Arco Iris in a rented house and, for the past ten years, he has maD. urban transportation his business activity. Mr. Hernan is in his fifth loan cycle with this community bank and during this period of time he has demonstrated to be a responsible person (eventually, he was named the bank's treasury officer.) His wife, Mrs. Neneth Soruco, sells and fabricates ornaments that are sold in the same neighborhood where she lives. INGRID V. A. is also the bank's secretary and she lives in the same municipality previously mentioned. Mrs. Cuenta owns her home and she has worked for a hair salon for the past two years. She has two sons and lives with her husband who is as a driver. Her objective is to be able to save some money to open up her own hair salon.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital growth

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.
Maximiliana es soltera, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Maximiliana viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región 4 veces por semana  en donde vende ropa y de las ferias compra animales que vende en el camal. Además Maximiliana vende comida en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad.
Maximiliana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de faldas, chompas, blusas.
Los sueños de Maximiliana son tener un local estable y comprar un terreno para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a member of the Wiñarisun Communal Bank, which means "Let's Grow" in Quechua. Maximiliana is 31-years-old and single with 2 children. Four times a week, Maximiliana travels to different regional fairs where she sells clothes and buys livestock to sell. Maximiliana also sells food in the market bought wholesale in the city. Maximiliana needs a loan of 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of skirts, sweaters and blouses. Maximiliana dreams of having a stable and of buying a plot of land for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of skirts, sweaters and blouses.

loans.name: Rahmat Rasheed Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Rahmat baji is the wife of R. A.. They have resided in Riwind, Pakistan for the past 15 years. R. A. has a motor workshop where he repairs all types of vehicles. Rahmat baji is the mother of two sons. Both of her sons are involved in their father’s workshop. 

Rahmat baji stays at home and embroiders dresses. She has been in this business for the past 4 years. She collects a good number of orders from her neighbors and relatives. She is applying for a loan to buy repairing tools for her husband’s motor workshop. 

She is the leader of a group of women in her locality. Bilquis baji want a loan to buy spare parts for vehicles to sell. Rehana baji and Rukhsana baji each want a loan to buy buffalos for their milk-selling businesses. Saeedi baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business.  

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy tools for a motor workshop

loans.name: Elba Lidia

texts.es:
En el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Elba H.  con gran esfuerzo se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual posee a raíz de sus esfuerzos vendiendo todo tipo de productos desde comestibles hasta productos personales.

Es de importancia destacar que la señora Elba al haber iniciado su negocio hace cuatro años ha logrado surtirlo de productos y por esta razón anhela continuar mejorando las condiciones. Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los productos y así continuar en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Cinco Pinos, city of Chinadega, Mrs. Elba Hernandez has been applying all her efforts into a convenience store she owns which offers all sorts of products ranging from food to personal care items. It is important to note that Mrs. Elba started this business four years ago, and throughout this time spam she was able to build up stock merchandise. Because she wishes to continue improving her living conditions, she decided to approach Cepodrel in order to benefit from a credit line that would be used to purchase additional products and provide the support her store needs to continue in business.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Vicenta es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.
Vicenta es casada, tiene 56 años y 6 hijos, Vicenta tiene un puesto en el mercado central en donD. venD. carne, los animales los compra en las ferias D. la región y luego los beneficia, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su esposo.
Vicenta necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cerdos, carneros.
El sueño D. Vicenta es mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Vicenta is a member of the Wiñarisun Communal Bank, which means "Let's Grow" in Quechua. Vicenta is 56-years-old and married with 6 children. Vicenta has a position in the central market selling meat. She buys her livestock at regional fairs and later sells them. She is assisted in this activity by her spouse. Vicenta is requesting a loan of 1000 soles that will be invested in the purchase of pigs and rams. Vicenta's dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of pigs and rams.

loans.name: Villa Cumaravi Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “VILLA CUMARAVI”, es una de las mas  antiguas, pertenece a la familia de  pro-mujer hace ya mas de diez años,  cumpliendo con 21 ciclos de crédito, esta  se encuentra en la zona de Senkata, de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha  cuenta con 14 miembros activos y han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito. Un grupo muy particular ya que tienen a un varón como presidente de la asociación, a diferencia de los demás grupos. 
Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación como ser; la elaboración y venta de comida, venta de dulces y otras golosinas en puestos, otras  tienen tiendas de barrio y algunos son artesanos. La asociación Villa Cumaravi afirma que necesitan mayor capital para la compra productos al por mayor para aumentar sus ventas, para obtener mayores ganancias con el único objetivo de mejorar la situación económica de sus hogares.
texts.en:
The association, so-called 'Villa Cumaravi', is one of the oldest, and has belonged to the family of pro-women for more than 10 years now. It has reached 21 cycles of credit, and is found in the zone of Senkata, in the city of El Alto, which at this date counts 14 active members and has demonstrated to be an organised group, in terms of loan payments. It is a very individual group, now that the members have a man as president of the association, which is different to the rest of the groups. Different businesses exist within the assocation, such as preparation and sale of food, sales of sweets and other candies in stalls, others have suburban shops and some are artesans. The association Villa Cumaravia states that they need more capital to buy products, mainly to increase their sales, to obtain better earnings, with the sole objective of improving the economic situation of their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for their businesses

loans.name: Nargis Wazir Shah Group

texts.en:
Nargis baji is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been a citizen of Riwind, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband, W. S., has been selling vegetables for the past 6 years. Nargis baji helps to share his financial burden  by sewing clothes. She takes order from her neighbors and charges them $2 per dress. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell. 

She is the leader of a group of women in her locality. Googi baji wants a loan to buy razors and scissors for her barber shop. Shahida baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy bangles to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
Hace diez años aproximadamente la asociación “Los Ángeles” forma parte de  la familia de Pro-Mujer, grupo formado por 14 mujeres, que al haber podido construir una actividad propia, están seguras que tienen mejores oportunidades de éxito.
Casi todas casadas y con un promedio de 4 hijos, de distintas edades. Las actividades dentro el grupo son varias, Jacinta por ejemplo se dedica a la venta de papa y chuño, otras de sus compañeras venden comida, tambien existe la venta de ropa en tiendas, venta de adornos, venta de helados. La asociación Los Ángeles actualmente trabaja en el centro focal de Senkata,  necesitan capital para invertir en la compra de mercadería e insumos, de este modo generar ingresos para el sustento diario de estas familias
texts.en:
For approximately 10 years the assocation 'Los Ángeles' has formed part of the family of Pro-Mujer, a group formed by 14 women, which, with the ability to construct their own activity, they are sure that they have better opportunities of success. Nearly all the women are married, and with an average of 4 children, of different ages. The activities within the group are various. Jacinta for example sells potatoes and tubers, some of her other companions sell food, as well the sale of clothing, sale of ornaments, and sale of ice cream. The association Los Ángeles actually works in the focal point of Senkata, and need capital to invest in the purchase of groceries and consumables, and by this mode generate earnings for the daily maintenance of these families.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and consumables

loans.name: Sr. De Torrechayoc – Mototaxistas. Group

texts.es:
Este banco es denominado “SR. DE TORRECHAYOC”; lleva el nombre del santo patrón de la provincia de Urubamba, y este banco lo conforman 11 miembros, todos ellos viven en la provincia de Urubamba, todos son casados y tienen hijos menores.

Estos nuevos socios son dueños de sus propios vehículos de modalidad - mototaxis, estos prestan servicio público en la provincia de Urubamba y es muy común puesto a que Urubamba es pequeña y de calle afirmadas y angostas, ellos adecuaron sus motos con una especie de carrocería y de este modo, pasó hacer un medio de transporte rápido y económico; nuestros socios quieren invertir el préstamo otorgado en el mantenimiento de sus mototaxis, mejorar la apariencia y de está manera dar un mejor servicio y mayor vida sus herramientas de trabajo, en el caso de las socias mujeres  una de ellas lo alquila a una tercera persona.

Estos socios están muy agradecidos y realmente valoran el apoyo otorgado por este medio y ellos se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos en las fechas establecidas.
texts.en:
This bank is named after the town's patron saint, "SR. DE TORRECHAYOC". This bank is located in the state of Urubamba and is composed of 11 members. They all live in Urubamba. They are all married and they all have young children. These new members all have their own individual business which is driving 'mototaxis.' This type of transportation in Urubamba is very common since the streets are very narrow and tight. This type of transportation is very fast and economical. Our members would like to invest this loan in the maintenance of their 'mototaxis' so that they can provide a better service to their clients and make sure their 'mototaxis' will last as long as possible since they represent their work tools. In the case of the women who are members, one of them is renting her 'mototaxi' to a third person. These members are all very thankful and they trully appreciate all the support given to them. They have all agreed on making the payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mototaxi maintenance

loans.name: Alejandra Virginia

texts.es: La Sra., Alejandra reside en el barrio Rene Cisneros junto a su esposa e hijos son cuatro de 10, 12,15 y 20 años de edad, que están estudiando, su negocio, tiene 45 años de edad, su negocio es una pulpería que administra junto con su esposo, pero también palmea tortillas, vende frijoles cosidos, nacatamales y los fines de semana hace sopa, tiene que generar otros ingresos para poder ayudar a sus hijos que sigan con la educación ya que todo esta caro. Con esta solicitud de crédito es para hacer mejoras a su casa y mejorar la infraestructura del negocio. Sus planes a futuro es comprar un vehiculo que le facilite el traslado de sus compras.
texts.en:
La senora Alejandra resides in the neighbourhood of Rene Cisneros, together with her husband and 4 children. Her cihldren are 10, 12, 15 and 20 years old, and are studying. She is 45 years old, and has a local store which she administers together with her husband. However, she also makes tortillas, sells cooked beans and tamales, and on weekends she makes soup. She has to generate other income to be able to help her children continue their education, as everything is expensive. With this loan she will make improvements to her house, and improve the infrastructure of the business. Her plan for the future is to buy a vehicle that will help her with the transport of her purchases.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for business

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina is a native of Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. She is already 54 years old, but she is still a very active woman. She has six children, three of whom are still schooling. She is applying for a loan amounting to PHP 14,000 for the purchase of additional scrap materials for her recycling business. She said she has many suppliers of scrap, that's why she needs additional capital so she can buy the scrap from her dealers.

Aside from her scrap business she is also engaged in selling fruit in the market, as her store is along the highway, where travelers pass by. She has many "suki" (loyal customers) already. She hopes she can expand both of her present businesses so she can help her children finish their desired courses.

loans.use: for purchased of additional scrap materials

loans.name: Siempre Unidos Group

texts.es:
Este banco lleva como nombre  “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”, sus socios son un total de 17 miembros,  ellos viven en el distrito de san jerónimo, nuestros socios tienen diferentes actividades, para lo cuál requieren el préstamo.

Los socios se dedican al comercio, muchos de ellos tiene pequeñas tiendas de abarrotes, otro  grupo tiene puestos de ventas de comida rápida, otros socios tiene pequeñas ferreterías, y otros tiene tiendas de venta de plásticos, otras socias tiene criaderos de truchas. Nuestros socios desean esté préstamo como un capital para poder abastecer sus tiendas y pequeños negocios y así convocar mayor número de clientes y que sus negocios puedan crecer mas.

Los socios valoran y agradecen de manera especial el préstamo otorgado por este medio comprometiéndose de esta manera a pagar las cuotas establecidas y el total del préstamo en el tiempo determinado.
texts.en:
This bank's name translates to "Always United". They are 17 members. They all live in the district of San Jeronimo. Our members are involved in sales. Some have small convenience stores, some have fast-food stands, some have small hardware stores, some sell plastics, and some raise trout. Our members would like to use this loan in order to stock up and increase inventory for their stores and small businesses. By doing this, they hope to attract more clients and hopefully grow even more. These members are very thankful and very appreciative of this loan. They have agreed to pay the monthly amount and the total loan amount on time.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Lucia Margarita Palacios

texts.es: Lucia Margarita P. vive en Zacatecoluca departamento la Paz, Lucia tiene 41 años edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos que han tenido que dejar sus estudios por falta de ingresos en la familia. Si bien el esposo de Lucia  provee económicamente, ya que se dedica a la plantación. Lucia se dedica a la venta de frutas en Zacatecoluca hace 21 años pero con mucho esfuerzo y perseverancia, en estos últimos meses ha logrado expandir sus ventas en el interior del país llevando de sus frutas a San Miguel y San Salvador. Ahora Lucia solicita un crédito para compra de mangos; ya que esta época en El Salvador se da mucho esta fruta y los clientes la buscan.
texts.en:
Lucia Margarita P. lives in Zacatecoluca in the state of La Paz. Lucia is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and two sons who have been unable to finish their education due to lack of money. Lucia's husband is able to provide for his family since he has a good job as a construction worker in a housing project. Lucia has been selling fruit in Zacatecoluca over the past 21 years with a lot of effort and perseverance. During these last couple of months, they have been able to sell more fruit in other areas such as San Miguel and San Salvador. Lucia is now requesting for a loan since she would like to buy mangos which are in season in El Salvador and they are in high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase mangos

loans.name: Sr De Los Milagros De Chimpahuaylla Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se denomina  “SR D. LOS MILAGROS D. CHIMPAHUAYLLA”, cuenta con 13 socios los mismos que viven a 38 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco; el barrio al que ellos representan se llama Chimpahuaylla, estos socios corresponden al segundo ciclo D. trabajo con su banco comunal.


Los socios están dedicados en su mayoría a diferentes actividades en las que tienen el comercio minorista, ellos venden productos como verduras, frutas, cereales, abarrotes a los diferentes mercados D. la ciudad, nuestros socios compran los productos directamente a los agricultores y los distribuyen por todos los mercados, es por esta razón que ellos desean el préstamo para poder comprar grandes cantidades D. productos y así los puedan venderlos en las diferentes ferias dominicales..

Los socios están agradecidos y valoran el préstamo otorgado por este medio comprometiéndose D. esta manera a pagar las cuotas establecidas y el total del préstamo en el tiempo determinado.
texts.en:
This bank's name is “SR D. LOS MILAGROS D. CHIMPAHUAYLLA” which translates to Lord of Miracles of Chimpahuaylla. It's composed of 13 members located about 38 minutes outsiD. of the city of Cusco. The area or neighborhood they represent is called Chimpahuaylla. All of these members are involved in some type of commerce such as selling vegetables, fruit, cereals and groceries to the many different supermarkets in the area. Our members buy products directly from the farmers and then distribute them to the supermarkets. This is why they need a loan in order to purchase in bulk and then sell at the local sunday food fairs. Our members are very thankful and appreciative of this loan. They have agrreed to make the monthly payments and to pay the whole loan amount on time.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, fruit, cereals and groceries

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es: Ana Vilma H. D. G., vive en Lourdes Colon, Vilma es madre soltera, vive con sus dos hijos menores D. edad. Vilma se dedica hace cuatro años a la venta D. Cosméticos y ropa D. manera ambulante, es decir casa por casa , Vilma se decidió a llevar asi su negocio para no descuidarse D. sus hijos;  ya que todas las mañanas cuando ellos se van a la escuela , Vilma aprovecha para ir a ofrecer sus productos tocando D. puerta en puerta, y en la tarD. cuando sus hijos ya están en casa ella se queda al pendiente D. ellos,  pero sin dejar su negocio a un lado, ya que los vecinos y clientes D. las colonias aledañas saben que por las tardes Vilma venD. en su casa; toda su variedad D. productos en lociones y ropa. Ana Vilma solicita un crédito para comprar mercadería y poner D. manera formal un pequeño bazar en su casa.
texts.en:
Ana Vilma H. D. G. lives in Lourdes Colon. Vilma is a single mother and she lives with her two young children. Vilma has been selling cosmetics and clothes from door to door over the past 4 years. Vilma decided to do this so that she can be attend to her children at all time. This way, when her kids are at school, she can take advantage of selling her products from door to door. Once the children are off school, she then takes care of them. This doesn't mean that she ignores her business since all the neighbors in the area know or are aware that Vilma sells from her home in the afternoons. She sells a variety of products such as lotion and clothes. Ana Vilma is requesting this loan in order to purchase more products (stock-up) so that one day she will be able to have a designated area in her home where she puts all her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Flor Del Carmen

texts.es: Flor del Carmen U. S., vive en Lourdes en el Occidente de El Salvador es una mujer casada con 42 años de edad, vive con su esposo y un hijo. Flor es una mujer trabadora y un pilar en la familia, hace ocho años Flor tiene la idea de poner una tienda en su casa para apoyar a su esposo y ayudar en los gastos de la familiares; pero ahora esa tienda que era hace ocho años ha ido creciendo por el espíritu emprendedor y la amabilidad que Flor muestra con sus clientes, ahora Flor también vende productos de papelería como cuadernos, lapiceros  plumones, ella trata de surtir su tienda con los productos que sus clientes le demandan. Flor solicita un crédito para compra de mercadería para su tienda, ya que quiere seguir creciendo y ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Flor del Carmen U. S. lives in Lourdes in the west part of El Salvador. She's married and she's 42 years old. She lives with her husband and son. Flor is a hard-working woman and a pillar of strength to her family. About 8 years ago, Flor decided to open up a small store which she runs out of her own home so that she could help her husband pay the monthly bills. Now, that same store is growing and growing due to the enterprising spirit and amiability Flor demonstrates to all her clients. She's also selling school supplies such as notebooks and pens. She tries to stock-up her store with all the products that her clients demand. Flor is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise for her store since she would like to keep growing and to keep offering the best products to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Grinssis Del Carmen

texts.es: Grinssis Del Carmen V. C. vive en San Martin ubicado en el oriente del país, Grinssis es madre soltera, una mujer luchadora que se las ingenia día a día para poder cubrir las necesidades de su hogar, en la casa de Grinssis viven sus tres hijos que son menores de edad y su hermana , que es de un gran apoyo para esta mujer, Grinssis monto una tienda en su casa pero al contar con la ayuda de su hermana Grinssis decidió salir de casa dedicándose a la venta de pollos y embutidos en el mercado de San Martin. Ahora Grinssis solicita un crédito para surtir ambos negocios, ya que su venta de pollo tiene mucha demanda y muchos clientes le solicitan mayor cantidad de pollo de la que su capacidad económica puede cubrir. Con este préstamo esta mujer luchadora lograra expandir sus negocios y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Grinssis Del Carmen V. C. lives in San Martin, located in the east of the country. Grinssis is a single mother, a born fighter who thinks up ingenious ideas day to day to be able to cover the necessities of her home. In Grinssis's house live her 3 young children and her sister. Grinssis decided to leave home, dedicating herself to the sale of chicken and sausages in the San Martin market. Now Grinssis is seeking a loan to stock up both businesses, now that there is a great demand for her chickens and many clients are asking for a larger quantity of chickens than her economy capacity can cover. With this loan this fighting woman will achieve the expansion of her businesses and will obtain better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to sell at market

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora L. is a native of Tugas, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. They were blessed with three children. She is engaged in raising pigs and hog-fattening. And for all the time of her business, Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative has been a consistent partner.

The business she is in is not only a thing that she likes to do, but at the same time allows her to earn an income. That's why she has requested a loan amounting to PHP 30,000. This is solely for the purchase of animal feed and vitamins. She is hoping that her piggery would grow and expand and would be able to supply meat shops in neighboring towns.

loans.use: Capital for her piggery; purchase of animal feed and vitamins

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina A. is a resident of Punta Sulong, Baliangao, Misaims Occidental, 56 years old and married to Mr. Artemio A., a fisherman. They were blessed with three children; two of her children already have a job. They have a small Sari-Sari (convenience) store at their residence. She started her small business from their own capital. Her husband also manages their fish cage.

Paglaum conducted an orientation at their Barangay (township); she attended the orientation and she was interested. She joined the training and become a member. She was recognized on October 15, 2004 under Micro-finance Program of Paglaum and took advantage of the credit services offered by the program. Her 1st loan was Php 3,000 and was used as additional capital for their Sari-Sari Store.

She is thankful that she became a member of Paglaum for it can help those who are need, especially in terms of finances. Thus, thru Paglaum she learned how to save money out of their income. According to Mrs. Celestina, the product that she was most interested in with Paglaum is their insurance benefit because it is tested and proven.

Celestina is now on her 8th loan and her present loan amounts to Php 5,000 which will be used for additional purchase of canned goods, assorted bath & laundry soap, shampoos, noodles, and many other items. Her hopes and aspirations in life are just to expand and develop her business and have a decent living for the family.

loans.use: Additinal grocery supplies such as canned goods, milk, etc.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Mrs. Florita L. has been a recognized member of Paglaum under our microfinance program since May 29, 2007. She is 53 years old, married, and blessed with three children all of them already married. She’s living at Guinabot, Sapang Dalaga. Her husband is a carpenter and engaged in farming. She admits that it is not easy for them to live nowadays because the income of her husband is not enough for their daily needs, especially food. There are also times that her husband has no work. She decided to put up a Sari-Sari Store; in that way she can help her husband support the family. But she has only a little amount of money for starting capital.

She heard from her friend that Paglaum is offering credit services at a very low interest rate. She did not hesitate to join because she said to herself, maybe Paglaum is the answer to our needs especially for finances. She received a loan amounting to PHP 3,000 as her 1st loan, used as additional capital for the Sari-Sari Store.

She says Paglaum helps her small business grow, and helps her to develop herself as a person. As a member, she also obtains information regarding savings and investment, insurance, and how to manage a business.

Florita is now on her 3rd loan and is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 as additional capital for her sari-sari store to purchase additional grocery items such as rice, canned goods, assorted bath & laundry soaps.

Her hopes and aspiration in life are to be able to expand and develop her business and earn enough income to build a decent home and have always a harmonious family life.

loans.use: Additional grocery materials such as food, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Lázaro

texts.es: Lázaro H. A. vive en San Luis Talpa, departamento La Paz; junto  a su mamá y su hijo. A Lázaro se le ha sido muy difícil sostener a su pequeña familia ya que Lázaro solo cuenta con un nivel educativo básico, solo ha logrado conseguir trabajos eventuales, los cuales no han sido de mucha ayuda para los gatos fijos que representa su hijo al ir a la escuela;  pero con el apoyo de su madre Lázaro se decidió a poner una pequeña tienda, que es atendida por su madre y el. Lázaro pretende que  con el crédito, podrá surtir su tienda. Como se puede ver en la foto la tienda de Lázaro cuenta con muy pocos productos, en su mayoría golosinas que el margen de ganancias de estas apenas es de $0.05ctvs. por unidad. Lázaro solicita un crédito para comprar mercadería que le permita lograr ganancias visibles para el crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Lazaro Hernandez A. lives in San Luis Talpa, department of La Paz, with his mother and his son. It has been very difficult for Lazaro to support his small family because he only has a basic educational level and can only get temporary work, his jobs have done little to help cover the fixed costs of his son's education. With the support from his mother, Lazaro decided to open a small store which both of them work in. Lazaro claims that with the loan he can supply the store. As can be seen in the photograph, Lazaro's store has very little merchandise, mostly candy which have a very small profit margin, barely $.05 per piece. Lazaro is requesting a loan to be able to buy merchandise that will allow him to make more visible profit for the growth of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to supply his store.

location.town: San Luis Talpa,  departamento de La Paz.

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
Mrs. Milagrosa B. is one of the active members of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative in Barangay Landing, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, a section known by the name of PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People). She was recognized July 11, 2005. She is married and has five children, and all of them are already married. She has a small Sari-Sari Store at their residence which she started with the capital lent from the Cooperative amounting to PHP 3,000.

She is grateful that she became a member of Paglaum because of their products and services offered to the community that can help those who are in need. She was very interested in the insurance benefits especially at her age. As of now, she’s on her sixth loan amounting to PHP 7,000, granted for additional purchased of basic grocery items for her Sari-Sari (variety) store, such as canned goods, assorted noodles, seasonings, laundry and bath soap and many others suitable for household needs. Now her business is growing compared to before when she has only a small amount of capital. Through Paglaum she also learned the importance of savings.

Her hopes and aspiration in life are to expand her business for the future of her grandchildren, to support their education and have a decent home for the family.

loans.use: purchase of additional grocery items such as canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline R. lives at Sapang Dalaga, MIsamis, Occidental, Philippines. She is 31 years old and married to Joseph R.. They were blessed with 2 children; both are not yet in school. She is an active and regular member in Paglaum Cooperative. Her husband is a fish and ballot vendor in their place. They have also a sari-sari (convenience) store with starting capital of Php 10,000 and have operated it for almost 10 years already. The business establishment is situated in the middle of their barangay (township).
	
Apparently, the business status is progressive. They are requesting Php 14,000 for additional grocery items. With the help of her husband the business grows. All their daily needs are taken care of from their business income and they are preparing for the future of their siblings. As for the loan they are requesting, it will help them to have more capital to buy more stock for their business because they are planning to extend their sari-sari store in the future.

loans.use: additional capital for purchase of grocery Items

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth D., 50 years old, is married and lives in Barra, Dipolog City. She has 3 children. She is engaged in retailing veterinary supplies and feeds for the past ten years. Her husband has no permanent job and he just helps her in the business. 

She has been a member of PMPC since 2007. After applying for several loans, and repaying them promptly, she is now applying for PHP 14,000 for the purpose of having additional capital for said business and acquisition of feed. Shown in the picture is Mrs. D. with her stocks of veterinary supplies and feeds.

She is looking forward to seeing the positive outcome of the existing business in order to help her children as well as to others in need.

loans.use: additional capital for purchasing feed

location.town: Minaog, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Ofelia Del Carmen

texts.es: Ofelia del Carmen C. vive en Santa Tecla, departamento La Libertad. Ofelia es madre soltera, vive con su hijo y su madre que es un apoyo para esta mujer que se encuentra sola en las responsabilidades económicas. Ofelia y su madre son un gran equipo,  que a pesar de de las adversidades y la competencia en  la zona han logrado sostener su tiene por muchos años pero con la necesidad de superación y salir a adelante ahora no solo se dedican a la tienda, ha Ofelia le surgió la idea de poner un comedor a unas cuadras de la casa donde viven;  ya que es una zona muy transitada. Así es como ahora este equipo de madre e hija han logrado sostener su tienda y ahora tener un comedor con mucha afluencia de clientes. Ahora Ofelia solicita un crédito para compra de mercadería para su tienda y  comedor ya que su cantidad de clientes va a aumentando y necesita abastecerse de productos para su cocina.
texts.en:
Ofelia del Carmen C. lives in Santa Tecla, department of La Libertad. Ofelia is a single mother, lives with her son and her mother who provides some support to this woman who finds herself bearing the financial responsibilities alone. Ofelia and her mother are a great team, in spite of the adversities and the competition in the area, they have been able to maintain their store for many years. With the desire to excel and get ahead they are now not only taking care of the store, but Ofelia had an idea of also opening a diner several blocks from where they live, since it is a high traffic area. This mother/daughter team has maintained their store and now have a diner with a large client base. Ofelia is now requesting a loan to purchase merchandise for her store and diner since the number of customers is increasing and she needs to increase the supply of products for her kitchen.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her store.

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Silvia Verónica

texts.es: Silvia Verónica D. M. vive en Cojutepeque departamento D. Cuscatlán,  vive con su esposo. Tras muchos unos años tomando experiencia en la profesión Verónica a sus 27 años decidió poner su salón D. belleza, alquilando un local en el mercado central donD. ella vive, Si bien el salón D. belleza D. Verónica es pequeño genera empleo para dos señoras que trabajan con ella, ya que la afluencia D. gente en la zona es granD.. El sueño D. Verónica es alquilar un espacio más en el mercado ya que a veces los clientes se van porque no hay quien los atienda,  ya que no son suficiente tres personas trabajando al mismo tiempo, es por ello que Verónica quiere ampliar su salón y contratar más personal, para que ningún cliente se les vaya. Verónica solicita un crédito para capital D. trabajo y en la inversión D. ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Silvia Veronica D. M. lives in Cojutepeque, department of Cuscatlan, she lives with her husband. After many years of learning the traD., at 27 years old Veronica decided to open her own beauty salon, renting a space in the central market where she lives. Her salon is small but due to the large turnout of people in the area, it generates employment for two ladies that work with her. Veronica wants to rent another space in the market because at times her customers leave due to her not being able to proviD. someone to help them, three people working at the same time are not sufficient. Veronica wants to enlarge her salon and hire more personnel so that she would not loose any more customers. Veronica is requesting a loan to be used as working capital in the investment of enlarging her salon.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Salvador Mauricio

texts.es: Salvador Mauricio D. vive en Zaragoza departamento La Libertad , Mauricio tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su esposa, su hijo y mamá. La Familia D. se dedica a la producción de pan, La panadería “La Fuente” como la ha llamado Mauricio tienen 7 años de experiencia. Es la favorita de muchos en la zona, La panadería la fuente le vende a muchas tiendas de colonias aledañas al por mayor, es por ello que Mauricio se decidió a solicitar a un crédito ya que necesitan abastecerse de materia prima para poder sacar más producción, ya que no alcanza sus producciones diarias, para satisfacer las necesidades de muchos clientes que buscan de su pan. Mauricio solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima para su negocio.
texts.en:
Salvador Mauricio D. lives in the Zaragoza department of La Libertad. Mauricio is 31 years old, lives with his wife, his son and his mother. The D. family is dedicated to the production of bread, the bakery "La Fuente," which is what Mauricio calls it, has 7 years of experience. It is the favorite of many people in the area, the La Fuente Bakery sells to a lot of stores in the neighboring areas, which is why Mauricio decided to ask for a loan since they ned to stock up on materials to be able to get more production, since they cannot reach their daily productions to satisfy the needs of many clients who look for their bread. Mauricio is asking for a loan for materials for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materials for his bakery

loans.name: Vilma Rosibel

texts.es: Vilma Rosibel G. L., vive en Santa Tecla departamento de La Libertad. A sus cortos 19 años por problemas económicos en su familia Vilma a tenido que dejar a un lado su gran sueño de ir a la Universidad, Vilma ya termino de cursar el bachillerato, y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar  puso su propio negocio de venta de ropa al por mayor y al detalle en su casa , Vilma viaja hasta el oriente del país a comprar mercadería ya que es allí donde la encuentra más barata y de esta manera ella tendrá mejores precios para ofrecer a sus clientes. El sueño de Vilma es abrir un pequeño local donde pueda contratar a alguien que le ayude en su negocio para que ella puede seguir estudiando una carrera en la universidad, pero hoy por hoy es solo un sueño ya que necesita de muchos ahorros para hacer esa inversión es por eso que Vilma solita un crédito para adquirir más mercadería y obtener mayores ganancias que sirvan para poder cumplir su sueño de ampliar su negocio y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Vilma Rosibel G. L. lives in the Santa Tecla neighborhood of La Libertad. At the young age of 19 Vilma has had to set aside her dream of going to the university because of her family’s economic problems. Vilma has already finished high school and when she found herself in need of work, she started her own business selling clothing at wholesale and retail prices from her home. Vilma travels to the western part of the country to purchase merchandise because it is much cheaper there. This way she will be able to offer her customers better prices. Vilma’s dream is to open a small store where she can hire someone to help her with her business so she can continue her studies at the university, but, as of now, it is merely a dream because she would need to save a lot of money in order to make such an investment. For this reason Vilma is applying for a loan to purchase more merchandise and obtain greater profits which will help her achieve her dream of expanding her business and continuing her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (clothing)

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Jebta

texts.en:
Jebta Jacop sells beer at a bar and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Jebta is 35 years old and is widowed.  She has two children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build house and to pay school fees for her children. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a house and pay the school fees for her children

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
At young age of 15 Jenelyn was exposed already to a difficult task of being the breadwinner of the family. She experienced sell rice but her father collected collected every single cent she earns. Her father used to promise that he will buy "carabao" (water buffalo) for her future, but it was never realized.

She is requesting P5,000 to start selling rice again. She likes to earn money on her own to augment the daily needs of her family.  She dreams a good future someday. Through ASHI, she learned how to be an achiever and a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: Purchasing of 2 sacks of rice and weighing scale

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Mrs. Angelita F. hails from the beautiful province of Antique. She is 34 years old, married and blessed with three children. 

She is requesting for a loan of P 5,000 as initial capital to purchase two sacks of rice, weighing scale, and plastic bags to start a rice trading business. She knows that rice is the best product that needs by the people. Her customers are the people in the village.  She will also sell mongo beans vendor when in the season. 

She plans that after a year she will have more stock of rice to meet the needs of her cutomers. She dreams that her children will finish their studies and hope that they will not experience the hardships she went through. She also dreams to have a comfortable and concrete house in the future.

Through ASHI, she learned to accept her mistakes and apologize to the person involved. She likes to thank Kiva Lenders who will sponsor her loan.

loans.use: Initial capital for buying and selling of rice

loans.name: Zarafshon

texts.ru: Зардакова Зарафшон проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст 48  лет.Замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Работает портнихой уже два года. Благодоря имеющемуся опыту может открыть ателье , которое и планирует открыть в данное время. Но для этого, она решила получить кредит и купить швейную машинку и оверлог.Таким образом она сможет привлечь дополнительную работников и создать дополнительные рабочие места. А погасить кредит сможет в течение 18 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zarafshon Z. lives in Dushanbe. She is 48 years old and is married with five children. He has two years of experience of working as a tailor, which allows her to open a workshop. She is applying for a loan in order to buy a sewing machine and an overlocker. This would allow her to create new jobs and attract new work force. She would be able to pay off the loan within 18 months. .

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and an overlocker

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.ru: Абдуназарова Шаходат жительница города ДУшанбе. Возраст 22 года . Имеет высшее образование. Но занимается шитьем. Работает портнихой уже пять лет. Обратилась за кредитом для того, чтобы купить Вышивальную машинку. Это даст возможность ей увеличить ассортимент предлагаемых услуг. То есть она сможет вышивать платья , что привлечет новых клиентов. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Shahodat A., 22, lives in Dushanbe. She has a college education, but works as a tailor. She has been tailoring for five years. Shahodat applied for this loan to purchase an embroidery machine. With the new machine, Shahodat will be able to offer additional services and attract new customers. Shahodat will repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an embroidery machine

loans.name: Sharafnisso

texts.ru: Акрамова Шарафниссо проживает в районе Джалоллидини Руми. Возраст 51 год. Вдова , у которой осталось четверо детей на руках. Имеет средне -специальное образование. Но работает не бухгалтером , а бизнесменом на рынке. Торгует продуктами питания. Торговая точка арендована . Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sharafnisso A. lives in Dzhalollidini Rumi. She is a fifty-one years old widow with 4 children. Sharafnisso is an accountant by education, but, due to lack of professional jobs, she rents a stall and sells food at a local market. Sharafnisso will use this loan to increase the volume of goods she sells. Sharafnisso plans to repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the sales volume

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Додов Дильшод проживает в районе Джалоллидини РУми. Возрат 36 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Имеет среднее образование. Работает на рынке , торгует продуктами питания. Опыт в сфере бизнеса составляет уже два года. Имеет небольшой товарооборот, который планирует увеличить , способом получения кредита. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Dilshod D. lives in Jalollidini Rumi. He is 36 years old and is married with four children. He has a high school diploma and sells groceries at the market. He has been in this business for two years. He would like to increase cash flow.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Syeda Shoqat Ali Group

texts.en:
Syeda baji, the wife of S. A., runs a tea stall in Vehari, Pakistan. Syeda baji owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past 15 years. Syeda baji is the mother of two sons. Her eldest son is an electrician and the younger son works in a factory on a monthly wage. Syeda baji is applying for a loan to buy tea, sugar and milk for her husband’s tea stall. 

She is the leader of a group of women in her locality. Afzal baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Sheema baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Ghafooran baji wants a loan to buy masonry tools. Allah Rakhi baji wants a loan to buy goats for her livestock business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a tea stall

loans.name: Anees Zulfiqar Ali Group

texts.en:
Anees baji has lived in Vehari, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Anees baji is an uneducated woman because she comes from a poor family and her parents couldn’t pay her educational expenses. Anees baji is married to Z. A., who delivers construction supplies from his cart, which he transports from one place to another. He has been doing this work for the past 5 years. Anees baji is applying for a loan to buy a new cart because his old cart has become rough. 

She is the leader of a group of women in her locality. Raseesa baji wants a loan to buy lentils, cooking oil and spices for her food business. Nazia baji and Raeesa baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. Shakeela Rani baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: Ana Patricia de 32 años de edad, es soltera, tiene 2 hijos estudiando, trabaja como jefa de personal en el Super San Antonio, con 12 horas laborales todos los dias, su dia libre es el miercoles, el que destina para resolver los problemas familiares, no posee vivienda, habita en casa de su mama, pero como ella es la unica que trabaja de la familia es quien esta mejorando la vivienda, es muy responsable y este noveno credito plantea que tambien lo pagara en menos tiempo para continuar con los creditos en AFODENIC, donde ha encontrado acogida, pues siempre halla apoyo cuando lo ha necesitado, ya que en una oportunidad su compralero presto la escritura de la casa a su mama saco un credito no lo pago y se fue con otra y ella tuvo que responsabilizarse a pagar y enregar la escritura a su mamá.
texts.en:
Ana Patricia is 32 years old, she is single and has 2 children who are studying, she works as chief of personnel at San Antonio supermarket. She works 12 hours every day, Wednesdays is her day off, and she dedicates this day to solve her family problems, she lives with her mom, because she doesn't have a house, but as she is the only one working at home, she is the one doing home improvements. She is very responsible and this ninth loan she is planing to pay it in less time than the term, to keep on with the credits from AFODENIC, where she has found support every time she needed. Some time ago her partner borrowed her mom's house deed to get a loan he never paid, then he left her for another woman and Ana Patricia had to pay his debt and her mom's deed.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her bedroom

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Don Luis Antonio, soltero, con 58 años de esda, tiene 12 años de trabajar en la Alcaldia Municipal como guarda de seguridad, con 7 hijos, de los cuales 3 estan en el ejercito y dan un aporte a la casa, una hija casada tambien habita con ellos, su compañera trabaja como conserje en la Administracion de Rentas, 3 hijos estudian los domingos la secundaria.  Con este credito pondra el techo a la construccion que logro levantar con el credito que hizo su compañera, pues para el es de suma importancia contar con una ampliacion mas de la casa, ya que sus hijos necesitan espacio y privacidad.  Con este cuarto credito podrá poner el techo y embaldozará el piso para un espacio con las minimas condiciones para habitar.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis Antonio is single and 58 years old. He has been working for 12 years as a security guard at the Municipality, he has 7 children, 3 of them are in the army and help with the house's expenses, one of his daughter who is married also lives with them. His life partner works as a super for the Administration of Rents, three of his children study high school on Sundays. With the loan he is requesting he will build ceiling to the previous construction he started with the loan his partner did. For him is very important to improve his house, because his kids need space and privacy. With this fourth credit he will build a roof and floor which are minimum living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a roof and floors for his home

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: El señor Salvador labora para una empresa en el área de producción, su esposa lo apoyo ya que también ella trabaja para tener una vida mas cómoda y sin apuros. Ellos están solicitando este crédito para la colocación de protecciones en puertas y ventanas de su casa; ya que les acaban de hacer entrega de su casita y necesitan de mayor seguridad para ellos y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Salvador works for a production company. His wife supports him, as she also works to have a comfortable life without being put in tight spots. They are asking for a loan to install protection in the doors and windows of their house, as they have just received the house and they need more security for themselves and their children.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installment of protection for their house

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha Lorena es casada, tiene 48 años de edad, adquirio una vivienda en el Residencial Bosques de Juigalpan donde desea realizar mejoras como son: anexo para la cocina, construccion de pantry y poner ceramica al piso que esta embaldozado, acutalmente esta habitando en casa de una hermana donde no tiene condiciones ni privacidad, su esposo trabaja en estados unidios y esta gestionando su jubilacion para trasladarse a su vivienda en Juigalpa, donde pasara su jubilacion con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, uno de 8 años estudiando el 3er grado de primaria y la otra actualmente en estados unidos estudiando la secundaria. Una vez que la vivienda preste las condiciones necesarias se trasladaran para Nicaragua a cumplir su sueño de vida, descansar junto a su esposa e hijos.  Doña Martha Lorena esta dispuesta a continuar mejorando su vivienda una vez que su esposo este en Nicaragua, ya que en estos momentos se les hace dificil estar atendiendo gastos familiares en 2 lugares.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena is married, she is 48 years old and bought a house at Residencial Bosque in Juigalpan that she wants to improve. She wants to add to her kitchen, build a pantry and build a ceramic tile floor. She is currently living at a sister's house where she lacks privacy.
