Her husband works in USA and is trying to get his retirement to move to his house in Juigalpan, where he expects to retire with his wife and kids, one is eight years old and this daughter studies high school in USA. Once the house is on good conditions he will move to Nicaragua to fulfill his dream living with his wife and children. Ms. Martha Lorena will keep on improving her house once his husband is in Nicaragua, because right now is difficult to spend on family expenses in both places.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving her kitchen, pantry and ceramic tile on the floors

loans.name: Maribel Del Rosario

texts.es: Maribel  de 36 años de edad, casada, con 2 hijas, ambas estudiando la secundaria, esta solicitando su 2do credito el cual utilizara para invertirlo en el mismo negocio con mas de un año de experiencia y manifiesta la profesora que el credito anterior le sirvio de mucho, pues con el pudo comprar de contado todo lo necesario para el trabajo donde diariamente tiene una venta de C$.1,000.00, quedandole una ganancia de C4.400.00 mas lo que se comen sus hijas, su esposo, la persona que le ayuda con el trabajo y ella, a la ayudante le paga C$.30.00 diarios; cuenta ademas con el apoyo de sus hijas quienes despues de clases le ayudan a prepara las cosas, ya que ella cuenta con una clientela fija.  Su esposo es tecnico en refrigeracion, pero no siempre tiene trabajo y ella tiene que sostener el hogar.  La profesora por la mañana da clases, por la tarde planifica las clases del dia siguiente y luego prepara todas cosas del negocio para vender por la noche.  Maribel expresa sentirse satisfecha con el credito brindado por AFODENIC y cancelara antes de la fecha para seguri mejorando su negocio comprando mesas y sillas y sus ingresos, ya que con el salario de maestro es dificil hacerle frente a la situacion del pais.
texts.en:
Maribel is 36 years old, she is married and is studying high school, she is requesting a 2nd credit to be invested on the same business where she has more than a year of experience. She says her previous loan helped her very much, because she was able to buy cash what she needed for the business. She has a daily gross sale of C$1,000.oo and C$400.oo net profit. Besides what her daughters, husband and people who help her on the business eat from the restaurant. She pays her helper C$30.oo daily. Her daughters also help her prepare food, after they get home from school because she has some fix customers. Her husband is a refrigerator technician, but he doesn't always have a job, so Maribel has to support her home. She is teacher and during the morning she gives lessons and in the afternoon she plans the lesson for the following day then she prepares everything to sell at night. Maribel is satisfied with the loan provided by AFODENIC and will pay before the term is over to keep on improving her business and buy tables and chairs and improve her income because the teacher's salary is not enough.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for her Fritanga - preparing meals - business

loans.name: Los Alamos De La Estación Group

texts.es:
Este banco se denominado “LOS ALAMOS DE LA ESTACION”;  En este grupo tenemos a un total de 13 socios, todos ellos naturales de la comunidad de Urcos, en la provincia de Quispicanchis;, estos socios realizan diferentes actividades.
Su principal actividad es el cultivos de papas, maíz, hortalizas, verduras, también están dedicados a la ganadería ellos compran animales mayores como son las vacas y toros, para el engorde y la producción de lácteos y la venta posterior de los animales vacunos, otro sector de nuestros socios especialmente las socias mujeres venden comidas elaboradas por ellas mismas en el mercado central, puesto que Urcos es un paradero obligatorio para los buses y automóviles con dirección a la ciudad de Arequipa y Puno.

Nuestros socios se encuentran muy agradecidos por el préstamo que se les otorga y se comprometen al pago total de la deuda y en el plazo determinado, ellos valoran la creación de estos bancos comunales de ayuda social, por ser esta una zona humilde y se comprometen a hacer crecer su capital, demostrando que valió la pena darles la oportunidad y creer en ellos.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Los Alamos de la Estacion”. This group has 13 members, all of which are natives of the community called Urcos in the Quispicanchis province. These bank members all have different businesses. Their most common business is the cultivation of potatoes, corn, and vegetables. They also work with livestock, the production of dairy products and the subsequent sale of the livestock. Another business sector of the communal bank members, and in particular the women, is the sale of self-produced food in the central market, since Urcos is an obligatory stop for busses and cars that are traveling to Arequipa or Puno. Our bank members are very thankful for the loan and they are committed to the full repayment of the debt and within the term of the loan. They value the creation of these communal banks for social help. As they live in a humble area, they are committed to make their capital grow, showing that it was worth giving them the opportunity and believing in them.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy manure, fertilizer, bovine cattle, and products for the food sales

loans.name: Melba Celestina

texts.es: La profesora Melba es soltera, de 51 años de edad, no tiene hijos, habita en casa de su madre, todos los dias sale de su casa a las 6:00 a.m. para llegar a su centro  de trabajo que esta a 4 km de la salida de su casa, para salir a la carretera tiene que caminar 4 km mas o montar a caballo o bicicleta, pero esto se le hace mas dificultoso porque tiene que dejar el caballo en la carretera y personas ajenas los molestan entonces prefiere salir a pie y regresar a pie a las 4:00 p.m.   Esta solicitando su 9no credito porque quiere poner verjas a un corredor que es donde realiza su trabajo de clases y estudia por la noche, ya que esta cursando 3er año de Psicologia  en la UNAN Juigalpa, donde viaja todos los sabados manifiesta que esta rutina de trabajo y estudio ha sido posible porque no tiene ningun compromiso ni hijos, mas que con su mamá con quien ha vivido toda su vida, ha sido una clienta en la categoria "A" y esta segura que seguira manteniendo su bien record crediticio ya que esa responsabilidad la heredo de sus padres.
texts.en:
Ms. Melba is single, she is 51 years old, a teacher and has no children, she lives at home with her mother, every day goes out from home at 6:00am to work 4km away, in order to get to the road she has to walk 4km more or ride a horse or bicycle, but this is difficult because she has to leave the horse on the road and people is not nice to the horse, so she prefers to walk back and forth. She is requesting her ninth credit because she wants to place a fence to a hallway where she prepares her lessons and studies at night, because she is on 3rd year of Psychology at the UNAN Juicalpa, where she goes every Saturday. She tells this tight schedule has been possible because she is not married and has no kids, except for her mom who she has lived all her life. She is a client type "A" and is sure she will keep her good record because this debt came from her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a fence around a hallway

loans.name: Lilliam Del Socorro

texts.es: La profesora Lilliam, soltera, mayor de edad con 3 hijos: una estudiando la secundaria, otra primaria y el tierno de 2 años de edd; tiene 16 años de servicio en el sector educativo, esta solicitando su 8vo credito y lo utilizara para construir una acera al contorno de la casa, ya que en el invierno el agua que cae del zinc se le mete dentro de la casa y es como que estuviera en el campo.  Cuando inicio con los creditos en AFODENIC no tenia vivienda, habitaba en la casa de su mamá, pero a traves de los creditos ha podido construir su propia casa con minimas condiciones, pero esta segura que podra llegar a obtener una vivienda digna para sus hijos que es lo que toda madre desea que sus hijos no anden posando ya que en casa ajena siempre resultan problemas aunque se viva con la familia. Una vez cumplida esta meta continuara con los creditos hasta alcazar su meta deseada.  La profesora trabaja en la zona rural a 14 km de su casa, sale a las 7:00 a.m. en su bicicleta para gastar en transporte y regresa a las 4:00 p.m. debido a que el MINED  les ha obligado que den educacion de adultos en el sector donde trabajan.
texts.en:
Ms. Liliam is single, she is a teacher with 3 children: studying high school, middle school and the youngest is 2 years old. She has been a teacher for 16 years, and is requesting her 8th loan to build a sidewalk around her house, because during the winter the water the falls from the zinc roof gets into the house. When she started the credits with AFODENIC she didn't have a house, she lived with her mom, but thru the credit she has been able to build her own house, with the minimum conditions, but she is sure it will be a good house for her children, so they won't be going from one family home to another. She will continue to request loans until she fulfills this goal. Liliam works in the country 14km away from her house, she leaves at 7am in her bicycle to save on transportation and comes back at 4pm because the MINED requires them to teach adults on the same sector they work.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a sidewalk around her house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase small animals; sale of shoes; sale of food

loans.name: Viviana Liliana

texts.es:
Esta socia se llama VIVIANA, ella tiene 23 años de edad y tiene 01 hijo, de 1 año.

Esta socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, ella cria aves de corral como son, gallinas, pollos, patos y cuyes, ella tiene entre sus labores del hogar a esta actividad, ella es madre soltera y vive con su menor hijo y es padre y madre; ella necesita el préstamo para así poder hacer un capital mayor y comprar mayor numero de animales y crecer su producción.

Ella esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan por este medio y se compromete a pagar en su totalidad el préstamo en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
This group member is called Viviana and she is 23 years old. She has a one year old son. Her business is raising small animals, such as fowl, hens, chickens, ducks, and guinea pigs. She has both household tasks and business tasks. She is a single mother and lives with her child and her parents. She needs the loan so that she can increase her capital and buy more animals to make her production grow. She is very thankful for this opportunity and is committed to paying the loan in full within the determined term.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase small animals

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Este nuestro socio se llama Miguel Angel, el es natural de la provincia de Urubamba, el tiene 25 años y  es casado tiene 01 hijo de 2 años.

Este socio alquila una combi para prestar servicio de transporte público desde Urubamba a la ciudad del Cusco, diario, el desea poder comprarse a futuro su propia mobilidad para que el dinero que le ingresa sea líquido para el y así no tener que dividir sus ganancias con el dueño.

El socio agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a pagar la deuda en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
This member of the Asociación Arariwa, Miguel Angel, is from the province of Urubamba. He is 25 years old, married, and has a 2 year old son. Miguel Angel rents a van in order to provide public transportation services daily from Urubamba to Cuzco. In the future he would like to be able to buy his own van so that the money he earns will be his own, and he will not have to split his earnings with the owner of the van. He is very grateful for the loan and promises to repay it within the time allotted.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Van Rental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Puchase of cell phone credit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To rent transportation for his timber to sell it.

loans.name: Uilson Francisco

texts.pt:
Uilson nasceu em gaza tem 35 anos de idade vive maritalmente, estudou ate a 10 classe e pai de 6 filhos com idades comprieendidas entre os 3 aos 23 anos de idade os primeiros 5 vao a escola .

Uilson sai de gaza a namaacha uma vila na fronteira de swazilandia com seus pais devido a guerra, continua com estudos e faz a 10 classe começa a trabalhar com seu pai este que era trabalhador de uma grande plantacao de cereais. Dois anos depois abandona o emprego e faz  plantios na sua propria machamba tem 3 hectares e o seu melhor produto agricola e o pipinno, repolho, eo tomate pois tem muita aceitacao no mercado e bons kilos, tem enfrentado grandes problemas de agua na regiao mas ele consegue superar as dificildades porque Para alem de trabalhar com terra uilson e chefe da localidade e aufere um valor mensal de 4.000.00mt deste modo teve que empregar 2 trabalhadores para tomarem conta dos seus produtos enquanto ele estiver a trabalhar.  Tem tido um valor de 25.000.00mt em cada 3 meses e consegue por mês poupar 5.000.00mt porque para alem da sua familia responsabiliza se pelos seus pais que vivem numa localidade do mesmo distrito emviando lhes um valor de 1.000.00mt e alguns cereais que tem produzido na machamba. 

Este e o segundo emprestimo de uilson na hluvuku e primeiro no kiva. Os 15.000.00mt foram usados para comprar insumos agricolas e pede estes 20.000.00mt para o mesmo fim esta confiante que o seu nivel de producao vai subir e reembolsar sem nenhuma dificuldade.
texts.en:
Uilson was born in Gaza. He is 35 years old and married. He went to school until the 10th grade. He is the father of 6 children with ages between 3 and 23. The youngest 5 go to school. Uilson left Gaza for Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, with his parents due to the war. He continued with his studies and finished the 10th grade when he began working with his father who worked at a large grain plantation. Two years later he abandoned his job and began planting his own farm. He has 3 hectares, and his best agricultural products are cucumbers, cabbage, and tomatoes. He is well accepted at the market. He has encountered big problems with water in the region, but he has been able to overcome the difficulties because besides working the land Uilson is also head of the locality and earns 4,000MT per month. Because of this he has had to hire two employees to take care of his products while he is working. He has earned 25,000MT in each of 3 months and has been able to save 5,000MT per month because besides his family he is also responsible for his parents who live in the same district. He sends them 1,000MT and some grains that he produces on his farm. This is Uilson's second loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. The 15,000MT was used to purchase agricultural supplies, and he is requesting 20,000MT for the same reason. He is confident that his level of production will increase, and he will be able to pay off the loan without difficulty.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Lina Júlio

texts.pt:
Lina nasceu em chibuto tem 46 anos de idade, vive maritalmente estudou ate a 7 classe Mae de 4 filhos com idades conpriendidas entre os 26 aos 11anos de idade 3 dos fihos e que vao a escola.

Lina sai de chubuto a namaacha uma vila na fronteira de swazilandia quando tinha 14 anos de idade com o seu irmao mais velho este que era trabalhador dos registos civil e foi transferido para trabalhar naquele distrito. Chegado a namaacha lina ingressa a escola, ano seguinte ela fica gravida do seu esposo e teve que interroper os estudos porque na altura era proibido estudar emquanto gravida. junta se com o seu marido, 2 anos depois casam se e ele a abandona 5 dias depois do casamento emigra para a africa do sul deixando uma carta que so foi descoberta 6 meses depois alegando que ia a procura de emprego ate entao. A vida fica dificil e sem saber o que fazer ela pede ajuda ao irmao e este aranja um enprego para ela no registo civil como servente onde trabalha durante 5 anos. Com o fundo colectado ela inicia o seu proprio negocio de venda de capulanas adquiria em maputo e revendia na swazilandia, o seu negocio foi crescendo e já não conseguia satisfazer a necessidades dos clientes, entao aproxima se aos nossos servicos solicitando um emprestimo no valor de 20.000.mt para aumentar o seu stock de mercadoria. Hoje tem como melhor produto lencois, mantas, duvetes e cortinas  que adquiri a 400.00mt, a 500.00mt, a 350.00mt e revende a 1000.00mt, a 1250.00mt, e a 600mt concecutivamente. Tem tido um lucro mensal de 8.000.00mt por mês e consegue poupar 3.000.00mt pois não responsabiliza se por niguem. 

Este e o terceiro emprestimo de lina na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva.os primeiros dois usou para comprar mercadorias (roupas, lencois, duvetes e mantas), desta vez lina pretende usar os 20.000.00mt para o mesmo fim e esta confiante que vai desembolsar antes do prazo determinado e pedir um novo emprestimo para concluir a obra da sua cozinha.
texts.en:
Lina was born in Chibuto. She is 46 years old and married. She went to school until the 7th grade. She is the mother of 4 children with ages between 26 and 11, and the youngest 3 are in school. Lina left Chibuto for Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, when she was 14 years old with her oldest brother who was working for the registry office and was transferred to work in that district. When she arrived in Namaacha Lina enrolled in school. The following year she became pregnant with her boyfriend and had to interrupt her studies because at that time it was prohibited to go to school while pregnant. She moved in with her boyfriend. Two years later they married, and he abandoned her 5 days after the wedding emigrating to South Africa and leaving a letter that only was discovered 6 months after alleging that he went to search for work. Life became difficult and without knowing what to do she asked for help from her brother who arranged a job for her in the registry office as a servant where she worked for 5 years. With the money collected she began her own business of selling capulanas [a kind of robe/dress]. She buys them in Maputo and resells them in Swaziland. Her business was growing, and she was unable to satisfy the demand of her customers. She discovered our services [Hluvuku] and solicited a loan in the amount of 20,000MT to increase her inventory. Today her best products are sheets, blankets, duvets, and curtains that she buys for 400MT, 500MT and 350MT, and resells at 1,000MT, 1,250MT, and 3,000MT respectively. She has had a monthly income of 8,000MT per month and is able to save 3,000MT since she isn't responsible for anyone else. This is her third loan through Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. The first two loans were used to purchase products (clothing, sheets, duvets, and blankets). This time Lina intends to use 20,000MT to the same end and is confident that she will be able to pay it off before maturity so she can request another loan to finish the work on her kitchen.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of various clothing and bedding

loans.name: Mario

texts.pt:
Mario nasceu em inhambane tem 48 anos de idade, vive maritalmente estudou ate a 6 classe do antigo sistema e pai de 5 filhos com idades coopriendidas emtre os 6 meses aos 18 anos os 4 mais velhos que enquentam a escola.

mario sai de inhambane  a  namaacha uma vila na fronteira de swazilandia com o seu irmao mais velho apois ter perdido os seus pais, chegado a namaacha continua com os seus estudos e faz a 6 classe. anos depois e empregado nas TDM como operador de servico de atendimento de telecomunicacoes,hoje e funcionario permanente amais de 15 anos e aufere um salario no valor de 5.500.00mt trabalhando das 7h as 14h no periodo da manha e das 14h as 22h no periodo da noite. junta se com sua esposa e a convivencia com o irmao já não era agradavel assim sente se obrigado a sair de casa do irmao e passa a viver numa casa de aluguer enquanto construia a sua propria casa mas como não tinha fundo suficiente para concluir a sua obra, aproxima se aos nossos servicos e solicita um emprestimo para dar continuidade da sua obra. Responsabiliza se pela sua cunhada e pelos seus irmaos estes que vivem em inhambane mandando lhes em cada 4 meses um valor de 1.000.00mt e não consegue poupar nenhum valor pois a sua obra esta em construcao.


Este e o segundo emprestimo de mario na hluvuku e o primeiro com kiva.o primeiro de 8.000.00mt foram usados para comprar pintos para revenda, desta vez mario pretende usar  os 20.000.00mt para conprar material de contrucao. Mario e sua familia vivem em casa propria e esta confiante que vai desembolsar o emprestimo antes do tempo determinado e pedir um novo emprestimo.
texts.en:
Mario was born in Inhambane. He is 48 years old and married. He went to school through the 6th grade in the old system. He is the father of 5 children with ages between 6 months and 18 years old. The 4 oldest kids go to school. Mario left Inhambane for Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, with his oldest brother after having lost their parents. Having arrived in Namaacha he continued with his studies and completed the 6th grade. Years later he is employed in the TDM as a service operator of telecommunications. Today he has been a permanent employee for more than 15 years and earns a salary of 5,500MT working from 7am until 2pm on the morning shift and from 2pm until 10pm on the night shift. He married his wife, and since living together with his brother was no longer agreeable he felt obligated to leave his brother's house and moved into a rental home while he builds his own home. Since he does not have sufficient funds to finish the work, he approached us and solicited a loan to finish his work. He is responsible for his sister in law and his brothers who live in Inhambane. He sends them 1,000MT every 4 months and is unable to save any money while his home is in construction. This is Mario's second loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. The first oan of 8,000MT was used to purchase chickens for resale. This time Mario intends to use the 20,000MT to purchase construction materials. Mario and his family live in their own home and he is confident that he can pay off the loan before the maturity date in order to request another loan.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Benedito Feliciano

texts.pt:
Benedito nasceu em gaza tem 41anos de idade vive maritalmente, estudou ate a 4 classe do antigo sistema devido a falta de condicoes dos seus pais, e pai de 4 filhos com idades compriendidas entre os 7meses e 13 anos de idade  os 4 mais velhos e que vao a escola pois o mais novinho e um recem nascido.

Benedito sai de gaza a maputo alegando que ia estudar, chegado a maputo comeca a trabalhar com o seu pai como pedreiro.anos depois muda se com a sua familia para namaacha uma vila na fronteura com swazilandia,comeca a fazer  trabalhos locais como pedreiro, porque trabalho não rende muito em mocambique ele emigra para a africa do sul hoje ele e chefe de obras e trabalha na base de contratos a mais de 10 anos abre uma barraca na sua residencia pois ele trabalha longe de casa e não consegue satisfazer a necessidade da sua familia a tempo e hora e alega que esta e a melhor forma de ajudar a sua esposa enquanto ele estiver ausente, tem visitado a sua familia de 3 em 3 meses.o negocio tem um impacto positivo na comunidade e ele não consegue satisfazer a necessidade dos clientes e aproxima se a hluvuku solicitando um emprestimo no valor de 15.000.00mt para aumentar o stock dos seus produtos, tem como melhor produto a cerveja nacional 2M adquire a caixa por 250 e revende a 330, o saco de arroz 25kg a 500 e revende a 600 tem tido de receita mensal 3.000.00mt e consegue poupar por mês 1.000.00mt responsabiliza se pelo seus pais que vivem com ele em sua casa.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
Benedito já teve um emprestimo no banco tsuma e pagou sem nenhuma dificuldade, e este e o primeiro na hluvuku e kiva. Que seram usados para comprar produtos de primeira necessidade para revenda e esta confiante que ira desembolsar cem nenhum problema mesmo que ele se ausente a sua esposa ira pagar.
texts.en:
Benedito was born in Gaza. He is 41 years old and is married. He went to school until the 4th grade in the old system due to the lack of conditions of his parents. He is the father of 4 children with ages between 7 months and 13 years old. The 4 oldest kids go to school, and the youngest is a newborn. Benedito left Gaza for Maputo alleging that he was going to study. Having arrived in Maputo he began to work work with his father as a mason. Years later he moved with his family to Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland. He started doing local work as a mason, but because his work does not pay very well in Mozambique he emigrated to South Africa. Today he is in charge, and he works on a contract base. Over ten years ago he opened a stand in his home. Since he works far from home and is not able to satisfy the needs of his family he thought this was the best way to help his wife while he is away. He has visited his family 3 times in 3 months. His business has a positive impact on the community and he is unable to satisfy the demands of his customers. He approached hluvuku and solicited a loan for 15,000MT to increase his inventory. His best product is beer. He buys a case for 250 and resells it for 330. A 25kg sack of rice costs 500 and is resold for 600. He has had monthly receipts of 3,000MT and is able to save 1,000MT per month. He is also responsible for his parents who live with him in his house. Benedito already had a loan from a bank, and he paid it without difficulty. This is his first with Hluvuku and with Kiva, which he will use to purchase staple products for resale. He is confident that he will be able to pay off this loan without problems. Even if he is absent his wife will pay.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of various products

loans.name: Ana Jaime

texts.pt:
Ana jaime M. nasceu em namaacha tem 30 anos de idade vive maritalmente e estudou ate a 5 classe, poios foi  abandonada pela sua mae ainda crianca e passa a viver com a sua avo. E mae de 3 filhos com idades coopriendidas entre os 11 oas 6 anos de idade todos vao a escola.

Ana inicia muito tarde a sua carreira estudantil e quando frequentava a 6 classe esta fica gravida do seu namorado que a abandona alegando que o filho que ela esperava não era dele e teve que interroper os estudos. Entao a sua avo da lhe um fundo para fazer negocio, vendia clandestinamente no mercado do bairro(biscoitos e pasteis) 2 anos depois ela junta se com o seu 2 esposo este que a ajuda a cuidar dos seus negocios.o seu negocio foi crscendo e aos poucos construia uma barraca na sua residencia. Em 2007 consegue concluir a sua obra mas já não tinha fundo para comprar mercadoria, atraves duma conversa com as amigas teve conhecimento dos servicos da hluvuku assim solicitou um emprestimo e conseguiu comprar a mercadoria. seu melhor produto e o( açucar, arroz, sabao  e sal) compra o kilo a 20 e revende a 25, o saco a 500 e revende a 600, a caixa a 200 e revende a 275 consecutivamente pois na regiao onde se encontra vivem mais de produtos agricolas. Trabalha das 7h as 18h tem tido um rendimento mensal de 4.000.00mt e consegue poupar 1.000.00mt pois para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pela sua avo manda do lhe uma sesta basica de 500mt mensalmente.

Este e o segundo emprestimo de ana na hluvuku e primeiro no kiva. O primeiro de 7.000.00mt foram usados para comprar produtos de primeira necessidade para revenda e pede este segundo de 10.000.00mt para o mesmo fim esta confiante que vai reembolsar sem nenhum problema e pedir um novo emprestimo para concluir a sua obra.
texts.en:
Ana Jaime M. was born in Namaacha, is 30 years old, lives with her husband and was in school until the 5th grade as she was abandoned by her mother as a child and went to live with her grandmother. She is the mother of 3 children aged between 11 and 6 and they all go to school.

Ana began her studies quite late in life and when she was in the 6th grade, she fell pregnant and her boyfriend abandoned her claiming that the child she was expecting wasn't his, so she had to interrupt her studies. Her grandmother then gave her some money to start a business and she secretly sold biscuits and pastries at her local market. 2 years later she gets together with her husband who helps her take care of her business. The business began to grow and she slowly built a stall at her home.

In 2007 she managed to complete the construction of the stall but had no capital left to buy merchandise. Through a conversation with her friends she learnt of Hluvuku's services and solicited a loan to buy merchandise. Her best products are sugar, rice, soap and salt which she buys by the kilo for 20 MZN and resells at 25 MZN, by the bag for 500 MZN and resells at 600 MZN and by the box for 200 MZN and resells at 275 MZN, as in the region where she resides they live off more agricultural products. She works from 7am to 6pm and has a monthly income of 4,000.00 MZN, of which she manages to save 1,000.00 MZN, as apart from her children, she is also responsible for her grandmother to whom she sends 500 MZN a month.

This is her second loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. Her first loan for 7,000.00 MZN was used to purchase staple goods for resale and she is asking for this second loan of 10,000.00 MZN for the same purpose. She is confident that she will pay off her loan without any problems and will request a new loan to continue building her stall.


Translated from Portuguese by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and resale of various products

loans.name: Sandra Yesenia

texts.es: Sandra Yesenia T. L. vive en la Colonia Santa Maria departamento de Ahuachapán. Yesenia se dedica atender su negocio que es una tienda ubicada en su casa. Yesenia a sus 25 años de edad cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su madre, es por ello que Yesenia se animo a poner otro negocio que le generará más ingresos y puso una pupuseria que es abierta y atendida por ella todos los días al igual que la tienda. En las metas y sueños de Yesenia es ampliar sus negocios, la tienda y la pupuseria por eso,  ahora Yesenia solicita un crédito para compra de granos básicos y surtir su tienda
texts.en:
Sandra Yesenia T. L. lives in the neighborhood of Santa Maria, located in the department of Ahuachapan. Yesenia makes a living by running a business that she operates out of her house. Yesenia is 25 years old and she depends on the unconditional support of her mother. For that reason, Yesenia felt motivated to start a restaurant that specializes in "pupusas" (these are delicious, thick, hand-made corn tortillas that are stuffed with cheese, beans or meat). The restaurant is open and she works there every day. Her goals and dreams are to expand her businesses, the store she runs and the restaurant that specializes in "pupusas". Right now she is requesting a loan to be able to buy basic grains and to stock her store with a greater variety of items.

(Translated by Ashlee of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains and to stock her store with a greater variety of items

location.town: Colonia Santa Maria departamento de Ahuachapán

loans.name: Koy

texts.en:
T. is 40 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. He has three children: two of them are single and under his care, and the other one is married and lives separately. He is married to Cheng Ieng, 37, who plants bananas and watermelons.

T. is a local farmer working with his wife in the field. He is a responsible father and neighbor. He has earned a better living by selling his products to customers who buy the bananas and watermelon in bulk. T. can plant four times a year and he can earn around US$ 200 each time. He has one small truck for his business. He wants to increase his business income with his available space of land. T. is looking for a loan of US$ 1200 to buy more banana and watermelon seeds for his field and to repair his truck. The loan will help improve their living standard.

loans.use: To buy more banana and watermelon seeds for his field and to repair his truck

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn M., 53, is a resident of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. Like other women, Meryln wants more income to help support her family. Her husband is a farmer and they grow root crops, coconut, and bananas.  Another source of income is their village variety store which Merlyn started with their first loan through the HSPFI microfinance program.  Her business has grown and she is ready to expand.  A new loan would be used to purchase grocery items for the store.  She is determined that with the help of the loan her increased income will support the education of her granddaughter and grandson.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for her store

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sherley

texts.en:
Sherley S. is a resident of Calamagui 1st village, Isabela, Philippines. She is 49 years old and married to Andy, who is 56 years old and a vendor. The couple was blessed with six children. Michael is a commerce graduate, now working abroad as an OFW.  Reymund is a graduate of a secretarial course. Jason, Dennis, and Jenivie are currently in college. Paul is in third grade. According to Sherley, hers is a close and supportive family. 

She and her husband sell toys for kids in a small store in their village. This has been their family's main source of income since the 1990s. Sherley and her husband were able to send all of their children to school. She is thankful that they are able to support their family. Now Sherley wants to improve their business and needs a loan to provide additional business capital.

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Min T. is 36 years old, and resides in Taho village in Kompong Tom Province in Cambodia. She is single and earns a living by growing and selling flowers at the market. She is responsible for the care of her mother who assists her in the business. Her younger sister and brother are employed to help with family expenses. Her sister is sells cakes and her brother is a motorcycle taxi driver. T. is asking for a $400 loan to replace an old motorcycle that belongs to her brother. (She and her mother are pictured.)

loans.use: Replace an old motorcycle

loans.name: Savuth

texts.en: Mr. Savuth T. was born in 1977 and she now lives in Kraing Raong Village in Takeo Province. He sells motorbikes in the local village. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it, so he decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings to buy a motorbike to re-sell. His wife, Mrs. Yun Sopheap, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Mr. Savuth T. has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another one is attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is five years old. Mr. Savuth T.'s wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to re-sell.

loans.name: Reth

texts.en: R. is 33 years old and a resident of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She has two children, both of whom are students. She is married to Koey, 39, who is a local farmer. R. has farmed since 2000 and she can earn $5 per day. Her farming land is located in a fertilized zone and near a water source. Recently, she is interested in the land surrounding her house. R. is asking for a loan of $1000 to buy a piece of land. The loan will help the family live more comfortably.

loans.use: To buy piece of land

loans.name: Son

texts.en: Mrs. Son M. is a villager in Kbal Damrey Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile soil, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Tob Chron, helps her in the farming. Mrs. Son M. is 57 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a motorbike taxi driver while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Phoeut's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has three members and Mrs. R. is the leader. She is 43 years old and currently earns a living by selling a variety of desserts from her house in the village. Most of her clients are neighbors. She can average an income of $2 each and has been operating the business since she was single. She is married now with three children who are in school. They help her sell desserts when they are not studying. Her husband is a domestic carpenter. R.'s investment is going smoothly because she is skilled at attracting customers. She is asking for a loan to increase the size of her business. 

The other two borrowers are S. and L..  S., 28, is a dessert seller and she requests a loan to enlarge her own business and for her husband's carpentry business. L., 35, sells grilled bananas from home and she is asking for a loan to repair her existing house. The borrowers all live in Battambang Province.

loans.use: To increase business

loans.name: Nor Jan Group

texts.en:
Nor J. is the group leader of Nor J. Nafas Gull   group. There are four members in this group. All of them want to receive money for their business.

Nafas Gull and Tammana want to take a loan for their business of tailoring. They want to buy a new machine for their business. Also Nor J. wants take a loan for her bakery business. She wants to buy necessary materials for her business. Shokofa  wants to take a loan for her bakery in her house; she wants to complete her stock. They are requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000 Afghani for a term of 10 months.

With this loan they can make their businesses larger and support their families and make a better future for themselves and their families in future.

loans.use: expand their businesses and buy necesssary materials

loans.name: Sardar Group

texts.en:
This is the Sardar group. There are three members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their businesses.

Laylah and Fawzia want to take a loan for their tailoring business to buy new machines for their businesses. And Aziz wants to take a loan for his carpentry business to open a shop in future. And also they want to complete their necessary materials for their businesses.

Thay want to say that these loans to help businesses progress and make businesses larger are very useful. They all want to thank Kiva for making possible the process in Afghanistan to support poor people.

loans.use: to expand their businesses

loans.name: Marey Group

texts.en:
Marey is the group leader of the Marey Group. There are four members in this group. Each of them would like to receive money for his/her own business.

Shafeqa and Fareshta want to take a loan for the business of tailoring. They want to buy new machines for their business. Meyna wants to take a loan for her husband's general store to complete his stock. Marey wants to take a loan for her husband’s tailor shop; he wants to buy necessary materials for his shop. They all want to expand and progress in their business and to earn more money to support their families.

With this loan they can make their businesss larger and support their families. To become strong in their businesses and make a better future for themselves and for their families. They are really very happy with this loan process in this poor country.

loans.use: they all want to expand and progress in their businesses

loans.name: Prum

texts.en: C., 28, a resident of Pursat Province, Cambodia, cultivates rice and also owns a small milling machine providing a rice-hulling service for farmers. He normally earns about $7 a day from his investment.  His wife, Mrs. Sambath, 25, earns a living raising pigs from home. C. is now applying for a $400 loan to buy a motorcycle for family transportation and more piglets for his wife to raise.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle and more piglets.

loans.name: Rayza Gull Group

texts.en:
Rayza Gull is the group leader of Rayza Gull group. There are four members in this group. Each of them would like to receive money for his/her business.

Rayza Gull and Fareyda  want to take a loan for their husbands' book stores to add to the materials in stock. Kamalah   wants to take a loan for his  business of fruit car;  he  wants to buy necessary materials for his  business. Ahmad Faryad  wants to take a loan for his book store  to expand his  business inventory. They all want to make their  businesses larger with this loan of 40,000 Afghani with a term of 8 months.

They are very happy with this loan process in Afghanistan. They want to thank AFSG and Kiva and all lenders around the world.

loans.use: they each want to make his/her business larger

loans.name: Chou

texts.en: K. is 43 years old and resides in Pursat Province, Cambodia, where she makes an income by raising pigs at home. She is also a local chef for wedding parties and buys rice supplies to sell in the village to gain additional income. She is married to Chomroeun, 47, who owns a car which he uses to provide taxi service. The couple have four children who attend school. Two are in primary school and the others are in high school. As the rice harvesting season is approaching, K. is requesting a loan amount of $1100 from HKL, in order to purchase rice supplies to sell.

loans.use: To purchase rice supplies for sell

loans.name: Marsal Group

texts.en:
Mawoj Gull is the group leader of Marsal group. There are five members in this group and they all live in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. The total amount that the group members want to take is about 50000 Afghani and each member want to take a loan for the progress of his/her business.

Maryam wants to take a loan for the purpose of purchasing materials for her general store. Mahboba wants to take a loan for her business sewing clothes and she wants to buy a new machine for her business. Mawoj Gull wants to take a loan for her husband’s tailoring business, and Zakyara wants to take a loan for her son’s vegetable shop. He wants to buy necessary materials for his shop. Bibi Danna wants to take a loan for her son’s general store; he wants to expand his shop.

They all want to say that with the loan they would be able to do well and have their businesses progress as well.

loans.use: improving their  businesses

loans.name: May Flor

texts.en:
“In everything you do, put God first” Mayflor P. said.  The line also became her guiding principle in life.  Her family lives in the village of Calamagui, 1st in Ilagan, Isabela.  She is now 32 years old and married to June, 37 years of age, who works as a driver.  They, fortunately, are blessed with a son named Abilino who is only 2 years old.  Despite the difficulties of life, Mayflor and her husband are not losing hope in striving for a better future of their family.

Her husband operates a motorcycle transport business in their village.  With the loan she is requesting (PHP6, 000), Mayflor will able to help her husband purchase the needed spare parts for their motorcycle for its daily operation.  

Their tricycle transport helps them to earn money and provide for the basic needs of the family.  Without it they would be having a hard time supporting their daily needs since it is their only source of income in the village.  

Looking forward to the future of her son, Mayflor is hoping to save money little by little for her son’s education.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
“Be humble to others, surely you will reward in heaven” said Francisco L., a 63 year old client seeking financial support for her tailoring shop business.  Despite her retiring age, Francisco still is strong and determined to pursue her business, which is situated in Calamagui, 1st Ilagan, Isabela where her family also lives.  

Francisca is requesting the amount of PHP8,000, which will serve as additional business capital to further develop her tailoring shop.  Moreover, Francisca still has a clear sight for sewing at her age, optimistically aiming for business development. 
	
Francisca considers her sewing as a business habit since her children are already grown and have their own families, while her husband died few years ago.  Her four children are Samuel- 39 year’s old and vocational graduate, Marivic – 37 years old and a college graduate, James - 33 years old and a commerce graduate, and Jenino - 29 years old and now a trainer.

loans.use: Business capital to develop her tailoring shop

loans.name: Nhoem

texts.en: Mrs. Nhoem M. was born in 1954 and she now lives in Thkouv village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who has a small plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. She is a widow with five children, three of whom are employed in different businesses while the remaining two are attending the local school. Although Mrs. Nhoem M. and her family members try to work hard, they still live in an old house in poor conditions. To improve these standards of living, Mrs. Nhoem M. decided to ask for a loan to buy timber to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To buy timbers to build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Thea

texts.en: Mrs. Thea B. is a villager in Thkouv Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Tib Ton, is a palm juice collector who gathers it to process into palm sugar and wine. Although they try to work hard, they still don't earn enough income to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Thea B. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and she hopes to increase her income after she sells that cow. Mrs. Thea B. is 35 years old and the mother of four children who are all attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Thoeurn S. was born in 1963 and she now lives in Chi Chrab Village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Sum San, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, they gather a little rice revenue, but not enough to provide a better life to their family. Additionally, their family members also live in an old house in poor conditions; thus, Mrs. Thoeurn S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house for her family members. She has six children, three of whom are working in a garment factory while the remaining three are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To build a new house for her family members.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha T. is thirty two years old. She is widowed and has decided not to marry again. Martha has two children to bring up; a boy and a girl. She says one of her children is in senior high school while the other is in junior high school. Martha lives with her children in a rented house, in a town called Dormaa Ahenkro, in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Dormaa is an agricultural town. It is about a forty five minutes drive from Sunyani, the regional capital. 

She works very hard to provide for her family since she receives no other help. Martha is engaged in retailing activities. She sells utensils of all kinds and plastic products. She procures her products from Kumasi, a nearby city and sells in her community at the market square. She has been in business for eight years. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so that she can procure more products. She hopes to improve upon the family’s standard of living and give all her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure supplies of utensils and rubber plastics to resell

loans.name: Pagmatsogsmaa

texts.en:
Pagmatsogsmaa S. is a married woman with one child, living in Uvurhangay province. Uvurhangay is a one of Mongolia's southern provinces, located 400 km from the capital city, Ulaanbaatar. Pagmatsogsmaa and her family live in a "ger," which is the traditional, nomadic house in Mongolia. Her ger is situated in what is known as a “ger district,” an ad hoc settlement where many families live in gers near one another.

Since 2007 she has been running a food stall business with her own stall and employing one saleswoman. She buys candy, biscuits, cookies, chocolates, dried fruits, etc. from wholesalers and re-sells them. Her business income from the food stall is her family’s main source of income.

Pagmatsogsmaa has said in Mongolian: "I have a dream to have my own supermarket in the future". With the Lunar New Year celebration approaching, small items have sold quickly; therefore, she wants a loan to buy more food products for her food stall.

loans.use: to buy more food products such as candy, biscuits, chocolate etc.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia F. is the 50-year-old divorced mother of two sons and two daughters. One of her children has completed senior high school and yearns for more eduction, while the rest are in senior high, junior high and primary schools. Afia lives with the children in a rented apartment in Dormaa Ahenkro, an agricultural community in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana, about a 45-minute drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

She works very hard to support the family and, most importantly, to settle the children’s school bills. One of her businesses is selling iced water by the roadside to passersby and other road users, procuring the water in sachets from distributers. On sunny days, patronage is strong. Afia also sells kerosene, a fuel used in lanterns and stoves, to the people in her neighborhood. She has been in business 15 years and is now requesting a loan to procure the sachet water and fuel in bulk. Her goal is to give all her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure sachet water and kerosene.

loans.name: Simni

texts.en:
Simni sells coconuts and flowers in the Milinne neighborhood in Zanzibar. She is married, and has three children, ages 18, 16, and 15. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day she works at her business.

She is a member of the Ukombozi loan group. She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more coconuts and flowers for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

loans.use: Buy more coconuts and flowers to expand her business

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
T., 38, has used a medium-size stall for raising pigs for a long time. As another source of income, she sells Khmer fritters in front of her home. She is married and has three children who are teenagers and attend in the secondary school. Her husband's name is Saroeun; he is 38 and is a Cambodia military policeman (pictured here).

T.'s family is facing difficulties with transportation, and they frequently hire a taxi to go to work. To solve the problem, T. is asking for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for family so they can ride to work. T. lives in Pursat province.

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle for family's transportation to work

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en:
Bolormaa T. is 30 years old, married, and the mother of two. Her family lives in Uvurhangai province. Uvurhangai is a one of Mongolia's southern provinces, located 400 km from the capital city, Ulaanbaatar. Her eldest child goes to elementary school, and the youngest one goes to kindergarten.

After Bolormaa graduated from high school, she was taught by her mother how to cut hair. She then worked as a barber’s assistant in her mother's salon for 1 year. In 1998, she completed a short-term haircut training course. Following that course, she opened her own hairdressing salon and has been working independently for 10 years.

During the past 10 years, she has become very experienced and earned many repeat clients. Her business provides her family’s main source of income, and is important for improving her family’s living conditions. Bolormaa's husband runs a transport business using his own motorcycle. Bolormaa plans to use this loan to buy hair brushes, nets, sprays, and hair oil to sell and increase her business capital.

loans.use: Buy hair brushes, nets, sprays, and hair oil

loans.name: Jargalsayhan

texts.en:
Jargalsayhan A. is a married woman who has five children. Her two eldest children are university students. The three younger children attend elementary school. Her family lives in Uvurhangay province. Uvurhangai is a southern province, located 400 km from the capital city, Ulaanbaatar.

Together with her husband, she has been running a clothing business at the local market in a stall owned by her family since 2003. Their stall is located outside of the local market that runs year-round. She is the sole breadwinner of her entire family. Thanks to her cheerful, open and friendly personality, she has many repeat customers.

Jargalsayhan has been a XacBank customer (XacBank is a Kiva's partner microfinance institution in Mongolia) for the past 4 years. This is her fifth loan with the bank, and she has a perfect credit history with no overdue payments. The loans she takes help her to expand her clothing business, thereby increasing her income. With this loan, Jargalsayhan plans to invest in more clothes to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy more clothes to increase business inventory

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
For 3 years, Fatma has been selling bites (maandazi, chapati, and breads) in the Milinne neighborhood in Zanzibar. Fatma is 46 years old, divorced, and has two children: ages 25 and 18. She is a member of the Asaa Khery loan group. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $40. Every day she works at her business from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more flour and cooking oil for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to increase her business.

loans.use: Buy more flour and cooking oil for food business

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Raphael is 46 years old and married with 7 children. He lives in Agbor, Delta state, Nigeria. He sells and repairs motorcycle spare parts. He has been in this business for a long time. He needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en: Rosina Ameyaa is 36 years old. She is divorced and provides for two daughters. One of her children is in senior high school and the other attends the basic school. She lives with them in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Dormaa is an agricultural town, about a 45 minute drive from Sunyani, the regional capital. She works very hard to make enough income to provide for the family, and most importantly to settle the children’s school bills. Rosina trades in ready–made textiles, buying the textiles in Kumasi, a nearby city, and selling them in town. She also travels to other towns to market her products. She has been in business for two years. Rosina wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can purchase textiles in bulk. Rosina hopes to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy ready-made textiles

loans.name: Zariha

texts.en: Zariha is 32 years old, married, and has four children, ages 12, 9, 6 and 3. She sells bites (chapati) and handbags in the Milinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to the Tuwe macho loan (Group code 2013). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125, working every day. Zariha is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more handbags for her business. She is hoping that this loan will improve her business so that her income can grow.

loans.use: To buy more handbags to improve her business.

loans.name: Jambo Nia Group

texts.en:
Wanu is 40 years old, married, and has five children, ages 15, 13, 9, 6 and 3. She sells bites (chapati) and porridge in the Milinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $25, working every day. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more flour and cooking oil for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Wanu will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Chausiku and Kazija. Each woman has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more flour and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en: S. has been growing vegetables for more than 20 years, earning approximately $3 a day. She can plant twice a year, growing her crops through different seasons, a skill she learned from her grandparents. S. is married and the mother of six children, two of whom are students while the others are employed. Her husband, Poeun, age 26, earns money by selling marbles. S. is applying for a loan to buy a water buffalo that will be used to plow her fields. (S.'s husband is pictured because she was not available.)

loans.use: To buy a water buffalo

loans.name: Asaa Khery Group

texts.en:
Zanabia owns a small charcoal store where she also sells clothes in the Milinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She has worked at her business every day from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. for 3 years, currently earning an average monthly profit of $50. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and her business will grow.  

Zanabia is 45 years old, married, and has three children, ages 22, 18 and 10. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member Afua, who has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Nyimbo

texts.en:
Nyimbo has owned a small store, selling charcoal and firewood, in the Milinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for the last 5 years. She belongs to the Tujitegemee loan group (Group code 2003).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day she works at her business from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.  She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania, so that she can buy more  supplies of charcoal and firewood for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business.  

Nyimbo is 42 years old, divorced, and has three children: ages 15, 12 and 2.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Sa

texts.en:
Mr. Sa H., 53, and his wife, Mrs. Khotijas H., 51, were married in 1982 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Their son is a fisherman and the daughter attends school and assists her parents in fishing business when she has free time. The family lives along National Road Number Six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sa has been fishing for over twenty years, a skill he learned from his parents. His wife fishes as well. They fish from Mekong River and sell to the middleman in the village who then takes it to sell at market. Sa is asking for a loan of $400 to purchase a boat and boat motor for his fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase a boat and boat motor for his fishing business.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en: Clemetina is 42 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Agbor, Delta state, Nigeria. She is a farmer. She plants tubers of yam and cassava. She also plants plantain. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more yam seedlings to plant. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more yam seedlings to plant

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mrs. Mon P., 51, and her husband, Mr. Mot Ma, 53, live along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.  They were married in 1978 and have seven children: one son and six daughters. Two of their daughters are married and live outside the family home, one son is a construction worker and two daughters are garment factory workers.

Mon has been selling vegetables for almost one year.  Before she used to sell boiled corn. She buys vegetables from Koki market for resale at Chbar Ampov market, located in Phnom Penh. Her husband raises cows for resale. The couples hopes to that their business will be able support their children’s education. Mon is applying for a loan of $500 to purchase cows to raise.

loans.use: To purchase cows to raise.

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokly K., 28, and her husband, Mr. Rithy Moeung, 32, who live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia, were married in 2000 and have two sons. One is in school and the another is still too young. 
 
Sokly has been weaving silk since she was sixteen years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Sokly also taught her husband to become a silk weaver. Sokly has only one loom which makes it difficult for her to earn enough income to support her family. She is requesting her first loan of $500 to set up one more loom for her husband to weave and supplement her family’s income.

loans.use: To set up a loom for her husband.

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.ru: Махкамова Тахмина работает с Микроинвест уже с 2005 года. За это время ее каптал бизнеса возрос во много раз. Тахмине 28 лет. замужем и воспитывает 1 ребенка. Получив займ Тахмина старается прикупить тот ассортимент товаров который наиболее восстребован на рынке. Сейчас Тахмина подала заявку на КИВА чтобы на полученные деньги купить весенний ассортимент детской одежды. Новый займ собирается погасить в течении 2 месяцев.
texts.en:
Tahmina M. has been working with MicroInvest since 2005. During this time her business capital multiplied several times. Tahmina is 28 years old, is married and is raising 1 child. After taking out a loan, Tahmina tries to purchase a product selection that is most in demand at the market. Right now, Tahmina has applied to KIVA to receive money for the purchase of spring children’s clothing. She plans to pay back the new loan over 2 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spring children's clothing

loans.name: Friday

texts.en: Friday sells medicine. He has been in this business for a long time. He has a shop where he sells medicine to his customers. He needs the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. Friday is 45 years old and married with 3 children. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is 46 years old and married with 4 children. She sells provisions and drinks. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Mrs. Chenda Y., 41, and her husband, Mr. Ravann Meas, 37, who live on an island on the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia, were married in 1990 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Besides her children, she also has her parents living with her.

Chenda has been weaving silk for nineteen years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been driving motor taxi for ten years. His motorbike does not carry many people and only earns a little income to support the family. Chenda is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike with a trailer (Tuk Tuk) for her husband to run his taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike with a trailer (Tuk Tuk) for her husband.

loans.name: Madina

texts.fr:
Madame Madina D. est une femme mariée de trente quatre ans, mère d’un enfant qui vit dans une famille nucléaire à Sanankoroba à 20  kilomètres de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali).
 Elle travaille comme monitrice au jardin d’enfant du village d’enfants SOS (VESOS) de Sanankoroba.
Pour améliorer ses revenus, elle décida d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Après trois prêts solidaires tous correctement remboursés,  elle est à son premier prêt individuel.
 Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter,  10  sacs à mains, 10  paires de chaussures et divers autres articles sur le marché du Burkina Faso où  elle s’approvisionne une fois par mois et effectue ses ventes à Sanankoroba et à Bamako au comptant et à crédit.
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de trente trois mille francs CFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et contribuer aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Madina D., age 34, is married and the mother of one child. She lives in a nuclear family in Sanankoroba, located 20 kilometers from Bamako, the capital of the Republic of Mali. She works as a teacher at the kindergarten of the children village SOS (VESOS) in Sanankoroba. To increase her income, she decided to join the loan credit of Kiva's partner Soro Yiriwaso. After three solidarity loans (group loans) that were repaid without problem, she's seeking her first personal loan. She intends to use it to buy 10 handbags, 10 pairs of shoes, and various other items at a market in Burkina Faso, where she goes get her supplies once a month. She then resells her goods in Sanankoroba and in Bamako, for cash or on credit. She hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 33'000 (ca US$ 66), to be used to repay the loan and provide for the family expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell 10 handbags, 10 pairs of shoes, and various other items

loans.name: Nara

texts.en:
Ms. Rana N. (picture with her mother), 37, is single and lives with her widowed mother. She has six brothers and sisters. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

Rana has been a primary school teacher in her village for six years. Besides being a teacher, she is a tailor as well. Her mother is a rice farmer. Rna is requesting her first loan of $700 to purchase a sewing machine to build her tailoring shop.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine to build her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Channtum

texts.en:
Mrs. Channtum S., 27, and her husband, Mr. Chaiya Chaum, 26, who live along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2004 and have two young daughters. 

Channtum has been selling fruit for two years; she buys them on contract from villagers for resale in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a fisherman since 1999, a profession he learned from his brother. Channtum is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a trailer to carry fruit to sell and to buy mangoes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer and to buy mango for resale.

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr:
Madame Maïmouna B. est une  veuve de 50 ans et mère de quatre enfants. Elle vit au village d’enfants SOS de Sanankoroba (VESOS) où elle est directrice d’enseignement préscolaire. 
Afin d’augmenter son revenu, Madame Maïmouna B. intègre le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son premier prêt individuel après 3 prêts de groupe  tous   correctement remboursés.
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter, 55 pagnes wax à Bamako et à Conakry (capitale de la Guinée) où elle envoie souvent sa fille pour  son approvisionnement.
Les articles sont vendus aux femmes du village de Sanankoroba et de Bamako, elle vend au comptant et à crédit et compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 46.000FCFA  qu’elle utilisera pour payer rembourser les intérêts du prêt  et investir le reste dans son petit commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maïmouna B., age 50, is a widow and the mother of four children. She lives in the children village SOS (VESOS) in Sanankoroba, where she's a preschool director. To increase her income, Mrs. Maïmouna B. joined the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso. She's seeking her first loan, following three group loans that were repaid without problems. With this loan, she intends to buy 55 Wax pagnes (colorful African cloth) in Bamako and in Conakry (the capital of Guinea), where she often sends in her daughter to get supplies. The items are sold to the women of the Sanankoroba village, and in Bamako. She sells for cash or on credit, and intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 46'000 (ca US$ 90), that she will use to repay the loan, and to invest in her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell 55 Wax pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Mr. Yim T., 61, was married in 1970 and has six children: three sons and three daughters. Three of her children are married and live outside the family home, one daughter is a deputy commune leader and other two children live full time in Phnom Penh. The family lives along National Road Number Six, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Yim has been making mats for four years and sells them at her house. Making mats is a skill she learned from her neighbor. Mats are made from a plant that Cambodian people called Kork (showed in the picture). Her husband farms. He grows bananas and jujubes. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 T. purchase a plot of land for her son T. build his house.

loans.use: To purchase a plot for her son to build a house.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 46 years old, and she is married with 4 children. She sells provisions and drinks. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Vun

texts.en:
Mr. Vun N., 54, and his wife, Mrs. Kim-at Lun, 34, were married in 2004 and have no children yet. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

Vun has been a mason for fifteen years. His wife stays at home. Their main income is from his construction business, but he does not have enough materials to run his business.  He is requesting his first loan of $1,000 to purchase more construction materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for his business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel sells palm oil to his customers. He started this business in the year 2000. He needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more palm oil to sell to his customers. He is 42 years old and married with 4 children. He says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Madame Oumou Dembélé est une femme mariée de 48 ans, mère de  6 enfants qui vit dans une famille nucléaire à Sanankoroba à 20  kilomètres de Bamako (la capitale du Mali).
Oumou Dembélé, comme  bien d’autres femmes de Sanankoroba, dans le souci d’alléger leur pauvreté, intégra le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Après  3 prêts solidaires tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son quatrième prêt individuel.
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 600  kilogrammes d’arachide, 250  kilogrammes de tubercules et divers articles sur le marché de Sanankoroba et environnants. Elle  effectue  sa vente au marché sur une étale, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle essentiellement composée de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  120. 000FCFA.. Ce bénéfice servira à rembourser les intérêts du prêt et contribuer aux dépenses de la famille
texts.en:
Mrs. Oumou Dembélé, age 48, is married and the mother of 6 children. She lives in a nuclear family in Sanankoroba, located 20 kilometers from Bamako, the capital of Mali. Like many other women eager to alleviate their poverty, Oumou Dembélé joined the loan program of Kiva's partner Soro Yiriwaso. After three solidarity loans (group loans) that were all repaid without problems, she's now seeking her fourth personal loan. She intends to use it to buy 600 kg of peanuts, 250 kg of yams, and various other items at the markets in Sanankoroba and in the surrounding villages. She sells her goods on a stall at the market, for cash or on credit, to a clientele comprising mostly women. She expects to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 120'000 (ca US$ 240), to be used to repay the loan and to help with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanuts, yams, and various other items

loans.name: Sokhai

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhai S., 38, and her husband, Mr. Narai Chea, 45, were married in 1984 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. One son studies in university in Phnom Penh and four children attend the local school and last is still young. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

Sokhai has been selling fish for over ten years. She buys them from the Prek Phnao market and resells them at the market in Kilomet Number Six in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a rice farmer for twenty years. Beside of farming he is a fisherman as well. Sohai is requesting her first loan of $500 to pay tuition for her son and to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.use: To pay tuition for her son and to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Kosal

texts.en:
Mr. Kosal M., 33, and his wife, Mrs. Hel Phally, 29, were married in 2003 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both of them are still young. Kosal also has a brother, who is a security guard in Phnom Penh, and a sister, who is a tailor.  Both are living with him. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Kosal has been driving a motor taxi in Phnom Penh for three years. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. Kosal is requesting his first loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorcycle for his brother to drive to work and to buy a sewing machine for his sister.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his brother to drive to work and buy a sewing machine for his sister.

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi sells tubers of yam to her customers. She hopes to expand this business. She needs the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more tubers of yam to sell. She is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yam to sell

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Union) Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Benkadi  sont toutes mariées, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et 3 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier médina Koura  de la  ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso, république du Mali).
 Elles se sont  connues à travers des liens  de voisinage et pour la pratique de la même activité. Elles exercent  plusieurs  activités notamment la restauration, la vente de jus  de boissons de fabrication locale et de fruits.
 Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Benkadi a décidé d’intégrer   l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son huitième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe) tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter  des sacs de riz, de sucre et divers condiments. Elles s’approvisionnent en fruits dans les vergers et en condiments au marché. Elles effectuent leurs ventes dans leurs gargotes où les clients en se restaurant achètent les fruits et les jus, en détail au comptant.
 Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 110 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. Elles ont pour ambition d’agrandir leurs activités.
texts.en:
The five women of the group Benkadi are all married and average 29 years of age and 3 children each. They live in large traditional extended families in the Médina Koura district of the city of Koutiala (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali). They know one another by neighborhood ties, and they work in the same fields, notably the restaurant business and selling locally-made fruit beverages.

In order to satisfy the ever-growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their eighth solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

The women plan to use this loan to buy sacks of rice, sugar, and various condiments. Supplies of fruit are gotten from orchards, and the condiments are gotten from the marketplace. Sales are made retail through their eateries, where customers pay cash and buy fruit and juices.

The group members each hope to realize an average profit of 110,000 francs CFA in the course of this cycle. The profits will be used to pay the loan interest, to provide for the extended family, and to invest the rest in business. Their ambition is to expand their businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, condiments, fruit, and ingredients drinks

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 50 years old and married with 6 children. She sells soup ingredients. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more soup ingredients to sell. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more soup ingredients to sell

loans.name: Ambè Alako (Nous Suivons Dieu) Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Ambé alako  sont toutes mariées, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et 3 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier médina Koura  de la  ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso, république du Mali). 
Elles se sont  connues à travers des liens  de voisinage et pour la pratique de la même activité. Elles exercent comme activité principale la vente de poissons fumés, de tubercules et de légumes.
