Ynes M. is the representative of this group, and she is a perfect example of what micro-credit can do in a person's life. Ynes is the mother of one young child and before receiving her first loan, she was having a hard time feeding her child each day. Ynes had no real source of income and was just scrapping by each day. Ynes came to Esperanza International and took out her first loan a few years ago and started a small salon, selling beauty products. Through her hard work and diligence she is now taking out her seventh loan from Esperanza, and she can finally provide for her child. Her child is the love of her life, and she is so happy that she can put him through school! All she wants is a great life for her child, and she is on the right path! Ynes is so happy for the opportunity she received a couple years back, and is excited for her future! 

Thank you for all your support!!

loans.use: Buy products for her salon

loans.name: Saifiddin

texts.ru: Давлатову Сайфидину 57 лет, он женат. Даже по меркам востока он считается отцом героем – у него 8 детей. Почти все они уже имеют свои семьи и живут отдельно от родителей. Постоянной работы у Сайфиддина нету и поэтому он занимается частным предпринимательством. Его основной ассортимент это строительные материалы. На полученный доход он содержит свою семью. Сайфиддин решил получить займ для расширения своего бизнеса и получить займ.
texts.en:
Saifiddin D. is 57 years old and married. Even by the standards of the East, he is considered a “father-hero” because he has 8 children. Most of them already have their own families and live separately from the parents. Saifiddin does not have a permanent job; this is why he engages in private entrepreneurship. His main goods assortment is construction materials. The profit from the business allows him to support his family. Saifiddin decided to obtain this loan to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand assortment

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Додохоновой Саиде 34 года, замужем и воспитывает 1 ребенка. С Микроинвест сотрудничает в течении полугода. Ее основное занятие это купля продажа косточек от абрикосов. Каждую неделю она выходит на местные рынки и закупает абрикосовые косточки. Если получается продать дороже, то она сразу продает, а если цена ее не устраивает то она привозит косточки домой. Отсортировав косточки по размеру, она выносит их на следующий базар и там продает. Ее доход составляет дополнительный доход в семью. Саида собирается получить новый займ и так как сезонная цена на косточки низкая закупить их оптом.
texts.en:
Saida D. is 34 years old, married and raising one child. She has been partnering with MicroInvest for half a year. Her main business is buying and selling apricot seeds. Every week she goes to local markets and buys apricot seeds. If she can sell them at a profit there, then she does so right away. If not, then she brings the seeds home. She then sorts them and takes them to another market to sell. Saida’s profit has become a supplemental income for her family. She plans to obtain a new loan to help her buy seeds wholesale at a current low seasonal price.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For wholesale purchase of apricot seeds

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua B. is 33 years old. She is married and has three children -- two are currently in school and the youngest one is still an infant. Afua and her family live in Tarkwa in the western region of Ghana. She is a food vendor who serves food like rice and stew. She sells her products in a community school to the school children. Afua says demand for her food is high but she does not have adequate funds to expand. Afua also sells fresh fruits like oranges.

She wants to use the loan to buy more meat and rice so she can increase her efficiency by  cooking in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to support her family and finance her children education. Afua belongs to the village bank called ‘Adom Akyede’ meaning the Gift of Grace. She is grateful for your assistance. She hopes to receive GHS 400 to make her business grow by restocking her inventory. Afua has been in business for five years.

loans.use: To buy rice, vegetables, meat, firewood, and oranges

loans.name: Musharraf

texts.ru: Мушарраф 57 лет, у нее 5 детей. Все ее дети уже имеют свои семьи и живут отдельно. Основной доход семьи составляет заработок ее мужа. У Мушарраф есть свой маленький бизнес – она занимается куплей продажей национальных платьев. Она закупает их как на местных рынках, также привозит их из других дальних базаров. У нее бойкая торговля, она получает хороший доход. С Микроинвест сотрудничает уже 1,5 года. Мушарраф подала заявку на новый займ и собирается закупить весенний ассортимент платьев.
texts.en:
Musharraf is 57 years old and has 5 children. All of her children already have families of their own and live separately. The primary family income comes from her husband; however, Musharraf also has her own small business. She buys and sells traditional dresses. She buys them at local and out-of-town markets. Because her business is busy, Musharraf receives a good profit from it. She has been partnering with MicroInvest for one and a half years. Musharraf wants to obtain a new loan in order to purchase spring assortment of dresses.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For wholesale purchase of spring dresses

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana O. is 47 years old. She is a wife and a mother of five children. She is a resourceful and very enterprising woman. She lives with her family in their family house in Wasa Simpa, a suburb in Tarkwa in the western region of Ghana. Her husband is a crop farmer.

Nana operates a local restaurant and sells local food like banku and okro soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is eaten with hot pepper or soup. She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she is no longer able to afford her production expenses. This has harmed the quality of production. She has been in this business for the last six years. She also sells foods, like yam and plantains, in the community marketplace at Tarkwa.

Nana needs a loan to add capital to her business to increase production and maintain quality. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. Nana belongs to a village bank called "Luke." She would be grateful for the assistance. She hopes to receive GH¢1000 to improve her business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana F. is 27 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. All of her children are in school and are doing very well. She has been trading in the community of Wasa Simpa in the western region of Ghana where she lives with her family.

She has been a local manufacturer of palm oil for four years. She has been doing this business with her husband. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits. She produces and supplies palm oil to food vendors to prepare their meals and she even treks to the villages to purchase the finished goods when demand becomes very high. She and her husband also travel to the big cities for supplies. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more palm nut fruits and an electric milling machine to increase her efficiency and allow her to produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business and to raise more income so she can help her husband to provide food for her family and finance her children's education. 

Susana belongs to a village bank called "Luke." She hopes to receive GH¢600 to improve her business by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more palm nut fruit.

loans.name: Teresa Isabel

texts.es:
La microempresaria Teresa Isabel Chávez tiene 73 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos todos mayores de edad, 3 de estos viven en sus propias casas y 1 aun vive con su madre en compañía de su esposa y los hijos de este. Doña Teresa tiene mas de 30 años de dedicarse a  administrar una pulpería la cual le a servido para poder mantener y darle educación a todos sus hijos ya que doña Teresa es viuda desde hace 30 años.

La pulpería de doña teresa es una de las más viejas del sector donde habita, lo que le permite poder tener una buena cantidad de clientes. Actualmente la preocupación de estas microempresaria no son sus hijos sino mas bien sus nietos los conviven con ella y que espera poder darles al igual que hizo con todos sus hijos una educación que les permita poder enfrentarse ante  la vida por si solos.

Sin embargo al igual que muchos otros microempresarios no cuentan con el apoyo de instituciones bancarias por los requisitos que estos solicitan y por tal razón recurre nuevamente ante ADEPHCA y Kiva para que se le pueda financiar la compra de los siguientes productos:

2 Quintales de Frijoles a US$ 40 dólar cada quintal, 3 quintales de arroz americano a US$ 61 dólar cada quintal, 3 quintales de  harina a US$ 50 dólar cada quintal, 3 cajas de  leche la lechera a US$ 45 dólar cada caja, 5 cajas sopa maruchan a US$ 12 dólar cada caja, 4 cajas de huevos de gallina a US$ 35 dólar cada caja, 2 docenas de café presto grande a US$ 3 dólar cada unidad, 3 quintales de azúcar a US$ 30 dólar cada quintal y 3 bolsones de papel higiénico a US$ 30 dólar cada bolsón.
texts.en:
Microentrepreneur Teresa Isabel Chávez is 73 years old. She is the mother of four grown children, three of whom live in their own houses. One still lives with his mother along with his wife and their children. Teresa has spent more than 30 years running a general store, which enabled her to raise and educate all of her children, as she was widowed 30 years ago. The general store where Teresa works is one of the oldest in her neighborhood, which has brought her many customers. Today, her concern is not her children but rather the grandchildren that live with her. She hopes to give them everything she gave her own children--an education that will enable them to face life independently. Like so many other microentrepreneurs, however, she does not have the support of banking institutions because she does not meet their requirements. For this reason, she has returned to Adephca and Kiva to finance the purchase of the following products: 2 quintals of Frijoles @ $40/each; 3 quintals of American rice @ $61/each; 3 quintals of flour @ $50/each; 3 cases of La Lechera milk @ $45/each; 5 cases of Maruchan soup @ $12/each; 4 cases of eggs @ $35/each; 2 dozen units of instant coffee @ $3/each; 3 quintals of sugar @ $30/each; and 3 packages of toilet paper @ $30/each.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Frijoles, American rice, flour, milk, soup, eggs, coffee, sugar and toilet paper

loans.name: Milagros De Cumayasa 1 Group

texts.en:
Yokatsa R. is the representative of a group of five women. These five women are from a group called "Milagros de Cumayasa." The members come from a very poor area in San Pedro, Dominican Republic. When this group first came to Esperanza International, almost none of the members had a steady income, and all were having a difficult time paying for life's basic necessities. Now, through hard work, this whole group is receiving their 4th loan, and are continuing to grow their small businesses. 

Yokatsa is a mother to one young child and wants nothing more than a better life for that child. With her first loan, she started a small beauty salon in her house and now has a very successful business. For the first time in her life, she feels like she has something of her own, and feels like she can provide her child with all the things he needs. She is excited to continue expanding her business, and feels like this next loan will really help her salon. Thanks for all your support!

loans.use: To buy products for her salon

loans.name: Milagros De Cumayasa 2 Group

texts.en:
Milagros de Cumayasa 2 is a group of five woman all hoping to receive a loan. Each member of this group has already received a previous loan and all the women already have started their own small business. Each member has already experienced some success and now want to continue growing their business. 

Julia P. is the representative of this group and she has been a very good, outspoken leader for the women. Julia is the mother of four young children and knows she has to work hard if she wants her children to have a better life. Julia always had a dream to send all her children to school, but before receiving her first loan, she had no way of generating income. She came to Esperanza International in hopes of receiving a loan to start her own business. 

With her first loan she started a small business selling jewelry in her area and specializing in silver. With this next loan, she hopes to be able to buy more products for her business. She is excited that she is succeeding at something and that she has something that is all hers. She has never been so happy now that her children are going to school and she knows that she is going to be able to provide them a better life than she has had. 

Thanks for your support!!

loans.use: Buying products for jewelry business

loans.name: Milagros De Cumayasa 3 Group

texts.en:
Milagros de Cumayasa 3 is a group of women hoping to receive their fourth loan. Each member of this group has already experienced some success and each have their own small business. With this fourth loan, the women are all hoping that they can increase the size of their businesses and continue to improve their lives. This has been a very good group, and the three previous loans were all paid back on time and in full.

Amanda P. is the group representative and a women who is a proven hard worker. Amanda is the mother of five children, so she has had to work hard her whole life to support all those children. Her children range in age from 32 all the way down to 11. 

With her first three loans, Amanda started a successful business selling quilts and pillowcases. She has always been a great seamstress and, when she took out her first loan, she knew exactly what she wanted to do with it. She has continued to increase the size of her business with each loan and now is earning a good salary. She hopes to continue increasing in size and wants to show her young children, and even her older children, what is possible through hard work. She is very excited about her future, and can't wait to put this next loan to work! 

Thank you for your support!!

loans.use: To buy materials for quilts and pillowcases

loans.name: Colaboradores 5 Group

texts.en:
Group 5 from Los Colaboradores (Contributors) Bank of Hope are starting their second loan with Esperanza International. This is a group of 5 young women in search of better means for their families, specially for their young children. 

Yolanda P. is the group coordinator. She has two children, ages 3 and 2, and is only 22 years old. She has no formal education, and selling clothes is her sole source of income. She will purchase different items with the loan in order to be well stocked and be able to have stock available for her clients for a longer period of time. Getting ahead in life with her young children is her biggest challenge, but she doesn't waste her energy. She hopes to own a clothing store someday. 

On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for supporting the initiative of these young women!

loans.use: To purchase new items to resell

loans.name: David 3 Group

texts.en:
The four members of Group 3 from David Bank of Hope in La Romana will begin their second loan. They hope this new loan will help them strengthen their businesses, several of which were started with their first loan. 

Lavila P. is the group coordinator. She has two children, ages 4 and 7. She sells clothes and will use her entire second loan to buy new merchandise so that she has stock and can produce profits for a longer period of time. Lavila could not get any formal education, but she knows how important it is in order to have better income-generating activities. She dreams of seeing her children graduate from college from a career of their choice. This is why she works very hard to take her clothes-selling business to her ultimate goal, which is to have her own boutique. 

Thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: Purchase new merchandise

loans.name: David 4 Group

texts.en:
The members of Group 6 from David Bank of Hope are starting their second loan cycle with Esperanza International. Four of them are involved in retail sales, selling clothes and personal care products. Altagracia N. makes bread and pastries at her home for sale.

Yaquelin Y. is the group representative. This young mother of 5 children (ages 8, 5,3, 2 and 5 months) sells clothes to support her five children. This is not an easy task, since she is a single parent. Her children, being so young, require a lot of attention; so it becomes very challenging for Yaquelin to run her business.
 
Yaquelin doesn't want to sell clothes forever. She dreams of running a big convenience store one day. She hopes that the profits from her business will allow her to support her children's education. She hopes at least one of them decides to become a doctor. 

Thank you for supporting the hard work of these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To buy merchandise to resell

loans.name: Eva Rayda

texts.es:
Eva es socia del Banco Comunal Firmeza.
Eva es soltera, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Eva se dedica a la compra y venta de tara, producto que adquiere en las ferias, luego de acopiarlo lo envía a la ciudad de Lima a su hermano que exporta este producto. Además Eva se dedica a la venta de seguros contra accidentes.
Eva necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tara.
Los sueños de Eva son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Eva is a member of Firmenza Communal Bank. She is single, 43 years old and has three children. Eva buys and sells tara, which she acquires in markets. After collecting them, she sends them to her brother in Lima, who exports them. Eva also sells accident insurance. She needs a loan of 2000 soles to invest in the purchase of tara. Eva's dream is to provide a good education for her children so they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tara

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina es socia del Banco Comunal Firmeza.
Marcelina es divorciada, tiene 38 años y 1 hija, Marcelina es instructora de aeróbicos y hace algunos meses inauguro su propio gimnasio, negocio que esta creciendo, Marcelina tiene proyectado implementar con mas servicios como masajes, nutricionista. Además Marcelina vende cosméticos, medicina natural por catálogos.
Marcelina necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de extractor, licuadora y para pintar un ambiente para el cafetín.
Marcelina sueña con implementar su gimnasio con maquinas exclusivas para mujeres, salón de spinning, sauna y brindarle una educación de calidad a su hija.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of Communal Bank Firmeza. She is 38 years old, divorced, and has a daughter. Marcelina is an aerobics instructor. A few months ago she opened her own gym, a business that is growing. Marcelina plans to add more services such as massage and a nutritionist. She also sells cosmetics and natural medicine through catalogs. Marcelina needs a loan of 2600 soles that will be invested in the purchase of a juicer/blender and to paint a room for a cafe. Marcelina dreams of equipping her gym with machines exclusively for women, a spinning room and sauna, and of providing a quality education for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a juicer/blender and to paint a room for a café

loans.name: Fortunita

texts.es:
Fortunita es socia del Banco Comunal Firmeza.
Fortunita es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Fortunita junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de chompas, pantalones, gorros, actividad que realizan de manera ambulatoria en diferentes mercados y calles de la ciudad de Ayacucho, para lo cual cuentan con un triciclo, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Juliaca. 
Fortunita necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chompas, pantalones.
Los sueños de Fortunita son ampliar su casa, surtir con mas productos su negocio, sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Fortunita is a member of Communal Bank Firmeza. Fortunita lives with her partner, is 40 years old, and has 4 children. Fortunita and her husband are ambulatory vendors of sweaters, pants and hats at different markets and on the streets of the city of Ayacucho, for which they use a three wheeled cart. They acquire their products in the city of Juliaca. Fortunita needs a loan of 2000 soles that will be invested in the purchase of sweaters and pants. Fortunita's dreams are to add on to her house, have a larger selection of products for her business, and that her children go to school and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of sweaters and pants

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es socia del Banco Comunal Firmeza.
Silvia es casada, tiene 48 años y 2 hijos, Silvia tiene un kiosco ubicado al frente D. un grifo en donD. venD. bebidas variadas, panes, golosinas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual D. sus hijos.
Silvia necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. gaseosas.
Los sueños D. Silvia son terminar D. construir su casa y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of the Firmeza community bank. She is married, 48 years old and has two children. She has a kiosk across from a filling station where she sells drinks, breads, snacks, etc., a business that she operates every day with some help from her children. Silvia needs a 1200-soles loan, money that she will use to buy cold drinks to resell. Silvia's greatest wishes are to finish building her house and to see her children complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for grocery business.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Basilia es socia del Banco Comunal Firmeza.
Basilia es soltera, tiene 25 años y vive con su mama, Basilia se dedica a la venta de productos naturales Herbalife que son suplementos alimenticios. Basilia estudios cosmetología y se dedica a realizar manicure a domicilio.
Basilia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de 4 batidos nutricionales.
Los sueños de Basilia son construir su casa y tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Basilia is a member of the Firmeza community bank. She is single, 25 years old and lives with her mother. She makes a living selling natural Herbalife food supplements. She is studying to become a cosmetologist and manicurist. Basilia needs a 1000-soles loan that she will use to buy nutritional products for resale. Her greatest hopes are to build a house and own a shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Guillermita De Los Angeles

texts.en:
Guillermina de los Angeles C. is a married, fifty-seven year-old woman who is seeking a new loan to help finance her retail store. She has successfully repaid seven prior loans and has more than ten years dedicated to the sale of general retail items in her profitable store. 

Since Guillermina de los Angeles operates her business out of the central commercial market, and responds to the needs of a wide range of customers, she travels to the capital city of Managua one or two times per month to purchase the best quality of goods. With the sale of these goods, Guillermina de los Angeles receives weekly revenue to cover basic costs, and is moderately subsidized by her husband’s pension, but still seeks a Kiva loan to help advance her business to the next level of success. 

Guillermina de los Angeles is no longer supporting her two grown, married children, and therefore wishes to put all profits from the business towards her retirement in the coming years. Her most profitable items are clothes, shoe products, female perfumes, and lotions. Please help this dear woman realize her dreams to retire in the next few years and spend more time with her grandchildren!

loans.use: Clothes, shoe supplies, perfume products, and lotions.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Roly Jesus

texts.es:
Roly es socio del Banco Comunal Firmeza.
Roly es casado, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos, Roly se dedica a la venta de seguros contra accidentes, además de asesoramiento en temas de seguro, para lo cual cuenta con un local alquilado.
Roly necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago para adquirir una moto.
Roly sueña con tener una empresa de seguros de mayor cobertura y ofrecer mas productos.
texts.en:
Roly is a member of the Firmeza community bank. He is married, 24 years old and has two children. He makes a living selling accident insurance and consulting on insurance matters, a business for which he has a rented office. Roly needs a 1000-soles loan that he will use to partly pay for a motorcycle. Roly wants to own a bigger insurance business with larger coverages and more products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Partly pay for a motorcycle.

loans.name: Karen Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Roxana es casada, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Roxana tiene 2 mototaxi que alquila diariamente, además junto a su esposo se dedican en la venta de carros usados que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además Roxana trabaja como secretaria en una Notaria.
Roxana necesita un préstamo de 2800 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago para adquirir un carro.
Roxana sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y que prospere su negocio.
texts.en:
Roxana is a member of the Violeta community bank. She is married, 36 years old and has 4 children. She owns 2 mototaxis that she rents by the day and operates a business with her husband selling used carts bought in Lima. In addition to that, she works as a secretary in a "Notaria" [registry office?]. Roxana needs a 2800-soles loan that she will use to partly pay for a cart. Her greatest hopes are to see her children take up professional careers and her business prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Partly pay for a cart for transportation business.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Genoveva es casada, tiene 51 años y 7 hijos, Genoveva viaja todas las semanas a la selva ayacuchana en donD. venD. abarrotes, cereales, verduras, en la ciudad D. Monterrico en donD. se queda 4 días, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo.
Genoveva necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite.
Los sueños D. Genoveva son ahorrar su dinero y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Genoveva is a member of the Violeta community bank. She is married, 51 years old and has 7 children. Every week, she goes to the city of Monterrico in the Ayacuchan jungle where she sells groceries, a business she operates with her husband. Genoveva needs a 2000-soles loan that she will use to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc. She wants to save her money and build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Luisa es casada, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos, Luisa viaja a las ferias en donD. compra animales que luego transporta a la ciudad D. Ayacucho, sus ventas los realiza en la feria D. San Juan y en algunas oportunidades los beneficia y venD. por mayor.
Luisa necesita un préstamo D. 2600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ganado vacuno y porcino.
Los sueños D. Luisa son tener mas capital, comprar un carro para transportar los animales y construir el segundo piso D. su casa.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the Violeta Community Bank. She is married, is 48 years old, and has 4 children. Luisa travels to the markets where she buys animals which she then transports to the city of Ayacucho. Her sales take place at the San Juan market and on some occasions she improves the animals and sells wholesale. Luisa needs a loan of 2600 Peruvian soles that will be invested in the purchase of cattle and pigs. Luisa's dreams are to have more capital, to buy a car to transport the animals, and to build the second floor of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cattle and pigs

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Valentina es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Valentina viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, productos que transporta con un carro alquilado.
Valentina necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa, zanahoria.
Los sueños de Valentina son construir el segundo piso de su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Valentina is a member of the Violeta communal bank. She lives with her common-law husband, is 35 years old and has 4 children. Valentina travels to the Ayacucho jungle where she sells groceries and vegetables, which she transports in a rented car. She needs a loan for 1500 soles, which will be used to buy potatoes and carrots. Valentina dreams include building a second floor onto her house and providing a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes and carrots.

loans.name: Caminemos Hacia Adelante Group

texts.en:
"Caminemos Hacia Adelante" or "Walking Forward" is a group of ten entrepreneurs seeking their second loan from Esperanza International. The group’s past loan has been successfully repaid and the group hopes to use additional loan funds for further business expansion. 

EstelL. is one of the coordinators for this group in Santiago. EstelL. sells undergarments to her community and neighboring communities.  EstelL. used her first loan, which has now been completely repaid, to buy additional products and EsteL. was able to increase the return on her business by adding inventory.  EstelL. wants to use her second loan to buy more undergarments to sell to her customers.  

EstelL. lives with her mother and sister and dreams of improving the house they live in and plans to use her business profits to do so.  Other members of EstelL.’s microfinance bank run similar entrepreneurial activities including arts, juice, ice-cream, fried food, and cake sales.      

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: To buy more undergarments to sell

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
Clementina es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Clementina es soltera, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Clementina vende emoliente (bebida caliente preparada a base de semillas de lino y hierbas que tiene propiedades curativas) actividad que realiza de manera ambulatoria, para lo cual cuenta con una carretilla. Además Clementina vende golosinas en el mismo lugar.
Clementina necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, golosinas, hierbas, linaza.
Los sueños de Clementina son mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Clementina is a member of the Violeta communal bank. She is single, 45 years old and has 4 children. Clementina sells "emoliente" (a hot drink made from flax seeds and herbs which has curative properties), which she sells on the streets from a cart. In addition, she sells candies. Clementina needs a loan for 1200 soles which will be used to buy sugar, candies, herbs and flax seed. Her dreams including improving her business and that her children complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, candies, herbs and flax seed.

loans.name: Rosa Elia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Elia P. Ramírez es empleada de maquiladora, tiene 20 años laborando para la misma empresa; ella tiene a su cargo un nieto que le dejo uno de sus hijos porque el ya no quiso hacerse cargo de el. La señora Rosa Elia P. cuenta con una discapacidad Labio leporino.
Toda su vida ha vivido en una casa que le presto su hermano, ella siente que ya es tiempo de adquirir su propia vivienda por un lado todo su esfuerzo y ganas de prosperar son por el nieto que al ver que esta creciendo necesita su espacio y un sustento para el futuro.
El tipo de vivienda que va adquirir es de interés social esta se le va descontando vía nomina por un lapso de 20 años pero para iniciar tramites piden una cantidad que ella por el momento no cuenta el efectivo.
texts.en:
Rosa Elia P. Ramírez is an employee of a maquiladora factory and has been working for the same company for 20 years. She takes care of a grandson, which one of her children left her because they no longer wanted to be responsible for him. Rosa Elia P. has a disability, a cleft lip. For her entire life she has lived in a house that her brother loaned her. She feels that it is time she gets her own home, on the one hand all of her efforts to succeed are for her grandson and seeing that he is growing up he needs his space and a means of support for the future. The type of house she is going to buy is social housing, which will be deducted from her pay over 20 years, but to start the paperwork they ask for an amount of money which she does not currently have.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase housing.

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.en:
“Genesis” is a group of five entrepreneurs seeking their first loan from Esperanza International.  This group, as a part of a larger, successful microfinance bank of 35 members, hopes to use their first microfinance loan to finance current businesses, or in the case of the group’s coordinator, Juana, finance a new entrepreneurial activity.  

Juana, mother of four (ages 18, 15, 14, and 12), resides in Santiago and plans to use her microfinance funds to finalize the opening of her variety-sales business.  Juana desires to purchase additional products, especially shoes and lotions, to sell to neighboring communities.  Juana desires to continue to provide for the physical needs of her family and spouse and hopes to see growth in her business throughout the term of her loan.

Other member’s of Juana’s bank run similar entrepreneurial activities, including sales of clothing and fried food, or “quipe."

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase inventory for variety-sales business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Margarita es conviviente, tiene 58 años y 1 hijo, Margarita tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, helados, tarjetas telefónicas, gas, también tiene teléfono publico, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Margarita necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de útiles escolares.
Margarita sueña con implementar mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Violeta communal bank. She lives with her common-law husband, is 58 years old and has 1 son. Margarita has a convenience store in her house where she sells groceries, ice cream, phone cards, gas and also has a public telephone. She works every day. Margarita needs a loan for 1000 soles which she will use to buy school supplies. She dreams of expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: Gerardo Eloy

texts.es: El Señor Gerardo M. es un señor emprendedor que no quiere que su familia se alarme con esta crisis, si no que el tiempo transcurre y no hay quien lo pare. El puso una tienda de Abarrotes la cual ha ido muy bien ya tiene siete meses en el negocio y quiere un préstamo para comprar mas mercancía, comenta que entre mas surtido y variedad aumenta mas sus ventas y su capital. El tiene dos hijos los cuales dependen de le  y están en etapa escolar lo cual piensa que con mas ingresos extras les podrá dar mejor educación;  también el trabaja en una maquiladora de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Gerardo M. is a enterprising man who does not want his family to worry over the financial crisis, but rather that time goes on and there is no stopping him. He set up a grocery store 7 months ago which has gone very well, and he would like a loan to buy more merchandise. He says that the more inventory and variety he has, the more his sales and profit increase. He has two children who depend on him and are in school and he thinks with more income he can give them a better education. He also works in a maquiladora factory in town.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: La Union Group

texts.en:
“La Union” is a group of ten entrepreneurs seeking their third loan from Esperanza International.  The group’s past loans have been successfully repaid, and the group hopes to use the additional loan funds for further business expansion.  Sara is the president of this group in the city of Santiago.  

Sara, mother of a two year old daughter, has used her past two Esperanza loans to fund her “colmado”, or small grocery store.  With her first loan, Sara ran her own small colmado until a member of her microfinance bank became ill and could no longer run her colmado.  Sara merged the two colmados and with her second loan was able to fund the joint effort.  The previously ill member of the bank is now healthy and will be taking over the joint colmado and Sara will use her third loan to start a new business selling used clothing.  Sara is able to buy used clothing in bulk packages and sell to her neighbors and neighboring communities.  When asked about the dreams for her business and life, Sara declares that she intends to help those who are ill as she has in the past and to continue to provide a good life for her child.  

Other members of Sara’s microfinance bank run similar entrepreneurial activities including a beauty salon, cake sales, and a small restaurant.  

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase Used Clothing to Sell

loans.name: Jesus Antonio

texts.es:
Jesús es socio del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Jesús es conviviente, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Jesús de acuerdo a la temporada y demanda vende diferentes productos como en época escolar vende mochilas, en carnavales talco, serpentinas. Sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Jesús necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de talcos y serpentinas.
Los sueños de Jesús son incrementar su capital, comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Jesús is a member of the communal bank, "Las Gaviotas." Jesús has a live-in girlfriend, is 38, and has 3 children. In accordance with the seasons and demand, Jesús sells different products. During the school year, he sells backpacks. During carnivals, he sells talc and streamers. He gets his products from the city of Lima. Jesús needs a loan of 1000 soles, which he will invest in the purchase of talc and streamers. The dreams of Jesús are to increase his capital and to purchase a car to transport his products.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase talc and streamers

loans.name: Enriqueta Juana

texts.es:
Enriqueta  es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas.
Enriqueta es casada, tiene 44 años y 1 hijo, Enriqueta tiene una bodega en un local alquilado en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, bebidas variadas, tarjetas telefónicas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Enriqueta necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tarjetas telefónicas y cerveza.
El sueño de Enriqueta es surtir con mas productos su negocio.
texts.en:
Enriqueta is a member of the Las Gaviotas ("The Seagulls") Community Bank. Enriqueta is married, is 44 years old and has one child. Enriqueta has a store in a rented space where she sells general groceries, produce, various drinks, phone cards -- an activity that she performs every day. Enriqueta needs a loan of 1,000 Soles which will be invested in the purchase of phone cards and beer. Enriqueta's dream is to stock her business with more products.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of phone cards and beer.

loans.name: Mujeres Con Esperanza Group

texts.en:
“Mujeres con Esperanza”, or Women with Hope, is a group of fifteen entrepreneurs seeking additional loan funds from Esperanza International.  The group’s prior loan has been successfully repaid and the group hopes to use additional loan funds for further business expansion.  MarieL. is one of the coordinators for this group in Santiago.

MarieL., mother of two and proud grandmother of three grandchildren (ages: 13, 6, 3), lives with her husband and sells beauty products.  With funds from her prior loans from Esperanza, MarieL. has been able to establish a loyal customer base and her customers are able to buy her beauty products on credit and pay for their purchases at the end of the month.  This agreement allows for a flexible payment system and has been very successful for MarieL..  MarieL. plans to use her next loan to purchase additional beauty supplies to increase her inventory.  MarieL. dreams of a “beautiful house” and plans on using her profits towards that goal.  

Other members of MarieL.’s bank run similar entrepreneurial activities including ice cream, clothing and perfume sales, as well as small restaurants.

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase Beauty Supplies to Sell to Customers

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria es socia del Banco Comunal Las Hormigas.
Gregoria es casada, tiene 52 años y 3 hijos, Gregoria junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta D. carros usados, Tienen un taller mecánico en un local alquilado, además hacen carretas para tractores que son utilizados para el transporte D. carga, estas carretas los fabrican D. carros viejos que desarman y utilizan algunas piezas.
Gregoria necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido como parte D. pago D. un carro.
Los sueños D. Gregoria son construir su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of Las Hormigas ("The Ants") Community Bank. Gregoria is married, is 52 years old and has three children. Gregoria, along with her husband, is dedicated to selling used cars. They have a mechanic shop in a rented space. Additionally, they make tractor carts that are used for transporting cargo. They make these carts from old cars which they breakdown and use some pieces. Gregoria needs a loan of 2,000 soles which will be invested in a car payment. Gregoria's dreams are to build a house and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car payment

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal Las Hormigas.
Graciela es separada, tiene 41 años y 1 hija, Graciela vende productos naturales, tiene una tienda en la ciudad de Lima en un local alquilado, Graciela vive en la ciudad de Lima porque su hija esta estudiando en la universidad. Además Graciela en algunas oportunidades vende loceria de acuerdo a los pedidos de sus clientes.
Graciela necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicina natural y loceria.
Los sueños de Graciela son comprar una casa en la ciudad de Lima y que su hija culmine sus estudios y sea profesional.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of Las Hormigas ("The Ants") Community Bank. Graciela is separated, is 41 years old and has one daughter. Graciela sells natural products. She has a shop in the city of Lima in a rented space. Graciela lives in the city of Lima because her daughter is studying at university. Additionally, Graciela, on some occasions, sells pottery according to orders from customers. Graciela needs a loan of 2,000 soles which will be invested in the purchase of natural medicine and pottery. Graciela's dreams are to purcahse a house in the city of Lima and that her daughter finishes her studies and becomes a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of natural medicine and pottery.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchando Por El Progreso Group

texts.en:
“Mujeres Luchando Por El Progresso”, or Women Fighting for Progress, is a group of ten entrepreneurs seeking additional loan funds from Esperanza International.  The group’s past loan has been successfully repaid, and the group hopes to use additional loan funds for further business expansion.  Altagracia is one of the coordinators for this group in Santiago.

Altagracia, mother of three (ages: 7, 5, 2), operates a “colmado” or small food stand  selling Dominican staple foods such as rice, oil, bread, and sugar.  Due to Altagracia’s established clientele base she is able to sell her food items on credit to her customers and collect the money in installment payments. This makes it easier for her customers to purchase the food items they need.  Altragracia wants to see her business grow so that she can continue to provide for the physical needs of her three children and husband.

Other members of Altagracia’s bank run similar entrepreneurial activities including bean, undergarment, and shoe sales as well as a restaurant and beauty salon.
  
On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Buy Additional Food Offerings for "Colmado"

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Las Hormigas.
Isabel es separada, tiene 40 años y 5 hijos, Isabel es vende frutas variadas de manera ambulatoria cerca al cementerio de la ciudad, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hijo.
Isabel necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de frutas variadas.
Los sueños de Isabel son construir su casa y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the Las Hormigas ("The Ants") Community Bank. Isabel is separated, is 40 years old and has five children. Isabel sells various fruit on foot near the city cemetary, an activity that she performs every day with the help of her son. Isabel needs a loan of 1,200 soles which will be invested in the purchase of various fruit. Isabel's dreams are to build a house and that her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of various fruit.

loans.name: Gladys Reyna

texts.es:
Gladis es socia del Banco Comunal Las Hormigas.
Gladis es casada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Gladis se dedica a la venta de lanas en el penal de la ciudad de Ayacucho, a donde acude los días miércoles y sábados, días de visita. Además Gladis tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende verduras, carnes y abarrotes en general.
Gladis necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Gladis son que sus negocios progresen y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Gladis is a member of the Las Hormigas ("The Ants") Community Bank. Gladis is married, is 40 years old and has four children. Gladis is dedicated to selling wool in the jail of Ayacucho city, where she goes to visit on Wednesdays and Saturdays. Additionally, Gladis has a shop in her house from where she sells produce, meat and general groceries. Gladis needs a loan of 1,000 soles which will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar. Gladis' dreams are that her businesses progress and that her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Las Hormigas.
Maria es casada, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Maria junto a su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de precocidos como pallar, arveja, garbanzo, panza, patas, también elabora gelatina natural de pata, sus ventas los realiza a domicilio dependiendo de los pedidos, también vende ambulatoriamente.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azucar, leña, descartables, bolsas.
Los sueños de Maria son tener una empresa de precocidos en un local estable y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the community bank, Las Hormigas ('The Ants'). She is 43-years old, married, and has three children. Maria and her husband prepare butter beans, peas, chickpeas, tripe, beef shank, and natural gelatin made from hooves. They sell these dishes from home when there are customer orders, and also sell from a handcart. Maria needs a loan of 2,000 PEN to invest in the purchase of sugar, firewood, disposable utensils, and bags. She dreams of running her business from a permanent location, and seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, firewood, disposable utensils, and bags.

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.en:
Maria Salome is 30 years old and is married with five children. Her two oldest kids are in school and her husband works in construction, which helps with household expenses. Maria’s business is a store that she runs out of her home. She sells everyday consumer goods like food, drinks, soap, etc. She is requesting this loan in order to increase the variety of products she sells. Maria’s dream is to increase sales and to one day have a larger business.

***********************************************************************************

Maria Salome, es casada, tiene 30 años de edad y cinco hijos.  Los 2 mayores van a la escuela.  Su esposo se trabaja en la construcción, y le ayuda con los gastos de su casa.   Su negocio es una tienda de productos de consumo diario en su casa, allí ella vende productos para comida, aguas gaseosas y jabón.  El préstamo lo solicita porque necesita invertir más en mercaderías para su negocio.   Su sueño es incrementar sus ventas, y tener un negocio más grande.

loans.use: Increase variety of products to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Vencedoras Group

texts.en:
“Mujeres Vencedoras”, or Victorious Women, is a group of five entrepreneurs seeking their second loan from Esperanza International.  The group’s past loan has been successfully repaid, and the group hopes to use the additional loan funds for further business expansion.  Crescencia is one of the coordinators for this group in Santiago. 

Crescencia, mother of three (ages: 28, 25, 11), operates two notably different entrepreneurial activities.  Crescencia cares for children in her house.  Currently every day she cares for six or seven children and provides meals for them while their parents are gone.  Crescencia has been operating this business for ten years and used her first loan with Esperanza to pay for additional food for the children.  With her second loan from Esperanza, Crescencia plans to finalize her new business of selling food orders to customers.  Customers call her home with their requested meals and Crescencia has the food delivered to her customers.  The second loan will be used to buy food products to create these meals.  

Other members of Crescencia’s bank run similar entrepreneurial activities including meat and furniture sales as well as a small grocery store and restaurant.   

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Buy food products to create meals for her customers.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Manuel Antonio R. tiene ya más de quince años dedicando se a la plomería y electricidad a domicilio esté negocio es la fuente de ingreso de su familia ya que tiene 4 hijos pequeños que actual mente están estudiando y quiere lo mejor para ellos. 
  Don Manuel está solicitando un préstamo para comprar herramienta más moderna y de mejor calidad para trabajar, porque la que tiene ya está en muy malas condiciones y tiene problemas para realizar los trabajos.
texts.en:
Señor Manuel Antonio R. already has more than fifteen years dedicated to household plumbing and electricity. This business is the source of his family income. He has four little children who are currently studying; Manuel wants the best for them.

Don Manuel is requesting a loan to buy more modern tools that do higher quality work, because the tools that he already has are in bad shape and have trouble doing the job.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more modern tools

loans.name: Uy's Group
loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her work transportation and her family

loans.name: Tuk's Group
loans.use: To renovate her house and build another kitchen room.

loans.name: Saing

texts.en:
Saing K., a 26-year-old farmer in Pursat Province, is married to Neoun, 22, who earns a living raising piglets behind the house. A responsible father and neighbor, Saing harvests his crop twice a year and sells to customers in bulk at a good price.

He would like to end his reliance on his neighbor's oxen to plow his field, and so is requesting a loan of $250 to buy oxen and to renovate his house. The loan will help the family achieve a better living standard.

loans.use: To buy oxen and to renovate his house.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Y. is 28 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She has two children: both of them are still young and under her care. She is married to Mean, 30, who is a farmer. Y. has grown vegetables since 1998. She sells eight times a year to her customers in the market in bulk at a good price. She is a struggling mother and a responsible neighbor and she earns a better income.

Recently, Y. wants to increase her income by hiring her neighbor's plot of land for her planting. So Y. is looking for a loan to buy more vegetable seeds and to hire the land. She dreams of having a degree for her children.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable seeds and to hire land

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
S. is 29 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She has one child who is still young. She is a widowed mother and has been working as a local farmer on land behind her house since 1996. She is a struggling mother and a responsible neighbor. She harvests twice a year on her own farming land inherited from her parents; she has earned a good income from her field.

Recently she wants to increase her income for her family's needs. So S. is looking for a loan of US$ 250 to buy a small plot of farmland next to her house. She dreams of having a degree for her child.

loans.use: To buy a small plot of farmland

loans.name: Hieng

texts.en:
Mrs. Hieng T. is a farmer who lives in Chi Chrab village in Takeo province. She is a 55-year-old widow with four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the remaining two are attending the local school.

Although they try hard, they still earn not enough income to support the family. In order to support the family, Mrs. Hieng T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to raise, and she hopes to support the family well after she sells her cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow to raise

loans.name: Try

texts.en:
H. is 49 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She has seven children: the first two are married and live separately, the second two work with her husband, and the last three are students. H. is married to Din, 50, who works at gathering stones to sell; he gathers them from the mountain far from the village.

H. is a local farmer on a big plot of farmland inherited from her parents which she has always harvested for customers twice a year since 2000. To help the family's income, H. also raises piglets in the pigpen behind her house.

H. is tired of hiring her neighbor's buffalo to plow her farmland. So she is looking for a loan to buy a pair of buffaloes for her plowing. She dreams of having a degree for her children.

loans.use: To buy a pair of buffaloes for her plowing

loans.name: Nhok

texts.en:
M. is 26 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She has two children: both of them are attending school. She is married to Phat, 33, who works as a fence pole provider through the commune. M. has been a pig-raiser since 2002 and she earns a good income, for she always sells to the slaughterer four times a year.

To help meet the family's income, she also farms rice on a big field which she inherited from her parents. Recently, as the family is growing up, M. faces a difficulty with transportation. So she is requesting a loan of US$ 400 to buy a motorbike for herself and her family. The loan will help the family gain a better standard of living. (M. was not at home to be photographed but her husband was.)

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for herself and her family

loans.name: Sing

texts.en: Sing L., 45, a married mother of five children, all students, lives in a medium-sized wooden house in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She currently breeds pigs next to her house twice a year, selling them for slaughter three months after she begins raising them. Her husband, Korn, 45, earns a living making and selling charcoal; the family also grows rice for sale, and the children help their parent's businesses when they are not studying.  Sing and her husband are now requesting a loan to buy a buffalo for transporting charcoal and rice.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for transporting rice and charcoal to market.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
L. is 29 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She has two children: both of them are attending school. She is married to Vy, 27, who works as a fence pole provider. L. is a local vegetable planter on a plot of land behind her house, inherited from her parents, which she always harvest eight times a year. In that way, she can earn a better profit for supporting her family.

As the family is growing up, L. recently faces a difficulty with transportation. Hence, L. is applying for a loan of US$ 250 to buy a motorbike for herself and her family. The loan will help the family gain a better standard of living. (L. was not available to be photographed, but her husband was.)

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for herself and her family

loans.name: Naheebullah

texts.en:
Naheebullah D. is 20 years old; he is single and he lives in Jalalabad Nangrahar province. He is the one responsible for his whole house, and also he is studying in the ninth class in the public school in Jalalabad city. In his spare time he sells yogurt in the bazaar, and now he wants to enlarge his animal farm.

Now he wants to take out an individual loan of 30,000 Afghanis for a term of 22 months to start his business and get them ready to sell them in the bazaar to make a good profit, repay the loan, and support his family to provide a better future. 

He is happy with all members of his family and he would like to thank Kiva and AFSG for a successful loan process in Jalalabad, Afghanistan. He wants to say a special thank you to lenders who are supporters of this process and wants to continue his partnership in the future.

loans.use: Buying animals for his land

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
Хучаёрова Мавлюда женщина 51 года мать пятерых детей. Сама работает в колхозе ,на поле. Мавлюда вместе с мужем занимается откормом и продажей скота. Муж пастух в колхозе. Из пятерых детей у неё трое детей семейные, живут отдельно от родителей.
Для увеличения бизнеса скота Мавлюда решила получить кредит
texts.en:
Mavluda H. is a 51-year-old mother of five. She works in the field for a collective farm. Together with her husband, Mavluda raises and sells cattle. Her husband works as a shepherd for a collective farm. Out of their five children, three are married and live separately from their parents. To increase cash flow, Mavluda decided to apply for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to raise and sell cattle

loans.name: Komil

texts.ru: Омонов Комилчон 53 лет, женат имеет четверых детей. Работает бригадиром в колхозе Самгара. Жена не работает помогает мужу по уходу за скотом. У Комилчона три коровы которые в день дают по 8 литров молока каждая. Жена  Комилчона доит и продаёт молоко в кондитерские цеха Самгара. Для увеличения численности скота Комилчон решил обратится в Микроинвест за кредитом
texts.en:
Komil O. is 53 years old and is married with four children. He is a brigade leader at Samgar's collective farm. His wife does not work - she helps her husband tend to cattle. Komil owns three cows, and each gives 8 litres of milk. Komil's wife milks the cows and sells the milk to the confectionaries of Samgar. For increasing the number of cattle, Komil decided to turn to Microinvest for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle

loans.name: Murat

texts.ru: Куйлибаев Мурат мужчина 42 лет , женат имеет  четверых детей. Работает в колхозе трактористом, жена доярка на ферме Самгара. Мурат хочет получив кредит отремонтировать сарай и купить побольше корма для своих баранов. Сейчас у него около 20 баранов.В день мониторинга не удалось снять Мурата на фоне скота, ведь скот у них пасется на пастбищах. Мурат на фото в день выдачи
texts.en:
Murat K. is a 42 year old father of four. He is a tractor driver and his wife milks cows at Samgar's collective farn. Murat would like to get a loan for fixing a barn and buying more fodder for his sheep. Now he owns around twenty sheep. On the day of monitoring we did not capture Murat with his cattle because the cattle grazes on the pastures. The picture shows Murat on the day of loan disbursement.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle raising and sales

loans.name: Turan

texts.ru:
Абдурахимов Туран пожелой мужчина в возрасте 67 лет отец пятерых детей. Закончив первый займ, Туран увеличил свой скот. И в сезон дешёвого скота опять решил получить кредит для закупа скота. За скотом у него дома ухаживают его сыновья, они не дают утомляться отцу. Туран только присматривает и советует как лучше кормить и пасти скот.
Ему на этот раз понадобилось 2000 сомони, для закупа скота и корма.
texts.en:
Turan A. is a 67 year old elderly man and a father of five. The first loan allowed Turan to increase the number of cattle. Now, when cattle prices are again low, he decided to apply for another loan that would allow him to purchase more cattle. His sons tend to cattle and do not let their father get tired. Turan only supervises the process and gives advice on how to improve livestock raising. This time he would need 2000 somoni to buy cattle and fodder.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle raising and sales

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru:
Ахмадов Абдусалом мужчина 53 лет имеет одного сына , жжена пенсионерка. Абдусалом 
Полностью занимается уходом ,откормом и продажей скота. Он ветеринар и мастер по купле и продаже скота. Абдусалом каждую неделю выходит на рынок скота, и помогает своим друзьям купить породистый скот. Сейчас у  Абдусалома  30 баранов ,которые пасутся на пастбище вблизи гор. Соседи посоветовали попробовать закупить в кредит ещё десяток голов баранов, для чего и обратился Абдусалом  в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Abdusalom A. is 53 year old and is married with one son. His wife is retired. Abdusalom makes a living by tending to cattle, raising and selling it. He is a vet and a master of cattle trade. Every week he goes to the market to help his friends buy cattle of good breed. As of now Abdusalom owns 30 sheep which graze on mountain pastures. Abdusalom's neighbors advised him to get a loan and buy another ten sheep. For this reason Abdusalom came to Microinvest.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Holikberdi

texts.ru: Холикберди 36 летний мужчина , отец троих детей, жена домохозяйка. Сам  Холикберди работает шофёром грузового такси. Он на заказ возит груз на дома. У него дополнительный доход с откорма и продажи скота. В его отсутствии ему помогает его жена , она кормит и поит скот. У него сейчас 13 коз и 7 баранов. Для увеличения скота он решил взять кредит.
texts.en:
Holikberdi M. is a 36 year old father of three. His wife is a homemaker. Holikberdi works as a moving van driver. He makes extra cash by raising and selling cattle. When Holikberdi is away, his wife tends to cattle. Now Holikberdi owns 13 goats and 7 sheep. In order to purchase more, he decided to apply for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to raise and sell cattle

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru: Анвар мужчина 32 лет ,женат имеет пятеро детей. Жена дома занимается  с детьми дома домашними делами. Сам Анвар  пастух в колхозе Урунходжаева. Вместе с семьёй он откармливает несколько голов баранов. Для закупа ещё баранов он обратился в Микроивест. Колхоз ему заработную плату не платит, а выдаёт вместо денег продукты питания. Для увеличения оборотного капитала и повышения уровня жизни семьи Анвар хочет в кредит закупить скот.
texts.en:
Anvar is a man of 32 years of age, he is married and has five children. His wife stays at home with the children and does housework. Anvar works as a shepherd at the collective farm of Urunhodjaev. Together with the family he raises several heads of sheep. To buy more sheep he has come to MicroInvest. At the farm he does not receive a salary, but is paid by food and produce instead of money. To increase his working capital and improve the quality of life of his family Anvar wants to buy cattle in credit.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising of cattle and sales

loans.name: Fazul Ahamd

texts.en: Fazul Ahamd is the son of A. R.. He lives in district 3 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has got a general store and all the family members benefit from his income. He wants to expand his business and to attract more customers, so he has requested an individual loan of 30,000 Afghani for a term of 12 months. He is happy that he has got the chance to progress as soon as possible.

loans.use: buying inventory for his general store

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.ru: Одилов Абдумалик  мужчина в возрасте 30 лет , женат имеет троих  детей. Абдумалик работает  в колхозе поливщиком полей. Также он занимается дехканством . Для увеличения своего бизнеса животноводства он хочет купить в кредит несколько голов баранов. Его жена  занимается производством бараньей пряди из которой сама вяжет носки, и  оптом сдаёт перекупщикам. Абдумалик на фото в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Abdumalik O. is a man of 30 years of age, married and has three children. Abdumalik works in a collective farm as a field aerator. He also does animal husbandry. To increase his business he wants to buy several heads of sheep on credit. His wife spins yarn from sheep's wool and then makes socks which she sells in wholesale to retailers. Abdumalik is pictured on the photo on the day of getting the loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising of cattle and sales

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Гадоева  Саодат закончила свой очередной займ , и подала заявку на очередной кредит. Она хочет использовать его на закуп весеннего ассортимента тканей. Её точка продажи расположена в центре рынка тканей. Её товар пользуется хорошим спросом. За товаром Саодат ездит в Бишкек сама два раза в месяц.
.
texts.en:
Saodat G. has paid off her last loan and applied for another one. She wants to use it to buy an assortment of fabrics for the spring. Her vendor space is located in the center of the fabrics market. Her merchandise is in high demand. Saodat travels to Bishkek by herself to buy merchandise twice a month.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: May

texts.en:
Mr. O. is 39 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. He is single and lives with his mother who raises piglets in the pigpen behind their house. O. has been a local farmer since 1990 and he is a responsible son and neighbor. He has earned a suitable income, for he always harvests three times a year; he also helps out with his mother's pig-raising.

O. is recently facing a difficulty with transportation. So he decided to take a loan of US$ 250 to buy a motorbike for his business and his family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his business and his family

loans.name: Ahmad Shabaz

texts.en: Ahmad Shabaz is the son of M. S.. He is 45 years old and lives in district 2, Kabul, Afghanistan. He has six children and he works in a shoe selling shop. He is requesting an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani for a term of 12 months and would like to expand his business. He is confident that after the loan he can increase his business.

loans.use: For expanding his business

loans.name: Masuda

texts.en:
Masuda K. is an enterprising woman with a big desire to improve the quality of life for her family. She is married and the mother of three children. Masuda has been a seamstress since she was very young, learning in her mother's office. With a lot of effort, she has been able to open her own shop in her home. Her shop has been successful because her customers recognize the high quality of her products. She constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow. Today Masuda is applying for a loan through IMON International for the first time. She is requesting a loan of $1200 USD with a term of 12 months so she can purchase materials to sew pillowcases and bed-clothes. You can help improve the quality of life for Masuda’s family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, its culture is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.
However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and its manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing necessary materials for sewing pillowcase and bed-clothes

loans.name: Yokubjon

texts.en:
Yokubjon started his business because he needed to support his wife somehow, and what better way to do so than selling national clothing and footwear for women? He works in the famous Somon market, which allows him to work seven days a week. He started selling in marketplaces seven years ago, and since then he has not quit the business because it generates good profits. He cannot slow down his sales because of the serious economic crisis and because the expenses never stop accumulating. Yokubjon currently offers apparel at good prices so that his customers can keep buying from him even though the competition is stiff. He is requesting a loan of $1100 USD, which will be repaid in 12 months. He will use this loan to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: Increase working capital for business development

loans.name: Yusufjon

texts.en:
Yusufjon K. just turned 37 not so recently. He and his wife have raised two children. For six years Yusufjon has been involved in manufacturing wooden doors and window frames. Yusufjon’s eldest son helps him with the business. Yusufjon is respected and known in the neighborhood as a real master and this reputation has allowed him to earn a clientele. The business is stable and is generating the main income for the family. Today Yusufjon needs to purchase input materials such as lumber for his business. He is also planning to improve the working conditions of the business. In order to accomplish these tasks he requests a loan of $1100 USD with a term of 12 months. Considering that this is the first loan for Yusufjon he thanks all lenders for supporting and trusting him.

loans.use: Purchasing wood and supplies for making furniture

loans.name: Zareena M.rafiq Group

texts.en:
Zareena baji has been a citizen of a city named Vehari, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Zareena baji is married to a man whose name is M. R., and he is a mason. Zareena baji is a housewife but she is involved in a clothes-sewing business also. She knows that her husband’s income is insufficient, and she does this work to share the financial burden of her husband and to meet the family's expenses. Zareena baji is applying for a loan to buy mason's tools for her husband’s business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Nagina baji wants a loan to buy meat to sell. Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business. Shafiqan baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy mason's tools

loans.name: Siek

texts.en:
S. is 46 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She is a widow, and she has seven children: the first three are working in a private company, and the other four are students. S. is a local vegetable seller to the villagers in the market. She gets up in the morning to buy vegetables from the field in bulk and hurries, taking them to the market to sell retail at a good price. She is a struggling mother and a responsible neighbor. 

S. recently faces difficulty with transportation. So S. is looking for a loan to buy a motorbike for herself and her family. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living. S. was not available during the photograph so her son is taken instead.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for herself and her family

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en:
Dilshod M. is a dynamic, serious, and entrepreneurial man from the Spitamen district of Tajikistan. He is married with four children. He has been breeding livestock for 5 years. With this goal in mind, Dilshod is requesting a loan that will serve him as business capital. Dilshod is requesting a loan to expand his herd and repair an enclosure to help meet the needs of his village and the surrounding community, some of whom travel over 20 km to buy his animals. The profit he earns will enable him to improve living conditions for his household and make some investments.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. loans.use: Purchasing small cattle for developing business

loans.name: Shahnaz Kosar M.arshad Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz Kosar baji has resided in a city named Vehari, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Zareena baji is married to a man whose name is M. A. and he has a business selling motor oil. He buys oil from factories and sells to customers who require it.

Shahnaz baji is the mother of two kids: one son and one daughter. Both of her kids are getting an education from a school located near their house. She prepares embroidered clothes to pay the school fees of her kids. She is applying for a loan to buy more motor oil to sell.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Naseem begum baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Razia baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Farhat baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for transport.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy motor oil to sell

loans.name: Ravshanjon

texts.en:
Ravshanjon S. is 34 years old. He is married and has 2 children to support and provide an education for. 

Ravshanjon has been providing tractor services at the local farm since 1999. To earn additional income, he breeds calves, cows, and sheep and sells them at the local market. He has been able to improve his financial situation by wisely using prior loans he received from IMON International to breed his animals. Now his biggest dream is to expand his business by offering dairy products to the community. He would also like to purchase spare parts to repair his tractor.  Ravshanjon is requesting a loan of $1100 USD and is hopeful for your generosity.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, and Central Asian traditions.
