loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for repairing tractor, purchasing cattle

loans.name: Sabra Sagheer Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Sabra baji is the wife of S. A. and has resided in a city named Vehari, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Sabra baji’s husband has had a dairy business for the past 10 years. He has a buffalo at his house and Sabra baji helps him in getting milk from the buffalo.

Sabra baji is a very supportive and caring lady. She shares the financial burden of her husband by preparing embroidered clothes. She takes orders from her relatives and neighbors and charges US$ 3 per embroidered dress. She is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for her husband’s dairy business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Raheela baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Nazri baji wants a loan to buy meat to sell. Mussarat baji wants a loan to buy an ox cart for transport. Aflan baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (tea, sugar, and milk) for her tea stall. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for their dairy business

loans.name: Mahsad

texts.ru: Махсад  женщина которая кредитуется в Микроинвест уже пятый год. Она пунктуальная  и ответственная женщина. Следующий кредит Махсад хочет использовать для пополнения своего товара весенним ассортиментом тканей. За товаром ездит её сын  в Бишкек.
texts.en:
Mahsad is a woman who is taking out loans at MicroInvest for the fifth year. She is a punctual and responsible woman. Her next loan Mahsad wants to use to add a spring selection of fabrics to her inventory. Her son travels to Bishkek for the merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki has had her own small charcoal and firewood store in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 1 year. She belongs to Tudumishe Umoja group (Group code 2054). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 90. Every day she works at her business. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Riziki is 24 years old, married, and has one child, age 2.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: Ujamaa Group

texts.en:
Amina has her own small shop in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. Every day she works at her business. She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more rice, oil, and other commodities for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Amina is married, and has four children: ages 24, 15, 12 and 9. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Salama and Mwanahamis. Each woman has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more rice, oil and other commodities for her shop

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina sells cooked food and drinks. She hopes for the loan amount of N 120,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. She is 42 years old and married with 2 children. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Mkasi

texts.en:
Mkasi is a soap seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to Kutoa Ni Moyo group (Group code 2045). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$50. Every day she works at her business. She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more soap for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mkasi is 30 years old, married, and has two children: ages 5 and 1.

loans.use: To buy more soap for her business

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 45 years old, widowed, and has two children: ages 22 and 18. She has her own small firewood store in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to Tuwe Na Moyo group (Group code 2012). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 60.

Every day she works at her business from 6:30 a.m. to 10:30 p.m. She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more firewood for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for her business

loans.name: Victorious

texts.en: Victorious sells clothes, shoes, and underwear. She needs the loan amount of N 150,000 to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell. She is 40 years old and married with a child. Her husband is a pastor. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Nwaka

texts.en: Nwaka O. is a hair stylist who also sells salon materials like hair cream. She needs the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell. She is 25 years old and single. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Muamini

texts.en:
Muamini K. J. has sold clothes in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. Muamini is married with three children, ages 10, 16 and 18. Muamini belongs to the Asaa Khery group loan (group code 2014). Muamini works at her business every day from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. and earns an average monthly profit of $50 dollars.

Muamini is requesting a second loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more clothes (khanga and bed sheets) for her business. Muamini is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (khanga and bed sheets) for her business

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema A. sells clothes in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. Rehema is 23 years old and is married with one child, aged 2 years. Rehema belongs to the Ujamaa group loan (group code 2016). Rehema works every day at her business and earns an average monthly profit of $60 dollars.

Rehema is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more clothes for her business. Rehema is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Marian

texts.en: Marian sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She hopes to get a loan for the amount of N80,000 to purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She is 39 years old and married with 5 children. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary sells second hand shoes and clothes. She also rents out VCD'S to her customers. She would like to make a loan for N150, 000 to purchase more second hand shoes and clothes to sell. She hopes to expand this business. She is 28 years old and married with 2 children. She says thanks to kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy, the 55-year-old married mother of six children, sells provisions and cosmetics. Customer demand for her goods is high, and in order to continue to meet that demand she is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and cosmetics. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Hasina

texts.en:
Hasina M. S. has sold food in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for six years. Hasina is 35 years old and is married with three children, ages 12, 15 and 18. Hasina belongs to the Wapendanao group loan (group code 2008). Hasina works at her business from 7:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. and earns an average monthly profit of $125 dollars.

Hasina is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy rice, wheat flour, beans, fish, chicken, and cooking oil for her business. Hasina is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy rice, wheat flour, beans, fish, chicken, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria sells provisions, drinks and food items. She is hoping to borrow N80, 000 to purchase more provisions, drinks and food items to sell. She is 34 years old and married with 3 children. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks and to sell

loans.name: Henrietta

texts.en: Henrietta is 29 years old and single. She lives in Asaba, Delta state, Nigeria. She sells clothes and shoes. She is hoping to make a loan for N80, 000 to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell. She says thanks to kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Mkorofi Si Mwenzetu Group

texts.en:
Chausiku J. M. has owned a small charcoal and firewood store in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for seven years. Chausiku is 45 years old and is married with five children, aged between 4 and 15. Chausiku belongs to the Maisha Bora group loan (group code 2101). Chausiku works every day at her business from 6:30 a.m. to 10:30 p.m. and earns an average monthly profit of $80 dollars.

Chausiku is requesting a second loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more bread for her business. Chausiku is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, improve her home, and pay school fees for her children. Chausiku will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Kiduchu, who also has a small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to expand her business.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela A. D. has owned a small charcoal and firewood store in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. Angela is married and has three children, ages 2, 6, and 19. Angela belongs to the Wapendanao group loan (group code 2008). Angela works every day at her business and earns an average monthly profit of $50 dollars.

Angela is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy charcoal, firewood, and salon items for her business. Angela is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en:
She works hard, and faithfully helps her husband with earning the family income. Mrs. Jenefer C. is 31years old and resides at Cawa-Cawa, Dapitan City. The couple is blessed with two children and are very conscious of the children's future. They borrowed money to different lending institutions and started their business; motorcycle parts supply. 

On March 18, 2008, Jenefer turned to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and became a member. She likes the insurance and other benefits that she enjoys with the Cooperative. She has borrowed twice already and recently applied for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of motorcycle parts. She wishes to continue and operate her business successfully and she expects to pay her loans with no default.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for motorcycle parts

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.ru:
Икром 35 летний мужчина , бригадир в колхозе. Имеет земельный участок, с которого  имеет доход с посева урожая. Кроме этого он занимается  откормом и продажей скота.
Жена учительница в средней школе.  Икром решил в кредит увеличить оборотный капитал бизнеса животноводства. Для  чего и обратился в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Ikrom is a 35 year old man, a team leader in a collective farm. He has a plot of land which brings him profit from the harvest. Besides this he also raises and sells cattle. His wife is a teacher in a secondary school. Ikrom decided to use the loan to increase his working capital of his animal husbandry business. This is why he has come to MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and sales of cattle

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.en:
Gulmira S. is 33 years old and is married with two children. She has been selling Oriental style jewelry at the local market for the past 11 years. The national earrings, rings and bracelets she sells are very beautiful and popular in Tajikistan. All Tajik women have at least one set of jewelry, often inherited from their grandmothers.

Gulmira’s jewelry business is successful and generates a stable income for her family. She started out with $300 USD and now has $3000 USD in working capital. She requests a loan of $1200 USD to purchase new jewelry and increase the range of items she sells. Gulmira has demonstrated herself as a reliable IMON borrower over the past two years. She thanks all for the support and promises to repay the loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

loans.use: Purchasing of new items of jewelry for increasing the range of goods

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.ru: Кодиров Хусейн мужчина 29 лет , женат имеет двоих детей. Работает строителем в бригаде. Его доход на хватает для прожиточного минимума , поэтому он дополнительно занимается бизнесом животноводства .Для увеличения оборотного капитала  своего бизнеса он решил получить кредит.
texts.en:
Huseyn K. is 29 years old, married, and has two children. He works on a construction team. His income does not cover a minimal standard of living, so he also has a livestock business. He would like to use a loan to increase his working capital.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and sales of livestock

loans.name: Abduvali

texts.en:
U. Abduvali is 28 years old. He is married and the father of three children. In addition, Abduvali lives with and cares for his parents. He is a high school graduate and started cattle raising in 1998. His wife (pictured) helps him with caring for the cows. Abduvali wants to increase the family income in order to be able to meet his children’s expenses and the health care cost of his parents. He wants to purchase an additional two dairy cows and he is requesting a loan of US $ 1100 for the term of 12 months. Abduvali is a hard working young man and will be able to repay the loan without any violations.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase of two additional dairy cows

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Mrs. J. is a bonafide resident of Barangay Sinian, Baliangao.  She is married to Mr. Ralp J. and they were blessed with two children. According to her, her rice production project is still in the growing phase.
  
She requests a PHP 7,000 loan amount to defray operating expenses for her rice growing land.  She needs to meet farm expenses such as fertilizers, medicines and labor expenses, especially for the harvesting of the rice.

Aside from her rice production project, she is also earning an income from her "sari-sari" (variety) store. She hopes and prays that her business would expand and earn enough savings for their retirement in the future.

She is thankful for the continued assistance and support of Paglaum, especially now that KIVA is helping MFI entrepreneurs.

loans.use: For the purchase of fertilizers and other farm expenses

loans.name: Ortik

texts.ru: Ортик мужчина 30 лет ,женат имеет четверых детей.Жена учительница в средней школе.Сам Ортик работает кассиром в налоговой инспекции Костакоза.Он с детства вместе с отцом занимался откормом скота , а продавал его отец.И по сей день он самостоятельно покупает и откармливает скот.После откорма он продаёт его на рынке скота.Для увеличения численности коров он хочет получить кредит.
texts.en:
Ortik is a thirty year old man who is married and has four children. His wife is a middle school teacher. Ortik himself is a cashier at the Kostakoza tax office. He has raised livestock since childhood with his father, who sold the animals, and now he buys and fattens livestock himself. After fattening, he sells the livestock at the market. He would like a loan in order to increase his number of cows.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding and sale

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en: Antoine is a 50-year-old married man with two children, living in A. Moualaka in the Bekaa valley. He has been a butcher for 30 years, a trade he learned from his father. Antoine wants to borrow $1,000 in order to buy a refrigerator to display his goods.

loans.use: Buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Karomat

texts.en: K. Karomat first applied to the Microinvest in 2009 and she came with the recommendations of reliable and well placed clients. Karomat applied to our program for a business development loan as she was engaged in commercial service and trade.  Thanks to her first loan Karomat started up a small stand in a local bazaar where she sells a local bread called “lepeshky”. She always has fresh bread so she has a lot of customers. “Lepeshky” bread is a traditional and required product in every Tajik home. Karomat dreams of starting a “lepeshky” bread baking workshop as she is skilled in lepeshky bread making.. Karomat is requestng a business support loan of 1200 STJ for 4 months. She thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: To start a bread baking workshop

loans.name: Sami

texts.en: Sami is a 21-year-old man living in Jalala in the Bekaa valley. He is an aluminum handyman and works in several workshops. Sami won a contract for a new project, renovating a small building, and is requesting a $500 loan in order for him to buy new tools and finish the project on time.

loans.use: Buy new tools

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 20-year-old man living in Ghazah in the Bekaa valley. Two years ago he invested all his savings in a blacksmith shop. Ali learned about his profession from his father, who used to teach him during his free time. He is requesting to borrow $1,000 so he can buy a stock of metA..

loans.use: Buy a stock of metal

loans.name: Murod

texts.ru: Мурод мужчина 29 лет , женат имеет двоих детей.Жена работает в аптеке фармацевтом.Сам Мурод продаёт зерновые культуры, на рынке Костакоза.Кроме этого он занимается откормом и продажей скота.Сейчас у него дома 7 баранов.Пока на рынках скот дешёвый Мурод хочет увеличить свой оборотный капитал при помощи кредита.
texts.en:
Murod is 29 years old, married, and has two children. His wife works as a pharmacist in a drugstore. Murod himself sells cereal crops at the Kostakoz market. In addition he feeds and sells livestock. He currently has 7 sheep on his property. While livestock at the markets is cheap Murod would like to increase his working capital with the help of a loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding and sale

loans.name: Bihosiyat

texts.en:
O. Bihosiyat has been our client since 2007 when she applied for a business development loan. Bihosiyat lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan but she comes every day to Khujand to trade in the crowded local bazaar “Panjshanbe”. She has been a fruit trader for 12 years. She works directly with a supplier so she can offer lower prices than the bazaar prices. She has repeat customers because she is an honest trader and customers respect her as a person. She finds time to communicate in the common language with customers.

Bihosiyat asks KIVA for a business support loan of 1200 TJS for 4 months to pay for the new fruit importing charge that permits her to increase the business turnover in summer time.

loans.use: To pay for the new fruit importing charge

loans.name: Swaswa C Group

texts.en:
Molleni C. has been a vegetable seller in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for five years. Molleni is married with six children, ages 17, 21, 30, 33, and 37. Molleni works 10 hours every day at her business and earns an average monthly profit of $40 dollars.

Molleni is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more vegetables for her business. Molleni is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to improve her home and pay school fees for her children. Molleni will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Veronica, Angela, and Janeth: all of whom have their own small businesses in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more vegetable for her business.

loans.name: Saer

texts.en: Saer A. A. is a 43-year-old married man with three children. He is a living in Kamed A. Lawz, Lebanon in the Bekaa valley. His first loan with Ameen was used to buy a refrigerator for his bakery. Today, Saer wants to borrow $1,200 to buy stock of flour and oil.

loans.use: Buy stock of flour and oil

loans.name: Mbathio's Group

texts.fr: Réunues au sein d'une association dénommée associationdes relais de Djilakh, ces femmes habitant un village pres de la ville de Mbour s' activent dans le secteur de l'agriculture notament dans dans l'élevage de betail depuis plus de trois ans.l'association achette une vache ou un boeuf pour chacune d'elle .Cet animal est élevé pendant au moins 4 mois avant d être vendu.les recettes titrées de la vente de cet animal vont permettre à la femme de parciper aux charges du foyer.Avec le pret q'elles sollicitent elles veulent renforcer leurs activités et accroitre ainsi leur revenu.
texts.en:
Gathered together in the heart of the association called “Association des relais de Djilakh”, these women living in village near the city of Mbour. They have been active in the agricultural field, notably in raising livestock, for three years. The Association buys a cow or a steer for each of the women. The animal is raised for at least four months and then sold. The receipts derived from the sale of the animal will enable the group member to help meet household expenses. With the loan the women are requesting, they want to bolster their businesses and thus increase their income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elie

texts.en: Elie A. S. is a 34-year-old married man living in A. Maalaka, Lebanon in the Bekaa valley. He works as a sanitation repair man and usually works in private homes and at new construction sites. Elie is requesting a loan of $800 to replace his old tools.

loans.use: Buy new tools

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en: Mavis G. is 28 years old. She is single and self-dependant. Mavis lives alone in a rented apartment at a Bawalashie community near Accra. Most of the inhabitants of Bawalashie are either farmers or trade in farm products. Very few people run other types of businesses. Mavis is a trader and trades in food items. She sells food items such as, cassava, maize, etc. in the local market of Bawalashie where she lives. After selling for the past six years, she has lots of selling experience to win customers. Mavis is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to expand her stock. She wants to use the loan to increase her stock of cassava, plantain, maize, etc. to serve her customers. She is a member of the community group called ‘To God Be the Glory’ Trust Group. Group members assist one another to provide support in handling repayment. She would be grateful for any assistance.

loans.use: To procure food items

loans.name: Medelii A Group

texts.en:
Janeth C. has been a cement seller in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for one year. Janeth is married with five children, aged between 5 and 18. Janeth works eight hours every day at her business and earns an average monthly profit of $350 dollars.

Janeth is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more cement for her business. Janeth is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and improve her home. Janeth will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Jane and Sarah: each of whom has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more cement to sell and expand her business.

loans.name: Medelii A Group

texts.en:
Janeth K. has owned a small food vendor store in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for two years. Janeth is married with two children, ages 13 and 15. Janeth works every day at her business for six hours and earns an average monthly profit of $250 dollars.

Janeth is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more food items for her business. Janeth is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and improve her home. Janeth will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Anna, Edda, and Sophia: all of whom have their own small businesses in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход мужчина 31 года , женат имеет четверых детей.Жена торгует на базаре Костакоза фруктами.Сам Фарход жарит и продаёт на рынке мясным шашлыком.Кроме этого он занимается откормом и продажей скота.У него сейчас 9 баранов.Для закупа корма и скота он решил получить кредит.Ему по уходу за скотом помогает его жена.
texts.en:
Farhod is 31 years old, married, and has four children. His wife sells fruit at the Kostakoz market. Farhod himself grills and sells meat shish-kebab at the market. In addition, he feeds and sells livestock. He currently has nine sheep. He decided to request a loan to use for purchasing feed. His wife helps care for the animals.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding and sale

loans.name: Medelii A Group

texts.en:
Gladys Z. has been a vegetable seller in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for one year. Gladys is married with four children, aged 2 to 17. Gladys also cares for two additional dependents. Gladys works every day at her business for 12 hours and earns an average monthly profit of $225 dollars.

Gladys is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more vegetables for her business. Gladys is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and pay school fees for her children.  Gladys will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Mariam:  Who has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to expand her business.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход 27 летний мужчина , женатый , отец двоих детей. Жена работает телефонисткой.Сам Фарход продаёт на рынке лотереи лото спорта.Кроме этого у него есть свой оборотный капитал в бизнесе животноводства.Он покупает худой скот подешевле и откормив его продаёт через 4-5 месяцев.Фарход хочет в кредит отремонтировать хлев, где он держит скот.Для чего он и обратился в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Farhod is 27 years old, married, and the father of two children. His wife works as a telephone operator. Farhod himself sells tickets for lottery games. In addition he has his own working capital in the livestock business. He buys underweight livestock cheaply and after fattening them for 4-5 months, sells. Farhod would like a loan in order to repair the shed where the livestock are kept. For that reason he came to Microinvest.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feed and sale

loans.name: Diarga's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe  réunu de jeunes filles et garçons agés entre 20 et 30ans .ils habitent la ville de mbour.chaque semaine les membre du groupe de réunu pour discuter entre eux des questions de jeunesse mais aussi pour  mettre en place des projets.Actuellement ils ont unprojet d 'acheter du materiel de sonnorisation qu'ils vont loyer c'est pourquoi il sollicite un pret
texts.en:
This is a united group of young girls and boys, ages 20 to 30. They live in the city of Mbour. Each week, the group members gather to discuss among themselves youth-related questions but also to put projects into place. Currently, they have a project to buy sound equipment that they are going to rent out. This is why they are requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Makole E Group

texts.en:
Mariam H. has been a soft drink seller in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for seven years. Mariam is 34 years old and is married with four children, aged between 8 and 19. Mariam also cares for one additional dependent. Mariam works every day at her business for 12 hours and earns an average monthly profit of $175 dollars.

Mariam is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more drinks and materials for her business. Mariam is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and pay school fees for her children. Mariam will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Lucy, Grace, and Creni: each of whom has their own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy drinks and materials for her business.

loans.name: Yolen

texts.en:
Yolen A. is 44 years old and raises ducks. The family is in this business because her husband has the experience to run this kind of business. His friend has shared the secrets of how to handle this kind of business.

She is married to a barangay official and blessed with two children. The children are both in college and still need support from them. Her loan of P10, 000.00 will be used to purchase 60 ducks and 2 pigs that will help to support her children’s studies. The duck eggs will help to augment the family’s daily expenses.

Her dreams are to expand her duck raising business and to have a poultry supply. She also dreams that her children will finish their studies to have a better and a good life in the future.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for her poultry business

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina has been trading in the local market of Bawalashie community, a suburb of Accra in Ghana, for the past 5 years. She is a forty year old woman, married with four kids who are all in school. She lives with her family at the same community in a rented apartment.  She is a busy petty trader who sells cassava, charcoal, tin tomatoes, yams, maize, etc. on top of a table in the local market. Augustina loves trading, which earns bread for her family. She does not have sufficient working capital to run the business. With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To buy food items such as cassava, charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru: Гавхар женщина 36 лет , замужем имеет одного ребёнка.Она работает в городской физ лечебнице,медсестрой.Муж работает водителем троллейбуса.Гавхар вместе с мужем занимается откормом и продажей крупно рогатого скота.У неё сейчас оборотный капитал состоит из трёх коров.Взяв кредит она вместе с мужем хочет купить ещё пару коров.
texts.en:
Gavhar is a 36 year old woman, she is married with one child. She works in the city's medical center as a nurse. Her husband works a trolly bus driver. Gavhar and her husband also raise and sell cattle. She has a working capital which consists of three cows. By taking out a loan she and her husband want to buy two more cows.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and sales of cattle

loans.name: Radjab

texts.ru: Раджаб мужчина в возрасте 58 лет ,женат имеет троих детей. Жена работает техничкой в городской поликлинике.Сам Раджаб работает лаборантом в  санпидемстанции  г.Гафурова. Его работа заключается в снятии анализов с продуктов питания продаваемых на рынках.Его зарплата очень низкая и не хватает на жизнь.Поэтому он имеет дополнительный доход на проживание с бизнеса животноводства.для покупки ещё несколько голов скота он хочет получить кредит.
texts.en:
Radjab is a 58 year old man, he is married with three children. His wife works as a technician in a city hospital. Radjab himself works as a laboratory assistant in a sanitation and epidemic control center in the town of Gafurov. His job consists of testing produce and food sold on the markets. His salary is very low and is not enough for their livelihood. This is why he has an additional income from his animal husbandry business. He wants to take out a loan to buy several more heads of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and sales of cattle

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon operates a grocery store in his neighborhood. He started his operation eight years ago. He is a 38-year-old father of two childten who are currently in school. He trades in products like rice, canned foods, drinks, cooking oil, assorted biscuits, candies, evaporated milk, and so forth. With the loan, he wants to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods, drinks, and cooking oil to increase his stock of goods. With increased stock of different varieties, he hopes to make more income to provide for the educational needs of his children. He would appreciate your assistance very much. He wants to send his children to the university. He is a member of the community group called To God Be the Glory Trust Group. In this group, members assist one another to provide support in handling repayment. He is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To procure groceries

loans.name: Rohat

texts.ru: Рохат Рахматова  1956 года рождения замужем, имеет 4 детей. С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2002 года. Раньше брала кредит с группой. Теперь расширила свою аптеку и ассортимент медикаментов. Ей нравиться работать  фармацевтом, так как она помогает людям, консультирует прием лекарств. В прошлом году из-за суровой зимы , было много клиентов, она продала лекарства на большую сумму. В этом году ее продажа   стабильная.
texts.en:
Rohat R. was born in 1956, she is married with four children. She has been with MicroInvest since 2002. She used to take out group loans. Now she has expanded her pharmacy and the variety of medicine. She likes working as a pharmacist because she helps people and consults them on how to take the medicine. Last year because of a harsh winter she had many customers and she sold medicine in large amounts. This year her sales are stable.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Lochinoy

texts.en:
D. Lochinoy has four children. She is a very honorable and resolute woman. Ever since she was a young girl she has learned the honest work of raising cattle, a knowledge she has passed down to her own children who have also managed to improve their quality of life. Lochinoy and her husband started their livestock business with only one cow. After a number of sacrifices, they were able to increase little by little the quantity of calves. At the moment, with the support of their children, they have started to produce milk. They sell these on the weekends in their village. Lochinoy wants to expand her business and to purchase more cattle. With the desire of improving their living, Lochinoy is counting to your generous heart. 
  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, Tajikistan is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Vohid

texts.ru: Вохид Мужчина в возрасте 56 лет , отец троих детей.Он вместе с сыном занимается бизнесом продажи живой рыбы.Он торгует на рынке г.Гафурова. У него свои постоянные клиенты которые перепродают товар.Сам Вохид имеет поставщиков рыбы , которые сами привозят ему.Вохид в основном продаёт рыбы породы сазан.Для увеличения оборотного капитала Вохид решил взять кредит.
texts.en:
Vohid is a 56 year old man, a father of three children. He and his son are in the business of selling live fish. He works on the market of the Gafurov town. He has many regular customers who then resell his fish. Vohid has suppliers of fish who bring it to him. Vohid mostly sells carp of similar type of fish. To increase his working capital Vohid decided to take out a loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Umarjon

texts.en:
I. Umarjon is a successful young father and a dedicated husband. He has a two-year-old child. Umarjon began a small grocery store two years ago with a small amount of savings. He is assisted by his wife who helps him serve his clients. Today his clientele has grown greater and his grocery become more popular. He is asking for a loan of $1000 USD so that he can expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store. Umarjon is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve successes in his business with this loan.

loans.use: To increase the range of goods

loans.name: Dilbarjon

texts.en:
For the past seven years, Dilbarjon has sold women’s dressing gowns and underclothes at “Somon” market in Khujand. Dilbarjon is married and has three children. She is determined to provide a better living for her entire family. Dilbarjon is hard working and kind, giving her the ideal blend of entrepreneurial determination and service. Skilled in trade and abounding in character, Dilbarjon has both a strong business base and a perfect credit history with IMON International. Currently, she is seeking a loan of $800 USD to purchase a new vending facility and to expand her business. With the increased income, Dilbarjon plans to continue growing her business and improving the financial situation of her family.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Nasrullo

texts.en:
Nasrullo is a very hard working and responsible entrepreneur. He and his family live in Khujand, Tajikistan. He is married and has three children. Nasrullo works in the central city market selling women’s clothing. His business is characterized by stability and consistent growth. He has been working in the market for two years. Once a month he travels to the neighboring city Istaravshan to purchase new goods. Nasrullo likes to work for himself. His business is the main source of income for his whole family. Today Nasrullo would like to ask for a loan of $800 USD for the term of 12 months to purchase new clothing to sell. We believe Nasrullo’s drive for success will help this young entrepreneur succeed and thrive in business. You can be an important part of the growth of Nasrullo’s business.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, Tajikistan is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. 

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a thirty-five-year-old married woman with two children. For the past four years, Mary has been trading in maize and ‘gari’. Gari is produced from cassava and it is one of the carbohydrate supplements. It can either be eaten raw with sugar and roasted groundnuts or with cooked beans and oil.

Mary obtains her supplies from the farming communities and retails them to her customers, mostly food vendors and other retailers. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk quantities of maize and gari to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to pay her children’s educational fees. Mary is a member of a community group called "To God be the Glory" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To procure ‘gari’ for re-sale

loans.name: Uktam

texts.ru: Уктам мужчина 29 лет , женат имеет троих детей.Дети ещё очень маленькие,поэтому его жена никуда не устроилась работать.уктам работает проводником на железной станции.Жена домохозяйка, ухаживает за скотом во время отсутствия мужа.Уктам узнав о возможности получения кредита для покупки скота решил обратится в Микроинвест.На данный момент у него 20 баранов.
texts.en:
Uktam A. is 29 years old and is married with three children. His kids are very small, and his wife is still a stay-at-home mom. Uktam works as a train attendant, and his wife tends to cattle in his absence. Having learned about microcredit opportunities, Uktam turned to Microinvest for a loan. He has 20 sheep at the moment but he would like to purchase more cattle.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle raising and selling

loans.name: Saidniso

texts.ru:
Саиднисо Раджабова  1970 года рождения, замужем имеет одного сына. Муж уехал на заработки в Россию, живет с сыном. Для улучшения своей жизни и оплаты обучения сына, она  вынуждена выходит на рынок торговать. Она как и все осталась без работы в годы гражданской войны.
 Теперь Саиднисо торгует сухими фруктами : кайса(сушеный абрикос), фисташки, миндаль и другими орешками. Товар привозят поставщики( фермеры), она закупает у них оптом и продает по выгодной ей цене. С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2008 года.
texts.en:
Saidniso R. was born in 1970. She is married with one son. Her husband is a guest worker in Russia, and Saidniso lives with her son. In order to improve their living conditions and earn money to pay for her son's education, Saidniso sells food at the market. Like others, she lost her job during the civil war. Saidniso sells dried fruit: kaisa (dried apricot), pistachio, mandel and other nuts. She buys the product from farmers and sells it at a profit. She has been a Microinvest client since 2008.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying dried fruits

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.en:
Murodjon S. is married with two kids. Murodjon is a unique entrepreneur. He has been a market vendor for about 5 years. Over that time he has become very popular at the market and has many customers. The secret of his success is simple: he tries to not only let her customers know the benefits of his products – he also gives them a sense of relationship which brings them back again and again. However, he doesn’t want to stop where he is with his venture.

Murodjon is seeking a loan of 800 USD to re-stock the merchandise in his store. We believe that Murodjon’s desire to excel in pleasing his customers will determine his further success and encourage new customers to buy from him.

loans.use: Purchasing of clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba Z. is 40 years old. She is married with two children. Matluba has a tailoring business. Her business is sewing traditional women's dresses. Her workmanship is very good and being still young, she has a good eye for design. She is very organized and has a good head for business. She has had this business for 22 years and has gained a lot of experience.

With her loan, Matluba will buy more material for sewing dresses. She smiles when asked what her dreams are for the future. She quickly replies that she plans to open a workshop, hire seamstresses, and expand her business. With her spirit, she will surely succeed.

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for sewing traditional dresses.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima G., forty-five, is a married woman with five children who are in high school. Alima lives with her family at Madina, a suburb of Accra in Ghana. She runs a small provisions store in her neighbourhood. She has been in business for twelve years. 

Alima buys her goods from wholesalers in the city. She says that she also supplies her products to food vendors in her community. Alima wants a bigger working capital. She desires to buy the goods in bulk whenever she travels to the city in order to save herself the expense of frequent trips. Alima is in a group called “Miracle”. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To procure provisions for re-sale

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.en:
Ilhom D. is 22 years old. Despite of his young age, he is already supporting his parents and has been working at baking “lepeshka”- traditional Tajik bread. He believes that this business is profitable and is not subject to seasonality. He gets up early and bakes lepeshka and bread so that people have the fresh bread on their tables for breakfast. All the input materials like flour, salt, yeast he purchases in the local market.

Now due to high demand, Ilhom wants to increase the number of his breads so he requests 1000 USD for a term of 12 months. The loan will be spent for purchasing flour and coal for baking the “lepeshka”. In future he is dreaming of opening his own workshop and with the profit, building his own house and family. Ilhom deeply appreciates the trust and support you give him.

loans.use: Purchasing flour wholesale for baking “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Oysanam

texts.ru: Ойсанам женщина 42 лет , мать шестерых детей.Муж работает шофёром маршрутного городского такси.Сама Ойсанам торгует на рынке сухофруктами.Кроме своего бизнеса она со своей семьёй занимается откормом и продажей скота.Ойсанам очень любит скот.В её отсутствии за скотом смотрит её старший сын. Для увеличения скота Ойсанам решила взять кредит.
texts.en:
Oysanam N. is a 42-year old mother of six. Her husband works as a mini-van cab driver. Oysanam sells dried fruit on the market. In addition to this business, she raises and sells cattle. Oysanam is very much fond of cattle. In her absence, her elder son tends to cattle. In order to purchase more cattle, Oysanam decided to apply for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to raise and sell cattle

loans.name: Tolib

texts.ru: Толиб Темиров очередной раз получает кредит на животноводство.Сотрудничает с Микроинвест с 2007 года. Ему необходима эта сумма также на покупку жмых (корм скота).  Толиб купит несколько голов скота по дешевой цене, и продаст осенью подороже, что и приведет к увеличению прибыли. Планирует  научить сына этому бизнесу, поэтому и хочет кредитоваться и в дальнейшем.
texts.en:
It's not the first time that Tolib T. has received a loan for cattle farming. He has been a Microinvest client since 2007. He needs a loan for buying fodder and more cattle at a lower price. He would resell this cattle at a profit in the fall. He plans to teach his son to do the same trade and he will apply for more loans in the future.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of livestock

loans.name: Abdugaffor

texts.ru:
Abdugaffor A. 1970 года рождения , женат имеет 2 детей. Жена домохозяйка, Абдугаффор торугет углем. Он торгует углем из дома. К нему приезжают купцы и закупают товар. Зимой был хороший спрос на уголь, теперь все закупают уголь, что бы печь  лепешки и другие мучные изделия. Сам он также печет лепешки и поставляет на рынок.  Уголь в основном закупают те  у кого есть кирпичные цеха, для сжигания  сырых кирпичей. 
Сотрудничает с Микроинвест  с 2006 года.
texts.en:
Abdugaffor A. was born in 1970. He is married and has two children. His wife is a homemaker. Abdugaffor sells coal. He works from home. Most of his customers have brick making ovens, and they come to Abdugaffor's place to buy coal. In the winter demand for coal was high; now everybody buys coal to bake bread and other flour-based food. Abdugaffor himself bakes bread and takes it to the market. Abdufaffor has been a Microinvest client since 2006. .

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of coal
